title: Developer
description:
Stockholm,Stockholm,Sweden
Job ID**766199**
Grow with us
**About this opportunity:**

  

Hardware Engineering strives to be the most competitive Radio Network R&D unit in the industry. We work in an agile set-up to develop and maintain competitive, high-quality Radio products which give our customer solutions securing future growth.


Control Software is part of the Hardware Engineering (EU HW) Radio within Business Area Networks (BNEW). We are based in Kista, Stockholm. We also have a close corporation with development of PEU Radio products in Ottawa, Beijing, Nanjing, Chengdu, Lund and Zagreb.


Control Software provides possibility to work with the latest technology within telecommunication development. We can offer a rich number of opportunities in an everyday learning, creative and challenging atmosphere where Kista, Stockholm, is our base but the world is our arena.


We provide the SW platform for radio products also known as the auxiliary control system (XCS). We organize in cross functional development teams, and we are involved in several activities at the same time. We are in an intense phase, due to 5G development, with many new products in the pipeline. There is a high pressure on quality, flexibility and understanding of HW and SW. It also means working with skilled colleagues in an inspiring environment.


We are now looking for a Developer to develop the auxiliary control system (XCS) for radio. Your role will include system design, SW design, trouble shooting in target environment and product documentation. Knowledge about Linux and SW close to HW is of high value.


Team has the end-to-end responsibility for developing and maintaining our Production System loops which are used for quality assurance, building, and delivering XCS products.

 **What you will do:**

  

* You will drive strategic technical leadership
* Develop and test high quality products
* Perform trouble shooting internally and on customer networks as well as handling customer support in general
* Drive continuous improvements of products and processes
* Develop competence in technical domain
* Execute continuous improvements of products and processes, bring up new SW platforms
* You will be given a more specific area of responsibility after becoming productive, and depending of interest

 **The skills you bring:**

  

* Education: MSc in engineering or similar
* Min years of experience: 5 years of relevant experience
* Domain experience: Linux and SW close to HW, systemization and trouble shooting, ASIC knowledge is benificial
* Experience from SW development in a Linux environment using e.g. GIT, Gerrit, Junit, Jenkins, Nexus, Bash/Shell, Artifactory
* Several years of experience working with C/C++ in an embedded environment
* Experience from designing and executing automated test scripts in Java, Python or similar.
* Product development knowledge and Product Lifecycle Management knowledge
* Ability to work with highly competent colleagues
* Being flexible and responding to change
* Delivering results and meeting customer expectations

 **Last date to apply: 1st June 2025**

**Why join Ericsson?**

  

At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**

title: Senior Android developer with a Design-Driven Mindset
description:
Looking for a job where you can actually make a difference? Paf isn’t your typical gaming company. We were started by the Red Cross, Save the Children, Public Health on Åland, and the Dagens Barn foundation.

  

We’re all about building something sustainable for the long run. All our profits go to charitable organizations that work to make society better.

### **JOIN OUR APP TEAM!**


We’re looking for a senior Android developer who’s got a good eye for design and a real curiosity and passion for modern Android development. In the App Team, you’ll be part of the journey to build apps for all 20 of our websites in 5 different countries. It’s a skilled and friendly team where everyone’s ideas count, and the mindset is open and collaborative.

### **THE ROLE**

  

In this role, we’re looking for someone who not only writes solid code, but also cares about how things look and feel. You’ll be involved in the whole development process, just like the rest of the team, but your main strength will be making sure the design is consistent and looks great all the way through. You’ll work closely with our UI and UX designers to create smooth, user-friendly experiences that look awesome.

#### **YOUR PROFILE**


You have at least 5 years of Android development experience, and are as passionate about design as you are about code.

**You also:**

* Have professional experience working with Kotlin and Jetpack Compose.
* Are skilled in Figma and understand good design principles.
* Willing to take on additional responsibility for the design of our Android apps.

**Bonus points if you also have experience with:**

* iOS development
* TypeScript
* AWS or other cloud platforms

 **We value practical experience over formal education. You’ll stand out if you demonstrate:**

* Strong communication skills.
* A team-oriented mindset.
* Independence and accountability.

#### **WE OFFER**

* A collaborative, flexible work culture prioritizing well-being.
* Occupational healthcare and insurance.
* A workplace that encourages individuality and personal growth.
* A strong focus on well-being and work-life balance - we avoid overtime unless absolutely necessary.
* Generous support for remote work setups and wellness, including coverage for your Wi-Fi and home office setup.
* Option to work abroad up to 3 months per year.

#### **PRACTICAL INFO**

* **READ BEFORE APPLYING**

  

To be eligible for this role, you **must** have:

* A **valid work permit** for working in Sweden.
* **Minimum** of three years of work experience in **Sweden**
* Fluency in English, both spoken and written.

 **Start Date:** As soon as possible, depending on notice period  

**Type**: Full-time, permanent with a 6-month probation  

**Location:** Flexible - 100% remote, hybrid, or based in our offices in Stockholm, Norrköping, or Mariehamn.  

**Application:** Only via our application form (GDPR compliance)  

**Recruitment Process:** Includes a programming test and technical interviews.

  

We review applications continuously and close the process once we find the right person. Don’t wait to apply!

title: Erfaren utvecklare till Softhouse i Luleå
description:
*På Softhouse befinner vi oss i en viktig fas på vår tillväxtresa och nu är vi på jakt efter fler utvecklare som vill ansluta till vårt kontor i Luleå. Vi brinner för ny teknik och gillar att utveckla, och utvecklas, tillsammans.*  

  

**Om Softhouse ‍**  

Inom Softhouse är vi ca. 300 medarbetare fördelade på våra 10 kontor och tillsammans levererar vi tjänster och mjukvara i världsklass. I Luleå är vi idag drygt 20 personer och du hittar oss i centrala lokaler på Kyrkogatan, med fin utsikt över Södra Hamn. Här möts du av trevliga kollegor som arbetar som enskilda specialister eller i sammansvetsade team för att erbjuda våra kunder bästa möjliga IT-kompetens. I Luleå finns även vårt team Neava Design Studio som ligger i framkant inom 3D-visualisering och Augmented Reality.

**Passar du i rollen?**  

Vi söker dig som är en erfaren utvecklare med ett intresse för de senaste trenderna inom mjukvaruutveckling. Vi ser gärna att du har bra koll på backend och Java-utveckling, men det är också ett plus om du trivs med att arbeta över hela stacken.  

  

För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du:

  

* Har flera års professionell erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling, gärna i en konsultroll.
* Har god kunskap inom system- och mjukvaruutveckling. Du behärskar Java men har också vana att navigera inom flertalet olika teknikstackar.
* Är en förtroendeingivande relationsskapare som har en lyhördhet för kunders behov och en vilja att erbjuda bästa möjliga mjukvarulösning.
* Drivs av att utvecklas och att dela dina kunskaper med kollegor.
* Kan uttrycka dig obehindrat på svenska och engelska.

  

**Vad du får hos oss**  

Här får du möjlighet att bli del av ett framåtsträvande bolag där du och din **work-life-balance** är i fokus. Utöver vårt generösa förmånspaket får du också:

* Möjlighet att påverka och bidra till företagets framgång, i en inspirerande arbetsmiljö med engagerade kollegor.
* En mix av spännande och utmanande uppdrag med allt från nyutveckling till förvaltning och vidareutveckling.
* Individuellt anpassad kompetensutveckling och aktiv kunskapsdelning med andra duktiga Softhouse-kollegor. Stämningen är öppen och prestigelös där vi delar med oss av kunskap och erfarenheter.
* Ett team som gillar att göra saker tillsammans för att förhöja vardagen.
* Ett värderingsstyrt bolag där vi alla känner igen oss i våra värdeord: Team, Enkelhet, Mod och Passion.

  

Låter det intressant? Vårt urval sker löpande, skicka in din ansökan!

title: Business Developer
description:
Hi there!  

How would you like to work with a world-class team and help disrupt the energy industry and the way consumers use energy and interact with utility companies?  

Eliq is looking for an entrepreneurial Business Development professional to take on a uniquely cross-functional role. You’ll blend the mindset of a consultant with the drive of a commercial lead, researching market opportunities, crafting compelling propositions, and opening new doors with utility partners. From analysis to outreach to boardroom-level presentations, you’ll be central to how we grow and deliver impact. **About the Role**
You will combine management consulting expertise, analytical skills, and hands-on sales execution. Your core objective is to identify, test, and deliver new ways of establishing relationships with utility companies across Europe. You will develop and present new propositions that leverage Eliq’s expertise, data, and products, with the ultimate goal of enabling the sales team to generate sales of the product.  

We are looking for an entrepreneurial individual who is equally comfortable presenting to C-level utility executives, conducting research and analysis to inform those presentations and reports, and engaging directly with highly targeted, new contacts to open doors.  

Most likely, your background is from management or strategy consulting, as a business analyst, or from a commercial role in the energy industry, or from building your own startup, but other backgrounds can still be considered. **Key Responsibilities:*** Identify and execute new ways to engage utility companies and build sales pipeline
* Conduct research and analysis to inform tailored propositions and presentations
* Deliver presentations and reports to C-level executives
* Design and run outreach initiatives to generate leads
* Collaborate with internal teams to refine sales strategies

 **Qualifications:*** Entrepreneurial mindset with a drive to take ownership and deliver results.
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret and present complex data.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills.
* Comfortable working in a fast-paced, evolving environment.
* Willingness to relocate to Gothenburg, Sweden, if currently based elsewhere.

 **Why join us?**

* The chance to shape and grow a business with a clear mission.
* Collaborative, innovative, and positive work culture.
* Competitive salary and benefits.
* Real impact in accelerating the energy transition.

 **About Eliq****:**
Eliq is a leading company in the energy insights space , serving 30+ utilities across 13 European markets. Founded in 2015, Eliq is a VC-backed business with approximately 40 employees, experiencing significant growth. We are dedicated to improving the way energy is used by making sense of the world’s energy data, enabling businesses to build digital energy products and users to avoid energy wastage. Join us in fast-tracking the planet’s transition to net zero.  

If you read this far, it is time to apply:  

We think you’re excited to work with a team that moves fast, takes risks, and comes to work every day excited about building a product that affects the lives of millions of people, while helping to accelerate the transition to clean energy. We would love to hear from you!
Our company primarily operates in English, as we are a diverse team made up of colleagues from various countries. We kindly ask that you submit your application with a CV in English.


Privacy Notice: Your personal data will be processed in accordance with our Privacy Policy. By applying for this position, you agree to the processing of your personal data as described. For more details, please review our full privacy policy.

title: Software Developer
description:
Stockholm,Stockholm,Sweden
Job ID**767803**
Join our Team
**About the Opportunity**

  

At Radio Products Sweden, we lead the Radio Network R&D industry with our innovative and excellent solutions. Our agile approach allows us to develop and maintain top-tier Radio products. Our vibrant workplace in Kista, Stockholm, fosters continuous learning and creativity, impacting the world. IV&C handles Radio System Integration, Verification and Certification. We seek a talented ReqMate Software Developer for Test Environment 2 within IVC to support Ericsson's success. This team develops, supports, and maintains test automation systems and tools for Environmental, Emission, and Performance verification of Ericsson's Radios and Base stations against 3GPP, FCC, ACMA requirements.

  

ReqMate is an Ericsson internal tool, which focuses on radio performance allocation for the whole radio requirements into radio blocks. ReqMate is now globally used by radio HW organization. We now have a small team working on its evolvement, technical supporting, and maintenance. Our team is dedicated to systemizing, crafting of performance allocation tool for Radio Units, with shared responsibility for all team tasks.  

If you are ready to embark on an exhilarating career journey with us, to become part of our innovative team!

 **What You Will Do**

* Work as a technical project manager, manage ReqMate roadmap, planning, and release.
* Work as a SW developer, contribute to development of Ericsson internal Performance Allocation Tool (ReqMate)
* Work as a UI designer, listen, collect current users’ feedback, and improve the current UI.
* ReqMate maintenance and support, including SharePoint, verification, report TRs, write manual, prepare training material.
 **The Skills You Bring**

* M.Sc. or B.Sc. in software computer science, electrical engineering or similar areas
* Min 5+ years of experience in SW/PjM/UI
* Experience in software development, technical project management
* Experience in C# coding, F# coding, MATLAB coding and UI design
* Good understanding of Radio HW architecture and Radio performance
* Fluent in spoken and written English
**Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**

title: Android Utvecklare
description:
**Om Doktor.se**


På Doktor.se omdefinierar vi det svenska sjukvårdssystemet genom att göra det mer tillgängligt, smidigt och effektivt – utan att kompromissa med kvalitet eller säkerhet. Vår unika hybridmodell, som kombinerar fysiska vårdcentraler med moderna digitala lösningar, har gjort oss till den största digitala vårdgivaren i Sverige, med miljontals konsultationer varje år. Vi är också stolta över att vara en av de mest populära arbetsgivarna inom vården.

 **Om rollen**


Som Android-utvecklare på Doktor.se får du frihet och ansvar att påverka produkter som verkligen gör skillnad. Våra produktteam har fullt ägarskap över sina initiativ – från idé till lansering – och du kommer att arbeta nära produktchefer, designers och andra utvecklare för att skapa innovativa lösningar som förbättrar vårdupplevelsen för miljontals användare.

 **Vad du kommer jobba med**

* Utveckla nya funktioner från idé till lansering i nära samarbete med ditt team.
* Bygga användarcentrerade gränssnitt i Material Design.
* Ansvara för att publicera i Google Play och kontinuerligt förbättra våra appar.
* Bidra till teamets utveckling genom att dela kunskap och samarbeta tvärfunktionellt.

  

**Vad du bidrar med**

* Du ska ha minst 5 års erfarenhet av Android-utveckling med gedigen förståelse av Kotlin och Android SDKer.
* Kunskap om ramverk som Hilt, Kotlin Coroutines och Retrofit.
* Erfarenhet av test-driven utveckling (TDD) och skriva enhets- och UI-tester.
* Kunskap om Android arkitektur och design patterns som MVI och MVVM.
* Kunna bygga gränssnitt med hjälp av Jetpack Compose och Material Design.
* Erfarenhet av modulär utveckling för att hantera komplexa kodbaser.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med backend APIer som REST.

  

**Vem vi söker**

* **Fokus på användarna:** Du har ett öga för detaljer och är van att balansera tekniska krav med användarens behov.
* **Senioritet:** Du har erfarenhet av att driva på utvecklingsarbetet, inte rädd för att komma med förslag på hur vi arbetar eller på projekten, och kanske har vart med i rekryteringsprocesser tidigare.
* **Nyfikenhet och utveckling:** Du är angelägen om att ständigt lära dig och utvecklas, både personligen och som en del av ett team, och du tycker om att hjälpa andra att göra detsamma.
* **Samarbete:** Du trivs i en agil, teamorienterad miljö och har utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter.
* **Du brinner för teknik som gör skillnad** och vill använda teknik för att lösa riktiga problem och förenkla människors vardag.
* **Språk:** Vi kommunicerar huvudsakligen på engelska inom Tech-avdelningen, men förmågan att kommunicera på svenska med personer utanför Tech är en stor fördel.

  

**Vad vi erbjuder**

* **Anställningsform**: Tillsvidareanställning med inledande provanställning.
* **Förmåner**: 30 dagars semester, ITP1-pension, friskvårdsbidrag och utbildningsbidrag.
* **Hybrid/Flexibilitet**: Vi jobbar på kontoret fyra dagar i veckan, valfritt hemifrån på fredagar eller vid behov.
* **Arbetsmiljö**: Ett samarbetsinriktat team och ett modernt kontor på Sveavägen 63 i Stockholm.
* **Personlig utveckling:** Möjligheter att arbeta på meningsfulla projekt som påverkar miljontals människor. Med fokus på din personliga och professionella utveckling stödjer vi dig via coaching och möjlighet att vidareutbilda dig.

  

**Ansökningsprocess**

* **Startdatum:** Så snart som möjligt, med hänsyn till uppsägningstid.
* **Urval:** Rekryteringsprocessen är pågående, och om din profil stämmer överens med våra behov, kommer vi att kontakta dig omgående.
* **Bakgrundskontroll:** Innan anställning kräver vi ett utdrag ur belastningsregistret och ID/passkontroll.
* **Sekretess:** På grund av GDPR accepterar vi inte e-postansökningar.
* **Visum/flytt -sponsring:** För denna roll krävs att kandidaten redan har arbetstillstånd och bor i Sverige.
* **Byråer/Konsulter:** Vi avböjer vänligen alla rekryteringsförfrågningar från byråer och konsulter samt jobbsajter.

  

**Var med och revolutionera vården!**


Med miljontals registrerade användare och stark tillväxt år efter år leder Doktor.se tillsammans med våra varumärken Doktor24 och Kollarna vägen inom digital och fysisk vård.


Kom och hjälp oss förbättra vårdupplevelsen i Sverige!
company_description: På Doktor.Se vill vi göra saker annorlunda. Vi vill utmana och förändra en hel bransch.

title: Senior Baseband Developer
description:
Stockholm,Stockholm,Sweden
Job ID**764685**
Join our Team
**About this opportunity:**


Are you ready to shape the future of 5G?  

  

Within the L1 Software Development team in the Product Engineering Group RU Baseband Software, we are dedicated to designing and implementing Physical Layer Baseband functions for our Radio products. Our goal is to maintain Ericsson’s leadership in the market by delivering cutting-edge L1 solutions across diverse deployment scenarios, frequency bands, radio platforms and 3GPP/ORAN standards.  

  

We are currently looking for a L1 Software Developer to join our outstanding team in Kista. In this role, you’ll be working on our 5G/6G RAN L1 Software product, playing a key role in ensuring its performance and success.  

  

Join us at the forefront of wireless innovation!  

  

**What you will do:**


As a member of the L1 team, you’ll shape system architecture, implement key features, and ensure high-performance deployment. Your focus will be on the Physical Layer (L1) components of Baseband software—core building blocks of our leading 5G RAN solutions and future 6G technologies.

* Collaborate with engineers to design/systemize, develop, and maintain software components essential to product functionality.
* Enhance existing features and develop new ones, with a focus on performance, scalability, and reliability—leveraging Ericsson’s evolving Multi-Core Architecture Platform.
* Participate in code reviews, testing, and quality assurance activities.
* Troubleshoot and resolve software issues to ensure seamless operation.
* Stay current with industry trends and best practices, applying new knowledge to improve product innovation.
* Work within a dynamic, agile development environment to meet timelines and goals.

  

  

**Skills You Bring:*** Master’s degree (or equivalent) in Electrical Engineering, Software Engineering, Computer Science, Wireless Communications, or a related field.
* 5+ years of experience in embedded software development, ideally in telecom or a related industry Passion and interest in design, continuous learning, and technical excellence.
* Proficiency in C/C++ and a solid and proven expertise in embedded software design.
* Expertise in multi-core architectures and real-time systems.
* Domain knowledge in wireless communications, especially in signal processing, 4G/5G NR Physical Layer functions (highly desirable).
* Strong collaboration skills – thrive in international, multi-site teams; open communicator with a proactive, can-do attitude.
* Comfortable in fast-paced, agile environments; committed to delivering high-quality software on time.
* A drive for innovation – proactive mindset for continuous improvement in development practices.
**Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**

title: Developer
description:
Linköping,Östergötland,Sweden
Job ID**756770**
Grow with us  

About this opportunity

  

  

Start your career with us! Whether you're just starting out or are on the verge of launching your career, you've come to the right place. Product Engineering Group RAN Services, PEU-RS, is a unit at Ericsson which is at the forefront of 5G development and applies innovative technology such as Cloud and Artificial Intelligence.

  

This job offers an exciting future where you as a next generation developer will work in a team responsible for the large-scale software products they develop, from early phases of ideas and drafts – all the way to customer delivery. It gives great opportunities to develop your knowledge within the field in a creative environment with stimulating tasks where one can make a difference.

  

What you will do  

  

* Design and review software based on requirement specifications for the 5G software product using mainly C++ in a Linux environment.
* Participate as a dedicated team member in everyday teamwork and collaborate closely with your colleagues in a global environment.
* Work end-to-end; participate in pre-design activities, document your work, and follow your work all the way to customer activities.
* Handle customer feedback and fix bugs.
* Analyze, design, and implement product improvements to secure long-term quality and architecture for our software products.
  

Join our Team  

You will bring  

  

* Proficiency in programming languages such as C/C++
* University education in e.g. M.Sc/B.Sc in computer science/IT/electrical engineering or equivalent experience.
* Ability to communicate effectively in written and verbal English.
* Because of the level of collaboration both within and outside your team, good communication skills and a positive team-oriented attitude is essential.
* An interest in developing your personal qualities and deepening your knowledge and career with us.
* Advantage for this position: Knowledge in Telecommunication, Cloud, Machine Learning, Agile ways of working.
  

Why join Ericsson?

  

At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.

  

Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Experienced Telecom Software Developer
description:
We seek a highly skilled and experienced Telecom Software Developer to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in telecom, particularly in baseband ULPHY development.
