title: Senior Solution Architect
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 We are seeking an experienced Solution Architect who will be responsible for the architecture of POS solutions, ensuring alignment with enterprise architecture standards and advancing the architecture toward the target state.
   

  

 In addition to the above, your role will involve:
   

  

* Defining a shared technical and architectural vision focused on creating technical alignment for the full solution rather than concerns for specific components.
* Reviewing, analyzing, developing and facilitating stakeholder understanding of business and technology implications of future direction, roadmaps and implementation plans.
* Creating architectural design to guide and contextualize solution development across initiatives that align with business and IT goals.
* Providing necessary leadership, analysis and design tasks related to the development of technology solutions to ensure that solutions meet business needs and align with architectural governance and security standards.
* Identifying interdependencies and using ‘holistic thinking’ to ensure a cross-team perspective. Provide consulting support around solution architecture to teams to ensure a product is aligned with the overall enterprise architecture.
* Translating business and technical requirements into architectural blueprints and documenting all solution architecture design and analysis.
* Evaluating and driving continuous improvement, reducing technical debt, and enhancing end-to-end business value.
* Taking ownership and responsibility of current solutions and flows and ensuring secure and stable operations with a good focus on resolving recurring problems to the root cause.


**Who You’ll Work With**
 In our Unit, you’ll work with a dynamic team and oversee the integration and customization of several vendor-provided POS systems which impact 4000+ stores across 60+ countries.
   

  

 We frequently collaborate with our vendors, business, and internal tech stakeholders from various departments.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 We are looking for people with…
   

  

* Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
* 8 - 10 years’ experience working in multiple software engineering-related roles, whereof 5+ years’ experience in a Solution Architecture capacity.
* Experience in working with all components of a holistic enterprise architecture (business, process, information, technology).
* Exposure to multiple, diverse technologies and processing environments.
* Solid understanding of modern development practices, technologies and software architecture including patterns and principles.
* Exceptional problem-solving, communication, and leadership skills.
* Proven experience from documenting and communicating architecture and experience in tools like Jira, confluence etc.
* Proven experience in designing solutions using patterns, following best practices etc. to comply with non-functional requirements.
* Experience working with POS is a merit.


 And people who have:
   

  

* Strong communication skills, with the ability to effectively convey complex technical concepts to a range of stakeholders.
* Experience in story exploration and refinement.
* Ability to troubleshoot independently and drive solutions to completion.
* Collaborative and willing to share knowledge with the team to foster a supportive learning environment.


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

 In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.
   

  

**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.

title: IT Systems Engineer
description:
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us— and let the world feel your work.**
**How You Will Make An Impact**
 As an IT Systems Engineer within our IT Engineering team, you will design and build backend services, integrations, and automations that power our internal IT infrastructure. You’ll play a critical role in enhancing employee productivity and security by streamlining processes between SaaS platforms, identity providers, and internal systems.
   

  

 Your focus will include developing robust integration services, implementing infrastructure as code (IaC), and building automation workflows for Identity and Access Management (IAM), HR systems, Mobile Device Management (MDM), and more.
   

  

 We work with services and technologies such as Okta, Google Workspace, Terraform, Kandji, Cisco Meraki, Slack, and a variety of HRIS systems—bringing them together through clean, well-documented, and secure APIs and workflows.
   

  

**What You Can Expect To Work On**
**Automation & Integrations**
* Design and build internal services and integrations between platforms like Okta, HR systems, MDM, Google Workspace, and ticketing systems.
* Develop secure and maintainable backend APIs and automation workflows.
* Implement event-driven or scheduled synchronization processes for data consistency between systems (e.g., HR → IAM).


**Infrastructure as Code**
* Develop and manage IaC templates using Terraform to provision infrastructure and manage SaaS configurations.
* Support the IT Engineering team in building reproducible and scalable systems and environments.


**DevOps & Internal Platforms**
* Create tools, scripts, and microservices to automate common IT tasks (user provisioning, group management, access reviews).
* Implement CI/CD pipelines for infrastructure and automation code.
* Monitor, test, and improve the reliability and performance of internal automation services.


**Collaboration & Documentation**
* Work closely with IT Operations, Security, and People teams to understand business needs and translate them into robust technical solutions.
* Document APIs, workflows, and system architecture clearly for internal use and compliance.


**In order for you to thrive in this role, we believe that you have:**
* A software engineering or integrations background with experience building backend services or integrations.
* Proficiency in one or more backend languages (e.g., Python, Go, etc.).
* Familiarity with REST APIs, webhooks, and authentication standards (OAuth, SAML, SCIM).
* Experience with IAM platforms (especially Okta) and HRIS systems (e.g., BambooHR, HiBob, Workday).
* Understanding of infrastructure-as-code using Terraform or similar.
* Practical experience with CI/CD tools and version control systems like Git.
* A security-first mindset when building internal tooling and integrations.


**Bonus if you also have experience with:**
* Building and maintaining Slack or email-based automation bots for IT workflows.
* Developing internal UIs or dashboards for visibility into system automation.
* Managing and integrating with MDM platforms like Kandji or Jamf.
* Experience with message queues or event-driven architectures (e.g., Pub/Sub, SNS/SQS).
* Familiarity with observability tooling (logging, metrics, alerting).


**Equal opportunity employer**
 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
   

  

**Application**
 Ready to make the world feel your work? Apply now by clicking the link below! We embrace a hybrid model but love collaborating in person, so we spend the majority of our time in the office.
   

  

**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.**

title: Junior IT-tekniker för kortare period | Stockholm | Experis
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
Har du ett IT-intresse och lätt för att lära dig nya saker? Tycker du om att arbeta i grupp med andra? Experis söker nu flera juniora IT-tekniker. Är du vass på datorer och IT samt är ute efter en ny utmaning? Sök redan idag!🚀
   

  

 Arbetsbeskrivning
   

  

 I den här rollen kommer du att få möjlighet att arbeta som junior IT-tekniker. Du kommer att delta i ett flyttprojekt där du tillsammans med dina kollegor ser till att arbetsplatser och kringutrustning fungerar som det ska. Kontorsplatser med skärmar och tillhörande utrustning ska plockas ned och förflyttas, samt installeras på ny arbetsplats. Som IT-konsult hos oss på Experis öppnas dörren till en värld av utveckling, utmaningar och en gemenskap där din huvudsakliga uppgift är att vara räddaren i nöden för dina kollegor när det gäller IT-relaterade utmaningar.
   

  

 Din arbetsdag blir som en resa genom IT-landskapet där du navigerar genom teknikmiljöer och kringutrustning. Ditt engagemang är avgörande för att lösa tekniska problem och se till att arbetsdagen flyter smidigt för alla.
   

  

 Uppdraget gäller under följande perioder:
   

  

 Uppsala v.34-35
   

  

 Stockholm v.46-48
   

  

*Kan du inte båda tidsperioderna?* 
 Givetvis är det fördelaktigt, men se det inte som ett hinder! 🚀
   

  

 Nyfiken på att veta mer? Ta kontakt med Vilma Andersson, så berättar vi gladeligen vilka vi är!
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Gymnasial relevant utbildning
* Övergripande kunskap om datorer, kringutrustning, operativsystem, nätverk och informationssäkerhet
* Kunskaper i Microsoft Office eller likvärdigt
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift


 Vem är du?
   

  

 Vi tror att du är en flexibel och ansvarstagande person med ett genuint teknikintresse. Noggrannhet och serviceanda är dina ledord, och du tycker om att kommunicera med människor i alla lägen. Det viktigaste för oss är att du bär med dig en positiv inställning, driv och vilja att utvecklas!
   

  

 Om Experis
   

  

 Experis är ett ledande, globalt konsultbolag inom IT/Tech med över 600 konsulter på uppdrag i Sverige och 22 000 konsulter runt om i världen. Via Experis får du tillgång till en stor variation av spännande uppdrag hos våra intressanta kunder inom både privat och offentlig sektor. Du kan anta uppdrag genom ditt eget bolag eller som tillsvidareanställd konsult. På Experis blir du en i teamet och får tillgång till ett brett nätverk av kollegor inom ditt kompetensområde.
   

  

 På Experis får du en personlig konsultchef och kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling så att du kan hålla dig ajour med ny teknik. Experis, som är en del av ManpowerGroup, har ett långsiktigt hållbarhetsarbete (Working to change the world - ESG strategy) med målsättningen att bidra till att lösa kompetensbristen av bland annat IT-resurser.
   

  

 Vi på Experis är ett värderingsstyrt bolag, och allt vi gör genomsyras av våra värderingar People, Knowledge och Innovation.
   

  

**People |** 
 Vi inkluderar och välkomnar alla oavsett roll, funktion eller ansvar. Vi värderar kompetens och har förtroende för att individen tar eget ansvar och levererar inom ramen för sin rollbeskrivning. Vi är prestigelösa och vårt arbetsklimat bygger på öppenhet och trygghet.
   

  

**Knowledge |** 
 Vi har ett "growth mindset" och håller oss relevanta på marknaden genom att ständigt förflytta och höja vår egen kompetens, våra konsulters samt våra lösningar/erbjudanden.
   

  

**Innovation |** 
 Vi vågar testa nytt och misslyckas. Det kräver mod. Vi har ett utifrån och in-fokus och arbetar hela tiden med värdeskapande aktiviteter för våra målgrupper.
   

  

 Vad kan vi erbjuda dig?
   

  

 På Experis är vi stolta över våra konsulter och tillsammans hittar vi rätt utmaningar för dig. Vi har höga förväntningar på dig, men i gengäld erbjuder vi dig goda utvecklings- och karriärmöjligheter. Förutom möjligheten att utveckla dina kunskaper ute på spännande uppdrag erbjuds du provanställning enligt kollektivavtal, marknadsmässig månadslön, reglerad semester och semestersättning, friskvårdsbidrag, tjänstepension och försäkring, samt många andra förmåner - precis som det alltid ska vara.
   

  

 Gör Experis till din nästa destination!
   

  

 Har du fått upp ögonen för denna möjlighet? Kontakta Vilma Andersson på mailadress vilma.andersson@se.experis.com för att höra mer om vad vi har att erbjuda! Vi är bara ett samtal bort från din nästa utmaning.
   

  

 Vänta inte, låt IT-äventyret börja! 🚀

title: Objektledare IT
description:
Verksamhetsstödets uppgift är att stödja universitetets utbildning och forskning. KTH:s verksamhetsstöd är inne i en spännande fas där vi tillsammans arbetar med utveckling av våra arbetsformer. Som medarbetare inom verksamhetsstödet bidrar du till KTH:s uppdrag att forska, utbilda och skapa samhällsnytta och får samtidigt möjlighet till egen professionell utveckling.
   

  

 Inom KTH finns flera digitaliseringsportföljer: Utbildning, Forskning, Ledning, Infrastruktur och IT. Några portföljer har redan väletablerade uppdrag, medan andra är i spännande etableringsfas för att bygga en stabil och effektiv grundstruktur. Det här är ett unikt tillfälle att bli delaktig i att forma och utveckla strukturer för digitalisering som stärker KTH:s ledande position inom utbildning och forskning.
   

  

 Denna rekrytering avser rollen som Objektsledare IT för objekten Driftsmiljö och Digital Arbetsmiljö vilket är två objekt med tätt samarbete mellan enheterna "Drift och Infrastruktur" och "Systemförvaltning och Utveckling".
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
 Som Objektsledare IT arbetar du i nära samverkan med verksamhetens objektsledare. Rollen innebär ett nära samarbete för att säkerställa optimal integration med verksamhetens behov och mål.
   

  

**I nära samverkan med verksamhetens objektsledare ansvarar du för:**
* Verkställande av objektets årsplan
* Utformning och underhåll av en treårig planeringshorisont
* Säkerställande av tydliga mål och effektiv arbetsfördelning inom objektorganisationen


**Ditt ansvarsområde innefattar vidare:**
* Styrning, ledning och uppföljning av objektets aktiviteter kostnadseffektivt och strukturerat
* Säkerställande av tillgänglighet och funktion hos IT-komponenter och tekniska samband enligt avtalade servicenivåer
* Efterlevnad av lagar, regelverk och interna riktlinjer
* Styrning och uppföljning av externa leverantörer enligt gällande avtal


**Vi erbjuder**
* En anställning på ett ledande tekniskt universitet som skapar kunskap och kompetens för en hållbar framtid
* Engagerade och ambitiösa kollegor samt en kreativ, internationell och dynamisk miljö


 Läs mer om hur det är att arbeta på KTH samt våra förmåner.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
**Krav**
* Relevant akademisk utbildning
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet inom någon typ av ledarroll på operativ nivå som exempelvis projektledare eller förvaltningsledare inom IT.
* Minst 5 års aktivt arbete inom områden som nätverk, klientplattformar, datacenter, virtualisering, fysisk infrastruktur och/eller lagringslösningar.
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av att arbeta med ekonomisk uppföljning.
* Erfarenhet av att utveckla, implementera rutiner, processer och arbetssätt.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska både i tal och skrift krävs för det dagliga arbetet.


**Meriterande**
* Högskoleutbildning eller motsvarande på minst 3 år
* Erfarenhet av att leda uppdrag enligt agila principer.
* Erfarenhet av att leda IT-portfölj, PMO, projektkontor eller motsvarande i stora organisationer.
* Erfarenhet av styrningsmodellen PM3.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i en processorienterad organisation (ITIL eller motsvarande).
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med strategier, mål, planer och uppföljning.
* Erfarenhet av behov-/kravanalys.
* Erfarenhet av arbete på högskola/myndighet.


 Vi kommer lägga stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper och söker dig som har en helhetssyn för både uppdraget, leveransen och personerna som jobbar i uppdraget. Du har goda ledaregenskaper och har lätt för att bygga relationer med personer i och utanför uppdraget. Att ha ordning och reda på planer, arbetssätt och uppdragets förutsättningar är givetvis grunden för en motiverande kultur och en effektiv leverans. Du ser utmaningar som möjligheter att växa och utvecklas.
   

  

**Fackliga representanter**
 Kontaktuppgifter till fackliga representanter.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Du ansöker via KTH:s rekryteringssystem. Du som sökande har huvudansvaret för att din ansökan är komplett när den skickas in. Ansökan ska vara KTH tillhanda senast sista ansökningsdagen vid midnatt, CET/CEST (CentralEuropean Time/Central European Summer Time).
   

  

 Om anställningen
   

  

 Anställningen gäller tillsvidare enligt avtal.
   

  

 Anställningen inleds med sex månaders provanställning.
   

  

**Övrigt**
 Strävan efter jämställdhet, mångfald och lika villkor är både en kvalitetsfråga och en självklar del av KTH:s värdegrund
   

  

 För information om behandling av personuppgifter i samband med rekrytering.
   

  

 Det kan förekomma att en anställning hos KTH är placerad i säkerhetsklass. Om så är fallet för just denna anställning görs en säkerhetsprövning av sökande i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) efter samtycke. I dessa fall är en förutsättning för anställning att sökande blir godkänd efter säkerhetsprövning.
   

  

 Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt försäljare av platsannonser.
   

  

 Om KTH KTH är ett av Europas ledande tekniska universitet och en viktig arena för kunskapsutveckling. Som Sveriges största universitet för teknisk forskning och utbildning samlar vi studenter, forskare och fakultet från hela världen. Vår forskning och utbildning omfattar såväl naturvetenskap som alla grenar inom teknik samt arkitektur, industriell ekonomi, samhällsplanering, historia och filosofi. Läs mer här
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidare med provanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: PA-2025-0988 | Kontakt: Fredrik Julin, Gruppchef, fjul@kth.se , | Publicerat: 2025-05-22 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-08-12

title: Technical Service Field Professional
description:
We currently offering an exciting opportunity to join the Brady Europe Middle East & Africa team as a
 



  





**Technical Service Field Professional (m/f), based in Stockholm (Kista)** 
 .
 



  





 As Technical Service Field Professional, you will be the primary point of contact for our clients. In this role, you will be responsible for repairing, servicing and installing of our equipment at customer sites. The position is based in Stockholm with up to 60% of the role involving travel to various customer locations across Sweden.
 



 The role reports to the Regional Field Lead, and you will work closely with customer service and sales teams to ensure customer satisfaction and efficient service delivery. This will involve regular interaction with cross-functional teams to support clients' needs and contribute to a smooth operational process. You will also collaborate with colleagues in our Danish office to support the Nordic region and the Baltics.
 



  





**Your tasks** 



* Provide onsite technical support, including repairs, service, installations, training, and troubleshooting.
* Assist the Solutions and Repair Teams with their daily activities when based in the office
* Take responsibility for customer follow-up, collaborating with the sales representative in case of conflicts or disagreements to ensure customer satisfaction.
* Organize and plan field interventions efficiently to ensure smooth operations.
* Use and adhere to administrative tools and procedures to maintain consistent serviced standards.
* Liaise with suppliers regarding technical issues or product improvements to provide optimal solutions for our customers.
* Identify sales or service opportunities during customer interactions and effectively communicate potential leads.
* Help the Solutions Team provide phone assistance to our clients.



  





**Profile** 



* Completed technical vocational training in a relevant field (e.g., engineering, IT, electronics) or a Bachelor's degree.
* Practical experience in industrial equipment or repair, ideally gained over several years.
* Strong technical skills and a quick learner with interest in modern technologies (e.g., Arduino, 3D printing)
* Customer-oriented mindset with the ability to gather and apply feedback to improve solutions
* Excellent time management, prioritization, and problem-solving skills
* Team player with strong communication abilities and a constructive approach to conflict resolution
* High level of self-motivation, composure under pressure, and commitment to continuous personal development
* Excellent command of Swedish and fluent in English; Norwegian/Danish is a plus
* Willingness to travel locally up to 60% (approx. 3 days/week)



  





**We offer** 



* International, growth-oriented company with stable structures and attractive working conditions
* Professional and respectful work environment with a strong team spirit
* Demanding and responsible tasks with room for initiative and professional development
* Competitive compensation package including a company car also available for private use, and a structured onboarding process
* Opportunity to contribute your expertise and actively shape processes in a dynamic environment



  





**About us** 




 Brady Corporation is an international manufacturer and marketer of complete solutions that identify and protect people, products and places. Brady's products help customers increase safety, security, productivity and performance and include high-performance labels, signs, safety devices, printing systems and software. Founded in 1914, the Company has a diverse customer base in electronics, telecommunications, manufacturing, electrical, construction, medical, aerospace and a variety of other industries. Brady is headquartered in Milwaukee, Wisconsin employing approximately 5,700 people in its worldwide businesses. Brady's fiscal 2022 sales were approximately $1.30 billion

title: Implementation Specialist
description:
Intric is accelerating its growth, driven by a fresh round of funding from investors and strong demand from both existing and new customers.
   

  

 Our platform - Intric.ai - is currently transforming how work is done, primarily within the public sector and companies valuing data sovereignty, by making the power of AI accessible to a wider audience. We have secured a market-leading position in a niche of this segment.
   

  

 We are seeking a motivated individual eager to embark on the journey of a lifetime with our expanding and driven team.
   

  

**Your role**
 As an Implementation Specialist, you will be at the forefront of ensuring our customers make the most of our innovative platform. Your role is not just about understanding our customers and their needs but also about communicating how our platform can enhance these processes. You'll be key in engaging, educating, and inspiring users to fully leverage our technology.
   

  

**Who You Are**
* Socially and educationally adept. You excel in communicating ideas and concepts simply and persuasively, helping users understand and embrace our platform's potential.
* Service-oriented. With a positive, pedagogical approach, you ignite enthusiasm in customers, guiding them through their projects and inspiring further applications of our platform.
* Technologically savvy. You are a quick learner when it comes to using technology, and usually catch on to new systems and ways of working quickly.
* Perceptive and curious. You are interested in our customers businesses, and quickly understand new processes and workflows. You will be collaborating with experts in their fields to extract essential information leading to the most value creating implementation.


**Key Responsibilities**
* Engaging and educating. Communicate the value and functionality of our platform effectively to users, ensuring they are not just informed but inspired.
* Facilitating integration. Leverage your understanding of the capabilities of AI and our platform, in order to help organizations seamlessly integrate it into their day.
* Cultivating enthusiasm. Create excitement around projects, motivating users to explore new applications of our platform.
* Process Analysis. Deeply understand diverse business processes to identify and implement efficiency opportunities.


**What We Offer**
* An opportunity to be a part of building a system and company that defines the future
* Rapid career development in an exciting, fast-moving sector
* Competitive compensation package combining salary and stock options


 If you thrive on educating and inspiring others, and you're ready to make a significant impact with our growing company, we would love to hear from you!

title: Industrial Network & Cybersecurity Architect
description:
Join Our Team: Seeking a Industrial Network & Cybersecurity Architect
   

  

 The energy transition is accelerating, and battery energy storage systems are at the heart of making it work. At Capture Energy, we’re building the infrastructure to support a smarter, more flexible, and secure electricity system — and we’re looking for an experienced
 **Industrial Network & Cybersecurity Architect** 
 to join us on that mission.
   

  

 Founded in 2023, Capture Energy is a fast-growing company with 31 team members across the Nordics. Our ambition is to lead the Nordic and European market in battery energy storage — an area experiencing rapid growth as grids decarbonize and electrification surges.
   

  

 As a small but agile team, we do things differently. That means fewer silos, faster decisions, and more room for meaningful impact. We bring good energy to everything we do — from the systems we deliver to the people we work with.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are currently seeking to hire a Industrial Network & Cybersecurity Architect to join our dynamic team. This opportunity is ideal for a candidate who is not only responsible and independent but also has a driven mindset. You’ll be joining our Automation team, working with the in-house developed
 **Capture Controller** 
 — the brain behind our battery energy storage systems. You’ll play a key role in strengthening our capabilities in network architecture and cybersecurity as we scale. This role is central to ensuring our systems are secure, robust, and ready for the future.
   

  

 Work assignments and Key responsibilities
 **2. Cybersecurity Strategy & Implementation** 
**3. Delivery Support & Project Involvement** 
**4. Cross-Functional Collaboration** 
**5. Supplier & Partner Coordination** 
**6. Continuous Improvement & Monitoring**
- Network Architecture & Design

- Design, document, and maintain secure network architectures for industrial energy systems (OT), including site-level and system-level topologies.

- Define best practices for segmentation, remote access, firewalling, and industrial protocol handling (e.g. Modbus, MQTT, OPC UA, IEC 104, IEC 61850).

- Define and enforce security standards for both OT and IT environments, including threat modeling, access control, patch management, and intrusion detection.

- Guide implementation of cybersecurity measures aligned with industry standards (e.g. IEC 62443, ISO 27001, NIS2).

- Participate early in new customer projects to ensure secure and robust network and system configurations from day one.

- Support commissioning and validation of secure connectivity for energy sites.

- Work closely with the automation, software, and product teams to define secure interfaces between cloud, control systems, and field equipment.

- Act as internal advisor and educator on OT/IT security for engineering, operations, and delivery teams.

- Evaluate and advise on network and security aspects of third-party equipment and supplier integrations (e.g. aggregators, SCADA platforms, routers).

 Develop secure integration patterns for partners and remote access solutions.
 - Develop internal processes for network and security audits.

- Stay ahead of cybersecurity trends, vulnerabilities, and regulatory developments relevant to BESS and critical infrastructure.

**Skills And Qualifications**
* Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Industrial IT, or equivalent hands-on experience
* 5+ years of experience in industrial network design and/or OT cybersecurity
* Solid understanding of OT/ICS cybersecurity frameworks (e.g. IEC 62443, ISO 27001) and secure network architecture
* Familiarity with industrial communication protocols (Modbus, MQTT, OPC UA, IEC 104, IEC 61850)
* Experience with firewalls, VPNs, and segmented network configurations in industrial environments
* Background in energy systems, critical infrastructure, or automation (e.g. SCADA, substations, BESS) is a strong plus
* Strong collaboration skills and ability to work cross-functionally with engineering, product, and delivery teams


**Why Join Us?**
 At Capture Energy, you’ll join a passionate and collaborative team driving the energy transition forward. We offer an environment that values initiative, encourages learning, and supports your professional growth. As a fast-growing company, we believe our people are our greatest strength — and we’re committed to making sure every team member feels empowered, appreciated, and inspired.
   

  

**We offer**
* A purpose-driven and people-focused workplace
* Competitive salary
* Generous wellness allowance to support your health and lifestyle
* Comprehensive pension and private health insurance


 Application Process
   

  

 If you believe you have the responsibility, independence, and drive we are looking for, please submit your CV and a covering letter detailing your suitability for the role. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you and possibly welcoming you to our team.
   

  

**About The Company**
**Capture Energy, founded in 2023, is on a mission to become a leading provider of large-scale battery energy storage systems (BESS).**
 What sets us apart is our end-to-end approach — we support our clients throughout every stage of their BESS projects. This is made possible by our advanced in-house technologies — the
 **Capture Controller** 
 and
 **Capture Cloud** 
 — as well as our experienced team of experts who bring deep industry knowledge and hands-on execution to every project.
   

  

 Visit our website for more information: www.captureenergy.eu

title: Systemutvecklare Windows
description:
**Vad Vi Erbjuder Dig**
 Hos SVT får du en varierande och händelserik vardag samtidigt som du arbetar på ett av Sveriges mest kända varumärken!
   

  

 Här väntar ett team med en familjär känsla som ständigt lär av varandra. Du kommer också att få vara med i spännande initiativ och projekt för att SVT ska bli framgångsrik i sin fortsatta digitaliseringsresa.
   

  

**Vem Vi Tror Att Du Är**
 Du har eftergymnasial utbildning inom teknik/IT eller några års motsvarande erfarenhet från arbete inom infrastruktur.
   

  

 Du utrycker dig väl i tal och skrift och har en god socialförmåga. Du behöver ha en god samarbetsförmåga då arbetet innebär mycket samarbete och kontakter.
   

  

 Vi söker dig med stor drivkraft, nyfikenhet och en vilja att hjälpa till och bidra inom ditt område. Du trivs med ett omväxlande arbete och har en hög servicekänsla.
   

  

 Vi tror även att du gillar att jobba målstyrt och är bra på att ta egna initiativ. Du är en problemlösare som är bra på att analysera och lösa komplexa tekniska utmaningar.
   

  

**Vad Den Här Tjänsten Innebär**
 Du kommer att få jobba i ett team som består av totalt 12 personer - och där du kommer att jobba närmast 2 kollegor inom Windows. Teamet ansvarar för drift och förvaltning av vår windowsmiljö. Hosting är en självklar partner inom flera stora projekt, där vi med glädje stöttar med vår kompetens.
   

  

 Vi tror att för att lyckas inom rollen som Systemutvecklare inom Windows har följande erfarenhet:
   

  

* Djup förståelse för IT samt hur verksamhet och IT interagerar
* Microsoft Active Directory & Microsoft Entra ID
* Erfarenhet av komplex felsökning och problemlösning inom området
* Erfaranhet av ADLDS, ADFS
* Erfarenhet av Windowsserverdrift
* Erfarenhet av Publik Key Infrastructure (PKI)
* Erfarenhet av Hardware Security Module (HSM)
* Grundläggande erfarenhet av Microsoft SQL Server
* Tvåfaktorsautentisering, 2FA
* Single sign-on, SSO (SAML, OpenID Connect)
* Infrastrukturell förståelse av Active Directory
* Erfarenhet av arbete i stora organisationer, med höga krav på driftsäkerhet
* Grundläggande erfarenhet av Virtualisering
* ITIL


 Meriterande om du har en eller fler av nedanstående:
   

  

* God erfarenhet av scriptprogrammering i Powershell
* God erfarenhet av IT-säkerhet
* God erfarenhet av Infrastructure as code
* Erfarenhet inom automation
* Erfarenhet av att skapa/designa integrationsstrategier


**Hur Du Ansöker**
 Tjänsten finns i Stockholm och med tillträdesdatum snarast eller enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Svenskt medborgarskap är ett krav då tjänsten kan komma att placeras i säkerhetsklass.
   

  

 I den här rekryteringsprocessen använder vi oss av urvalsfrågor och CV i stället för att be om personligt brev. Det gör vi för att säkerställa att rekryteringen blir kompetensbaserad och effektiv och att vi får samma viktiga information av alla kandidater
   

  

**Annat Som Är Bra Att Veta**
 Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Alexandra Jonsson Gruppchef för Hosting via mejl alexandra.jonsson@svt.se
   

  

 Fackliga frågor besvaras av  Maria Nassikas Unionen, Jonas Ohlsson SJF och Fanny Lindhé SACO. Samtliga nås via växeln 08-784 00 00

title: Data Analyst
description:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks, and TV channels. We believe in the power of content not just as a way of telling stories and touching lives, but also expanding worlds.
   

  

 We’re looking for the best people to join us on our journey. Right now, we’re searching for a
 **Data Analyst** 
 in our
 **Stockholm** 
 office – are you ready to hit play on an exciting career change?
   

  

**The Role**
 As a Data Analyst at Viaplay Group, you will play a pivotal role in transforming complex data into actionable insights, enabling us to deliver exceptional experiences to our customers. By leveraging your analytical, visualization, and data modeling skills, you’ll inspire and lead the way toward a more data-informed business. Collaborating with diverse teams, you’ll be integral in evaluating trends, optimizing strategies, and supporting data-driven decision-making. Your expertise will help shape the future of Viaplay Group through enhanced user engagement, content performance, and operational excellence.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Data Analysis & Insights: Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights that drive business strategies and improve user experiences
* Collaboration: Work with cross-functional teams to bring the business closer to data by offering expertise, advice, and insights. Actively contribute to creating a data-informed culture across all levels of the organization
* Data Visualization: Build dashboards and reports with a strong focus on storytelling, making complex data easy to understand for stakeholders
* Strategic Impact: Partner with stakeholders to align data strategies with business goals, support roadmap decisions, and ensure appropriate tracking is in place for new initiatives
* Self-Service Analytics:Champion a self-service analytics culture across the organization, empowering teams to access, interpret, and utilize data independently
* Education & Communication: Lead and participate in data education initiatives to improve understanding and utilization of data tools and methodologies across the organization
* Process Automation: Identify opportunities for automation in data tracking, analysis, and reporting to streamline processes and improve scalability
* Documentation: Create standardized and accessible documentation to ensure clarity, reduce dependencies, and enable teams to operate autonomously


**What We’re Looking For**
 We understand you may feel confident ticking certain boxes more than others and that’s why we always keep an open mind in our recruitment process. But, in order to thrive in this role, we do believe you’ll have at least some experience in the following:
   

  

* Proven experience as a Data Analyst, demonstrating the ability to work independently and proactively drive change
* Strong knowledge of SQL and proficiency in visualization tools like Tableau or ThoughtSpot
* Expertise in data storytelling, with the ability to translate complex insights into clear, compelling presentations for technical and non-technical audiences
* A passion for setting up dashboards, KPIs, and reporting structures that inspire action and align with business goals
* A collaborative mindset, with the ability to build strong relationships and work cross-functionally
* A proactive approach to problem-solving, actively seeking new solutions and considering scalability in your work
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with a talent for making others enthusiastic about data


**It’s a bonus if you have:** 
  

  

* Experience with analytical engineering or tools like Databricks
* Background in the streaming or media industry
* Experience working with data from finance or marketing teams


 What we offer you
   

  

* We’ve got you covered! 30 days of paid vacation every year, an attractive pension and insurance scheme, and generous parental leave pay lift.
* Your wellbeing matters. We provide you with various wellbeing initiatives including wellness allowance.
* A safe space to grow and up-skill. Our learning culture puts you in the driver’s seat of your own development.
* An innovative environment with Hack Days once a year. This week-long initiative allows you to think outside the box and deliver creative, technical solutions that (more often than not) go on to be implemented, either in our product or our ways of working.
* Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do. So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product – including serier & viewing events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more.


**Hit play** 
**today**
 If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here – you may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don’t send us your application via email because we won’t be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position.
   

  

 Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We’re only ever a few clicks away.

title: Design Engineer (trucks)
description:
The world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.
   

  

**Your role**
 As a Design Engineer, you will work with product development services towards our clients. As a consultant at Capgemini Engineering, you will get the opportunity to work in different projects matching your experience, background, and interests.
   

  

*In this role you will play a key role in:*
* An important and central part of our cross-functional team and responsible for implementations and goals in our projects.
* In contact with our clients' organizations.
* The responsibility for the execution of your assignment from concept to finished product. You will either work in an in-house team or at the clients’ office where we do full-scale project deliveries.


**Your profile**
* 2+ years of experience in product development as a design engineer
* Experience from working with trucks
* Theoretical and practical knowledge from engineering design process
* Good skills in CAD, preferably CATIA V5
* Good knowledge in Geometric Dimensioning & Tolerancing
* Bachelor in relevant field
* Excellent writing and verbal English skills


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
* At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
* We support your personal development and offer an education library with more than 250 000 (!) courses and educations and certifications.


**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
   

  

 Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com

title: Business Intelligence Internship - Start hösten 2025
description:
Vill du vara med och forma framtidens datadrivna beslutsstöd?
   

  

 Till innovativa insurtechbolaget Allina, söker vi nu en nyfiken och teknikintresserad intern som vill bidra till utvecklingen av deras moderna BI-plattform i Microsoft Azure och Power BI. Har du ett brinnande intresse för dataanalys och vill lära dig hur man bygger skalbara och smarta analyslösningar i praktiken? Då är det här internshipet för dig – med start hösten 2025!
   

  

**Om Allina Försäkringar**
 Allina är ett svenskt insurtechbolag i stark tillväxt. Vi bygger digitala försäkringslösningar som skapar kundvärde och affärsnytta för våra partners där försäkringen integreras sömlöst i deras befintliga ekosystem.
   

  

 Vårt team består av branschexperter med djup kunskap inom både försäkring och marknadsföring. Vi stöttar våra partners med den kunskap och expertis de behöver för att lyckas. Vi tror starkt på värdet i att skapa försäkringslösningar under varje företags eget varumärke. Men vi tror också att varje företag har ett ansvar att bidra till en tryggare och mer hållbar framtid för kommande generationer. På Allina samarbetar vi med våra partners för att skapa just det.
   

  

**🔍
 **Vad får du göra?****
 Som BI Intern ansvarar du för att underhålla, förbättra och vidareutveckla vår befintliga business intelligence-plattform. Den används både internt och av våra partners och är en viktig del i vår digitala tjänsteleverans. Ditt arbete kommer bland annat att innebära att:
   

  

* Underhålla och vidareutveckla vår BI-plattform byggd i Microsoft Azure och Power BI
* Skapa och optimera dashboards och rapporter för olika interna och externa användningsområden
* Arbeta med datamodellering, integrationer och datakvalitet i Azure-miljö
* Bygga nya skalbara strukturer som gör vår plattform framtidssäkrad och enkel att vidareutveckla
* Vara en nyckelperson i att skapa datadrivna insikter både för oss och våra partners


**Vi söker dig som har**
* Kunskap inom Microsoft Azure och Power BI
* God förståelse för datamodellering, pipelines och plattformsarkitektur
* Förmåga att arbeta självständigt och proaktivt inom dataanalys och plattformsutveckling
* Erfarenhet av att utveckla skalbara lösningar och förståelse för hur man bygger för tillväxt
* En pågående eller nyligen avslutad utbildning inom t.ex. datavetenskap, systemvetenskap, statistik eller motsvarande
* God kommunikativ förmåga på svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift


**Vad vi erbjuder**
* Ett spännande och tekniskt utvecklande internship i ett snabbväxande insurtechbolag
* Möjligheten att bygga BI-lösningar på riktigt – som påverkar både våra interna team och våra externa kunder
* Flexibilitet i arbetstid och delvis distansarbete
* Ett engagerat och nytänkande team där din kompetens värdesätts
* Placering på vårt kontor i centrala Stockholm


**Frågor och kontakt**
 I denna process samarbetar Allina Försäkringar med Amendo Tech. Vid frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Kiara Bergqvist på kiara.bergqvist@amendotech.se. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

**Om Amendo Tech**
 Amendo Tech är det självklara konsult- och rekryteringsföretaget inom tech, IT och digital utveckling.
   

  

 Amendo Tech är en del av Amendo Group som har arbetat med kompetensförsörjning sedan 2001. I koncernen ingår även Lagotto Executive Search & Interim som är specialiserade på executive search och interima tillsättningar av ledare och specialister, samt Amendo Bemanning och Rekrytering som erbjuder rekryterings- och konsultlösningar inom ekonomi, bank, finans, försäkring, HR och kommunikation.
   

  

 Följ gärna Amendo Tech på Linkedin.
   

  

 #IT

title: System Manager - ERP & CRM
location: Upplands Väsby och Sollentuna, Stockholm County, Sweden
description:
**Culligan Nordic Group 🌍**
 Vi på Culligan Nordic är stolta över att vara en av Nordens största leverantörer inom vatten, kaffe och storkök. Vårt uppdrag är att vara det självklara valet för innovativa och hållbara vattenlösningar för den privata och offentliga sektorn i Norden, och vår målsättning är enkel - alla ska ha tillgång till rent dricksvatten samtidigt som vi minskar engångsförbrukningen av plast! På Culligan Nordic Group arbetar 365 anställda, spridda över Sverige, Norge, Danmark och Finland. Du känner igen oss på vårt höga kundfokus, pålitliga service och dedikation till miljövänlig & etisk handel.
   

  

**Tjänsten i korthet
 **🪄****
 Vill du vara med och forma en ny IT-organisation i en spännande nordisk koncern? Motiveras du av att förvandla dina kollegors visioner till effektiva tekniska lösningar? Då kan det här vara rollen för dig!
   

  

 Som System Manager hos Culligan Nordic Group ansvarar du för förvaltning och vidareutveckling av vårt ERP- och CRM-system, med stort eget ansvar och möjlighet att driva egna initiativ. Du samarbetar nära verksamheten och externa leverantörer för att skapa tekniska lösningar som stärker affären.
   

  

 Det här är en nyckelroll i vår nya IT-organisation, där du får stort eget ansvar och frihet att påverka. Du ansvarar för förvaltning, utveckling och stabil drift av vårt ERP-system Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations, samt successivt även vårt CRM-system SuperOffice. Här får du förverkliga idéer från sälj och ekonomi genom tekniska lösningar och arbeta tätt tillsammans med både interna nyckelpersoner och externa leverantörer.
   

  

 Du kommer att:
   

  

* Säkerställa förvaltning och vidareutveckling av Dynamics F&O och SuperOffice, i linje med vår förvaltningsmodell.
* Självständigt genomföra mindre systemändringar och konfigurering, samt leda större utvecklingsprojekt tillsammans med våra leverantörer.
* Samla in, analysera och dokumentera verksamhetskrav och översätta dem till tekniska lösningar.
* Delta i systemtester, förändringshantering och förbättringsarbete samt planera förvaltningsinsatser tillsammans med nyckelpersoner.
* Utveckla processer för systemförvaltning, livscykelhantering och dokumentation.
* Vid behov utbilda systemanvändare och skapa relevant utbildningsmaterial.
* Hantera integrationer, datamigrering och säkerställa datakvalitet inom dina system.


**Vi tror att du:**
* Har dokumenterad erfarenhet av förvaltning av Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations och kan självständigt genomföra mindre ändringar och konfigureringar.
* Har grundläggande kunskaper i databashantering (MS SQL) och erfarenhet av integrationer, gärna med PEPPOL och Synapse för PowerBI.
* Är nyfiken och vill lära dig vårt CRM-system SuperOffice.
* Har förståelse för informationssäkerhet och GDPR, och säkerställer att systemen följer dessa krav.
* Är van vid kravställning, drivs av struktur och är kommunikativ och serviceinriktad i ditt samarbete med både interna och externa parter.
* Har goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.
* Är självgående, har högt eget driv och trivs med att ta stort ansvar.


**Det är även meriterande om du:**
* Har tidigare erfarenhet av CRM-förvaltning.
* Har kunskap om Microsoft Fabric eller Dynamic Web
* Är bekant med ITIL-ramverket och dess tillämpning inom systemförvaltning.


 Vi erbjuder dig:
   

  

* En unik möjlighet att med stort inflytande vara med och bygga upp och forma en ny IT-organisation!
* En roll med stort eget ansvar och frihet att driva utveckling och förändring.
* En innovativ och ständigt växande arbetsplats, där du har engagerade kollegor i hela Norden och goda utvecklingsmöjligheter.
* Flexibla arbetssätt och möjligheten att arbeta delvis på distans.


**Plats** 
****📍****
 Tjänsten utgår från vårt svenska huvudkontor i Sollentuna, med möjlighet att jobba remote.
   

  

 💧Hos oss på
 **Culligan** 
 gör vi mer än att leverera vatten – vi skapar lösningar som förbättrar människors vardag, hälsa och miljö. Vill du vara med och göra skillnad på riktigt? Då kan det här vara din nästa utmaning.
   

  

 Har du frågor kring tjänsten? Kontakta amanda.westerberg@culligan.se.
   

  

 Vänligen notera att med hänsyn till GDPR tar vi inte emot några ansökningar via mail.
   

  

 Vi rekryterar löpande, och kommer att granska din ansökan så fort vi kan. Om din profil passar för tjänsten kommer vi att kontakta dig för ett första steg, och skulle just den här rollen inte vara en matchning för dig kommer du oavsett att höra från oss med ett svar.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Enterprise Architect – Marketing
description:
**Job Description**
 We at H&M Group, have a vision to liberate fashion for the many. Our
 **Enterprise Architecture team** 
 helps align and enable business and tech, provide holistic architecture direction and governance, balancing the long-term and the short-term. Using robust frameworks and best practices they support an effective and efficient tech delivery.
   

  

 To strengthen our team, we are now hiring more Enterprise Architects to further level up our support to business and tech in several areas.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 At H&M Group, our architecture landscape is divided into segments, here the
 **Marketing segment** 
 covers our
 **Marketing and Customer & Experience Management** 
 capabilities.
   

  

 As an
 **Enterprise Architect – Marketing** 
 , you will play a key role in shaping the future of our global MarTech and Customer & Experience landscape, ensuring alignment between business strategy and technological execution. You will work cross-functionally to define, optimize, and evolve our marketing technology landscape and help enable a seamless customer experiences across all touchpoints.
   

  

**You will:**
* Define and drive the Marketing and Customer & Experience technology architecture, ensuring alignment with business strategies and marketing transformation initiatives.
* Identify dependencies across business and technology capabilities, guiding stakeholders through necessary changes in process, information, and technology.
* Provide strategic guidance to stakeholders on investment decisions, evaluating risks, costs vs. benefits, and business impact.
* Shape and evaluate future initiatives, including new operating models and emerging technologies, applying innovations to optimize business and operating models.
* Analyze industry and market trends to identify opportunities and assess their impact on enterprise architecture.
* Develop and maintain architectural frameworks, standards, and best practices, ensuring alignment across teams and fostering architecture thinking within the engineering and delivery community.
* Oversee and facilitate architectural decision-making, ensuring the Marketing and Customer & Experience capabilities are positioned effectively within the enterprise landscape, with clearly defined business capabilities, target states, roadmaps, and guardrails.
* Collaborate with other architects and teams to design and implement key strategies, solutions, and current-state and transition architectures.


**YOU’LL WORK WITH**
 As an
 **Enterprise Architect** 
 , you will collaborate closely with architects across different architecture segments and areas of the organisation, ensuring seamless integration between Marketing, Customer & Experience, and the broader enterprise architecture. You will work alongside
 **Solution Architects,** 
 other
 **Enterprise Architects, and System Architects** 
 to define, optimize, and evolve our marketing technology landscape while ensuring alignment with enterprise-wide strategies.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 Your role will bridge marketing, customer engagement, and digital experience with other architectural segments, enabling a cohesive and scalable Marketing and Customer & Experience landscape that supports business objectives across all touchpoints.
   

  

*We are looking for people with..*
* A bachelor’s or master’s degree in engineering, computer science, technology, or a related field—or equivalent work experience. Certifications in Enterprise Architecture frameworks (e.g., TOGAF) are a plus.
* 15+ years of experience in software engineering, business technology, or related roles, including 10+ years in a Solution or Enterprise Architecture capacity.
* Deep technical knowledge in paid and organic marketing channel technologies, attribution modeling, and content optimization.
* Strong understanding of Loyalty programs, CRM, CMS, CDPs, social media, journey orchestration, and SEO tools.
* Familiarity with AI/ML applications in marketing and customer experience.
* Knowledge of Customer Service technologies (e.g., voice, chat, email, social messaging, in-store experiences) and their role in delivering exceptional customer support is a plus.
* Proven experience from working with business & tech stakeholders with documenting & communicating architecture using one or several formal notations using EA Tools such as LeanIX, showing multiple viewpoints and dimensions – e.g. process, capability, information, application, technology etc.
* Experience in architecture governance and formulating architecture principles, standards, guardrails etc.
* Experience in Data, AI & Automation architecture, designing for high-volume products for retail solutions


*And people who are..*
* Strategic visionaries, shaping the future-state architecture to support business growth.
* Collaborative partners, working across segments to ensure alignment and seamless integration.
* Analytical thinkers, who can assess complex systems and provide clear, actionable insights.
* Technology leaders, staying ahead of industry trends and emerging technologies to drive innovation.


**LOCATION:** 
 This is a
 **full-time position with a placement in STOCKHOLM, SWEDEN**
**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. Read more about us here
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

 All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

**Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.**

title: Google Cloud Platform Engineer | SEB, Solna
description:
*SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From Java to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone.*
 Join SEB’s Cloud Tribe and help shape the future of scalable, secure, and innovative products by advancing Public Cloud technologies. Take on this exciting challenge and make a real impact!
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a
 **Cloud Engineer** 
 within our Cloud Tribe, you will join a team of 25 highly engaged peers using new technology to develop and maintain services on top of Public Cloud Platforms catering for the platform’s technical Governance & Compliance. Work closely with operations, maintenance, and security of the platform. Our delivery includes guardrails, best practices, and supporting functionalities, all of which are paving the way for SEB’s developers to create a modern bank in the Clouds.
   

  

 As part of the Cloud Core Platforms, we offer a unique opportunity to be part of building the foundation of a paradigm change in banking. Being part of a multi-cloud tribe you will have the opportunity to gain skill and experience in multiple Public Cloud environments
 **.**
**To Thrive In This Position, We Believe You Have**
* Hands on experience with Google Cloud.
* Understanding other Cloud Platforms such as AWS and Azure.
* Experience with Infrastructure as Code (such as Terraform), automation and CI/CD
* Experience with TypeScript, Bash and Python.
* Understanding of logging, monitoring and observability platforms.
* Knowledge of Agile principles
* Motivation and eagerness to learn


**What We Offer**
* Entrepreneurial Scandinavian environment: work-life balance, international working environment, hybrid work model, empowering and welcoming culture
* Growth culture: extensive training and learning opportunities, local and international internal mobility possibilities, long-term stability
* Modern environment: innovative company in forefront of technology, challenging, cutting-edge work, excellent office environment, agile and modern ways of working
* Additional monetary benefits: paid seniority vacation and volunteering days, allocations to Your pension fund, profit sharing programme, and additional health insurance


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but no later than
 **May the 31st, 2025.**
**Learn more about working at SEB: Technology | SEB**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
**TL;DR**
 We want a data-obsessed engineer to build Lovable’s data and analytics muscle. You’ll work cross-functionally across all teams to empower everyone with the insights they need for data-driven decision making. Must combine serious coding skills with the ability to turn complex data into winning product bets.
   

  

**Why Lovable?**
* Change the world, literally: 2025 is the year AI works, and Lovable has the best AI full stack engineer product (according to industry veterans)
* Work, learn, have fun: We’re building the strongest technical team in Europe. You will shape our culture and be inspired in a place of exceptional talent density
* Build a unique network: Lovable is a global top AI brand that the world is eager to work with. You will meet and work with some of the most important people in tech
* Get autonomy & ownership: With lots of things being built, this is a unique opportunity to get ownership and have a true impact on our product
* Compensation: Lovable pays top of market cash and equity, and is committed to compensate better than any other company in Sweden on a performance basis


**What We’re Looking For**
* A strong engineer with serious data infrastructure chops
* 5+ years of experience building data platforms or 3+ years with startup experience
* Past experience building up data infrastructure and pipelines to dashboards, reports and insights
* Obsession with understanding why users do what they do
* Strong opinions about the best data platform tools
* Startup and ex-Founder experience is an asset, especially if you’ve built up the data platform from the ground up


**Your Responsibilities**
* Design, build and maintain scalable data pipelines and infrastructure
* Develop and optimize data models, warehouses and lakes
* Ensure data quality, reliability and consistency through validation and monitoring tools
* Work cross functionally across teams to ensure they are data-driven and can leverage your data system


**Our tech stack** 
 We're building with tools that both humans and AI love:
   

  

* Data: DBT Clickhouse, Apache Flink, Apache Beam, Apache Kafka, Apache Spark, Hadoop ecosystem, Dataflow, SQL engines
* Frontend: React for lightning-fast interfaces
* Backend: Golang and Rust for serious performance
* Cloud: Cloudflare, Fly.io, Google Cloud Run, AWS, Terraform
* And always exploring what's next


**How Applying Works**
* Fill in a short form
* Participate in 2 rounds of technical interviews
* Join us for 1-2 days of trial work on-site if possible. We'll see how you tick and you get to meet the team and explore whether joining Lovable feels right for you
* Share 3 references of supervisors you’ve previously worked with


**About Your Application**
* Please submit your application in English. It’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join.
* We treat all candidates equally - if you are interested please apply through our application system.

title: Android Developer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Job Description**
* Design and build a scalable, clean Android SDK using Kotlin
* Develop a lightweight interface that communicates with our BFF service
* Collaborate with backend engineers and frontend stakeholders
* Ensure strong performance, modularity, and testability from day one


**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* 5+ years of Android development experience
* Strong skills in Kotlin and native SDK architecture
* Experience building SDKs or libraries for third-party consumption
* Comfort working with API-driven, dynamic UI rendering
* A proactive, solutions-oriented mindset


**Application deadline:** 
 18-06-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Growth Engineer
description:
**TL;DR**
 We want a data-obsessed engineer to decode how our customers use Lovable and turn those insights into explosive growth. You'll create automated systems that predict user behavior, find a-ha moments, and tell us what to build next. Must combine serious coding skills with the ability to turn complex data into winning product bets (and help implement them).
   

  

**Why Lovable?**
* Change the world, literally: 2025 is the year AI works, and Lovable has the best AI full stack engineer product (According to industry veterans)
* Work, learn, have fun: We're building the strongest technical team in Europe. You will shape our culture and be inspired in a place of exceptional talent density
* Build a unique network: Lovable is a global top AI brand that the world is eager to work with. You will meet and work with some of the most important people in tech
* Get autonomy & ownership: With lots of things being built, this is a unique opportunity to get ownership and have a true impact on our product
* Compensation: Lovable pays top of market cash and equity, and is committed to compensate better than any other company in Sweden on a performance basis


**What We’re Looking For**
* A builder who thinks in systems and code, not just SQL queries and dashboards
* Balance quality on critical user flows and quick AB testing iterations
* Supernatural ability to spot patterns in messy data and turn them into actionable insights

**Your Responsibilities**

**Our tech stack**
 We're building with tools that both humans and AI love:
   

  

* Frontend: React for lightning-fast interfaces

* We treat all candidates equally - if you are interested please apply through our application system.

title: Business analyst inom offentlig sektor
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 På CGI ligger vi i framkant när det kommer till digitalisering och tillämpning av nya teknologier. Just nu söker vi medarbetare som delar vår passion och som har en erfarenhet som kravanalytiker.
   

  

 Vi söker en engagerad och erfaren Business Analyst med teknisk bakgrund inom offentlig sektor som kommer att spela en nyckelroll i att förstå, analysera och definiera krav för projekt inom offentlig sektor. Du kommer att arbeta nära både kunder och projektteam för att säkerställa att lösningarna lever upp till verksamhetens behov och mål.
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 I rollen som Business Analyst kommer du att ha en central roll i att stödja och utveckla våra IT-projekt och verksamhetsprojekt inom offentlig sektor. Din roll kommer att vara starkt kundinriktad, där du analyserar affärsbehov och formar skräddarsydda lösningar för att uppfylla deras krav.
   

  

**Dina ansvarsområden**
* Samla in, analysera och dokumentera krav från intressenter.
* Fungera som en brygga mellan verksamheten och IT.
* Skapa och visualisera kravmodeller, processkartor och användningsfall.
* Säkerställa att levererade lösningar möter de identifierade behoven.
* Bidra med insikter om trender och bästa praxis inom offentlig sektor.


 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Du är en initiativtagande person som trivs i en snabbväxande miljö. Som en del av vårt team förväntas du vara självgående men samtidigt en lagspelare. Du har utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter och en naturlig fallenhet för problemlösning.
   

  

 Vi tror att du har en bakgrund inom datavetenskap, systemvetenskap eller annat relevant område och har mellan 3-5 års erfarenhet inom offentlig sektor. Du är även tekniskt kunnig och har förståelse för databaser och systemutvecklingsprocesser.
   

  

 Meriterande för denna tjänst är även om du är certifierad inom till exempel Scrum, SAFe, REQb.
   

  

 För den här tjänsten är det viktigt att du kan tala och skriva på svenska obehindrat. Eftersom våra kunder finns i offentlig sektor tillämpar vi även bakgrundskontroller.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan, har du några frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att maila rekryterande ledare Lena Lundgren på jonas.voneuler@cgi.com
   

  

**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Cybersecurity architect Getinge
company_industry: Medical Equipment Manufacturing, Biotechnology Research, and Hospitals and Health Care
description:
**With a passion for life**
 Join our diverse teams of passionate people and a career that allows you to develop both personally and professionally. At Getinge we exist to make life-saving technology accessible for more people. To make a true difference for our customers – and to save more lives, we need team players, forward thinkers, and game changers.
   

  

 Are you looking for an inspiring career? You just found it.
   

  

**About This Opportunity**
 The Cybersecurity Center of excellence at our Solna office supports our R&D teams and regulatory to make sure that standards and regulatory requirements are fulfilled throughout the lifecycle of our Critical Care products. Our products are complex and specialized both in design and the requirements they need to fulfill and with the challenges in the world around us, we play an important role in keeping our products safe and reliable for our end users.
   

  

 The team currently consists of five persons, and we are now looking forward to expanding the team with our next Cyber Security Architect.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 In this role, you will work closely with Critical Cares different product development teams and provide expert knowledge of the security aspects of their work. You will be supporting with both methodology and technical solutions.
   

  

 Your daily work will be to drive and support the teams with:
   

  

* Product threat modelling, risk analysis and risk mitigation.
* Secure design architecture for embedded and server-based solutions for our products.
* Secure coding practices and tool support.
* Training to increase understanding of the need for, and implementation of security solutions.
* Ensuring standard and regulatory requirement fulfillment in Getinge products.


 This position is based in Solna, Stockholm and may include occasional travel. The position is eligible for a hybrid setup where you can work from home 1-2 days a week.
   

  

**You will bring**
 To be successful in this position, we believe that you have the following qualifications:
   

  

* MSc in Computer Software or equivalent.
* At least 5 years of experience in working with security for embedded and IoT systems.
* Experience in working with product life cycle security standards.
* Experience in security SW environments based on Linux, RTOS, Java or Goolang.
* Fluency in English, orally and written, is required. Fluency in Swedish is meritorious.


**The Following Qualifications Is Meritorious**
* Secure coding practices and corresponding tool support.
* Security testing, fuzzing, penetration testing and corresponding tool support.


 In addition to your technical skills, we highly value your personality. We believe that you are a strong communicator who feel comfortable supporting colleagues and teams around the organization. Since you will support and work with a wide range of Critical Care products you have an interest in learning our product technologies and use. You have an ambition for growth and an eagerness for keeping up to date with the latest development of techniques and methodologies within the Cyber Security field.
   

  

 At Getinge we see ourselves as proactive and self-driven in learning and contributing to the continued development of our products and our organization's capabilities. We are Team Players, Forward Thinkers and Game Changers.
   

  

 We think you will thrive in a high-expectation environment and have an interest in our products.
   

  

**Why join Getinge**
 Getinge offers a job in a safe and informal work environment, where we appreciate close team collaboration. We keep an open dialogue between leaders and employees, as well as between teams. We are focused on developing people, and together we will create a plan for learning and competence development when you start your career with us.
   

  

 We offer a competitive compensation and benefits package, including wellness allowances, generous family benefits and joint company activities. Everything to ensure we support your well-being and goals.
   

  

**Application**
 Applications will be reviewed continually, and we therefore recommend sending us your application as soon as possible.
   

  

 We kindly ask you to submit your application in our recruitment system by clicking the “apply now” button. Due to GDPR regulations we do not accept applications via e-mail.
   

  

 If you have any questions regarding the role, please contact Hiring Manager Thomas Nyström at thomas.nystrom@getinge.com or Recruiter Emma Paulsson at emma.paulsson@getinge.com .
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application. We hope you will join us on our journey to become the world’s most desired MedTech company.
   

  

**About Us**
 With a firm belief that every person and community should have access to the best possible care, Getinge provides hospitals and life science institutions with products and solutions aiming to improve clinical results and optimize workflows. The offering includes products and solutions for intensive care, cardiovascular procedures, operating rooms, sterile reprocessing and life science. Getinge employs over 12,000 people worldwide and the products are sold in more than 135 countries.
   

  

 Reasonable accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

title: Enterprise Solutions Architect
description:
**Description**
 Are you passionate about cloud technology and helping customers innovate?
   

  

 Join our AWS Solutions Architecture team in Stockholm and empower enterprises across industries to innovate at speed and scale with cloud technologies.
