title: Senior DevOps Engineer
description:
**Are you an experienced DevOps Engineer with a passion for infrastructure, automation, and cloud technologies? Do you want to play a central role in shaping scalable environments and modern deployment pipelines in a fast-growing tech company?** 




  





 We are now looking for a DevOps Engineer for a well-established EdTech company with strong growth and a fully in-house tech team. You’ll be part of a central DevOps function that works closely with distributed development teams, helping to build and optimize both development and production environments.
 



  





**In this role, you will:** 



* Design and improve CI/CD pipelines and release flows
* Manage and automate AWS cloud infrastructure (Lambda, S3, SQS and more)
* Work with operations, monitoring, and security in production environments
* Collaborate with development teams to improve workflows and solutions
* Operate in a Windows and .NET-based environment, with a strong focus on automation and reliability



  





**Why this role?** 



* You’ll join a modern, international company with a mission to improve lives through education
* Fully in-house tech team with high ambitions and no outsourcing
* A key role with real influence on architecture, tools, and processes
* Flexible hybrid model – based in Stockholm with strong remote flexibility
* A collaborative culture where your voice matters and your ideas shape the future



  





 Does this sound like the next step in your career?
 



  





 Submit your application or contact us directly to learn more – we look forward to hearing from you!

title: Cloud Engineer
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Information Services
description:
Position: Cloud Engineer
 



 Location: Malmo Or Stockholm
 



  





 Are you passionate about Cloud Native technology and well-versed in DevOps principles?
 



  





 Staffhost Digital is exclusively collaborating with one of Europe's Top 5 Digital Transformation Leaders, Located in Malmo and Stockholm. They are currently expanding their Cloud practice following recent project successes.
 



  





 As a Microsoft Gold Partner, they provide unparalleled technical expertise and set exceptional service standards. Alongside their top-tier services, the company is renowned for promoting an employee-friendly culture that promotes work-life balance, flexibility, and autonomy. With opportunities for flexible schedules, this company stands out as the preferred employer within the tech industry.
 



  





 Your Role:
 



 As a Cloud Engineer, you will hold a pivotal role in designing, implementing, and supporting cloud-native solutions for their esteemed clients (Public and Private). You will be engaged in pioneering projects that harness cutting-edge cloud technologies and adhere to best practices in DevOps and microservices architecture.
 



  





 Key Responsibilities:
 



 • Experience in cloud-native development and architecture.
 



 • Good Knowledge in Microsoft Azure and cloud platform technologies.
 



 • Strong understanding of microservices architecture and event-driven design.
 



 • Hands-on experience with containerisation technologies such as Docker and orchestration with Kubernetes.
 



 • Familiarity with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools, including Terraform and CloudFormation.
 



  





 We appreciate your interest in this opportunity. Please consider your application unsuccessful if you do not receive a response from us within 48 hours.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Vi söker en
 **DevOps Engineer** 
 med några års arbetslivserfarenhet och som har passion för att bygga stabila och effektiva miljöer. Här får du arbeta hos vår kund inom försvarsindustrin och i nära samarbete med utvecklingsteam. Du kommer att få chansen att arbeta med teknologier och system som Kubernetes, CI/CD pipelines, Linux och mycket mer.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som DevOps engineer kommer du att spela en viktig roll i att bygga samt underhålla kundens mjukvarufabriksplattform med verktyg som Kubernetes, Vault, Grafana m.m. Du kommer att arbeta nära utvecklingsteamen på plats för att säkerställa att applikationer och pipelines uppfyller krav för distribution och testning. Det kommer även innebära att utveckla och underhålla script samt övervakning och felsökning av problem kopplat till bl.a. drift och nätverk. Du kommer dagligen samarbeta med andra personer i teamet för att förbättra pipelines, säkerhet och skalbarhet.
   

  

**Vi tror att du är en driven DevOps engineer som har:**
* Några års erfarenhet inom DevOps-tools.
* Erfarenhet av kubernetes, CI/CD pipelines, Grafana, Confluence, Docker.
* Kunskap inom automatisering och scripting, gärna erfarenhet av verktyg som Bash, Python eller Go.
* Kunskap om Linux/Unix baserade system och infrastruktur.
* Stark kommunikationsförmåga på svenska i både tal och skrift.


**Vad vi erbjuder**
 Hos oss får du en stabil anställning med:
   

  

* Konkurrenskraftiga villkor och fast månadslön
* Möjligheter att utvecklas och specialisera dig inom ditt expertområde
* En öppen och trivsam arbetskultur med regelbundna aktiviteter för teamkänsla och gemenskap


**Om oss**
 Vi är en ledande aktör inom drift och IT-infrastruktur och arbetar med marknadsledande företag inom en rad olika branscher. Här får du möjlighet att utvecklas inom avancerade projekt och arbeta med den senaste tekniken. Vi är måna om att våra medarbetare trivs och erbjuder en trygg och utvecklande miljö där du får stöd i din karriärutveckling.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Låter detta som ditt nästa steg? Urval sker löpande, så skicka gärna in din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

title: DevOps Engineer (Sys Admin)
description:
Avalanche Studios Group is looking for a DevOps Enginee r with a strong systems administration background for our next AAA game in Stockholm! This is a great opportunity for someone who has worked as a Systems Administrator and is looking for a path to the DevOps space. You'll manage and optimise our production infrastructure, ensuring high availability and performance, supporting both internal needs and publisher integration.
   

  

 You will prioritise project tickets and enhance production efficiency and security by collaborating closely with development and IT teams. You'll support CI/CD processes, manage P4 Source Code and the internal Needy repository, and handle storage and network tasks. This role reports to the IT Infrastructure Manager and works directly with game project teams.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Collaborating with development teams to ensure infrastructure is scalable, reliable and secure
* Automating infrastructure provisioning and configuration.
* Building and maintaining CI/CD tools
* Implementing monitoring and alerting systems.
* Support Autobuilders, Autotesting and Devkit, including physical support from build engineers.
* Administer network security with firewall rules and allowlists.
* Assist IT support with playtest setup, town hall meetings, streaming setup, hardware troubleshooting, support tasks, configuration changes, and procurement if needed


**Who You Are**
* Professional experience as a system administrator or DevOps engineer for at least 2 years
* Basics in configuration management tools (like Ansible, Puppet, Chef),
* CI/CD tools (like Jenkins, GitLab CI, CircleCI),
* Have worked with containerization technologies (like Docker, Kubernetes),
* Good knowledge in Cloud platforms (like AWS, Azure, GCP),
* Monitoring and logging tools (like Prometheus, Grafana, ELK stack).
* Windows and Linux system administration skills


*Note: Research shows under-represented groups in the industry (especially women) might not apply to a job if they don’t check off every requirement. At Avalanche, we’re more about your drive to learn and interest in tackling challenges than what’s on your resume! So don’t stress if you don’t tick every box— shoot us your application anyway! Diverse opinions and different experiences are what make our teams so great, not itemized lists of qualifications.*
**The Stockholm location**
 Our Stockholm office is situated in Södermalm, the beating heart of the city’s game industry. It’s a physical representation of our games – the lush vegetation of Just Cause and theHunter: Call of the Wild meets corroded metal straight out of Mad Max. It has everything you need to make it your creative base camp.
   

  

**Our values**
 At Avalanche Studios Group, we create worlds beyond limits. But that’s not exclusive to our games, so we’re committed to developing a diverse and inclusive workplace. All Avalanchers have a shared responsibility to create an open work environment where everyone is treated equally and respectfully. Being part of our world is not contingent on your heritage, your gender, or sexual orientation. It’s all about your passion and creativity.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 To apply for this position, please register below and provide your CV in English. We review applications continuously. All further studio-related information is provided under a non-disclosure agreement.
   

  

*At Avalanche Studios Group we're always on the lookout for talented individuals to join our passionate team, but please note that relocation assistance is not available for this role.*

title: Security Commissioning Data Center Engineer
description:
**Security Commissioning Data Center Engineer** 




**Location:** 
 Flexible within Europe with frequent travel across the continent, both local and international. This
 **hybrid** 
**role** 
 combines remote work flexibility with on-site presence during critical project phases. Occasional overnight stays may be necessary.
 



**About the Role:** 
 Join the
 **vanguard of data center security innovation** 
 . As a Security Commissioning Data Center Engineer, you will be
 **pivotal** 
**in bringing advanced security systems to life** 
 . You will work with the Data Centre (DC) Operations team, both on-site and remotely, to
 **test, commission, and perfect the systems that safeguard the digital world** 
 . Your expertise will empower clients across Europe. This role is for a
 **trailblazer who thrives on technical challenges, collaboration, and extensive travel** 
 . You will be part of a team that is
 **all-in on operational brilliance** 
 . This position is a chance to
 **lead, explore, and leave your mark on a fast-evolving industry** 
 .
 



**About Convergint:** 
 Convergint is a
 **global leader in service-based systems integration** 
 , committed to operational excellence and client satisfaction. We are about pushing limits and delivering excellence. We shape the future of data center security and work on innovative projects.
 



**What You'll Do (Key Responsibilities):** 



* **Master the Setup:** 
 Leverage technical prowess to
 **install and configure sophisticated network and security systems** 
 , ensuring a flawless launch.
* **Drive Commissioning Excellence:** 
 Coordinate seamlessly with project managers, engineers, and contractors. Adhere to client standards and
 **keep projects on track** 
 .
 **Document observations, tests, and checklists with precision** 
 .
* **Solve and Innovate:** 
 Tackle unique system challenges head-on. Deliver creative, actionable solutions. Be the go-to troubleshooter for colleagues, diagnosing IT and networking hiccups.
* **Collaborate and Connect:** 
 Partner with project crews and client IT teams to bring scope requirements to life and easily bridge technical gaps.
* **Lead with Expertise:** 
 Advise design and sales teams, offering technical insights that shape winning bids and groundbreaking plans.
* **Be the Client’s Champion:** 
 Act as the
 **trusted technical liaison** 
 . Deliver service so exceptional that clients remain on their first call.
* **Execute with Precision:** 
 Own the details and handle key technical elements across multiple projects. This includes
 **programming, graphics, certification testing, and client training** 
 .
* **Mitigate Risks:** 
 Spot potential pitfalls early, rally stakeholders, and craft strategies to
 **keep timelines tight and budgets intact** 
 .
* **Elevate the Game:** 
 Scout the latest tools and practices to boost efficiency and share your discoveries. Work with Project Managers to
 **enhance quality and client satisfaction** 
 .
* **Bonus Missions:** 
 Craft polished submittal booklets and take on additional duties to fuel the mission.



**What You'll Bring (Skills & Experience):** 



* **Technical Wizardry:** 
 Deep expertise in
 **testing, designing, and operating security systems, especially in the data center realm** 
 . Proven know-how with
 **network systems and equipment** 
 honed in high-stakes environments.
 **Advanced programming skills** 
 . Hands-on mastery of platforms like C-CURE, Lenel, Honeywell, S2, Genetec, Axis, or Milestone is required.
* **Experience:** 
 At least
 **2 years of direct experience in data center security systems** 
 .
* **Client-First Mindset:** 
 A knack for staying
 **calm under pressure** 
 while keeping customers delighted.
* **Multitasking Muscle:** 
 Stellar
 **organisational skills** 
 to juggle multiple projects.
* **Problem-Solving Chops:** 
 A
 **relentless drive to find solutions that stick** 
 .
* **Communication Excellence:** 
**Crystal-clear communication** 
 , written and spoken.
* **Leadership:** 
 Leadership that rallies teams and adapts to business needs.
* **Commercial Acumen:** 
 A sharp commercial sense that keeps you ahead of the curve.
* **Collaboration:** 
 A collaborative nature.



**Credentials (Required Education & Certifications):** 



* **Education:** 
 High school diploma (or equivalent) paired with
 **formal network design, installation, and maintenance training** 
 . Equivalent real-world experience is also accepted.
* **Certifications:** 
 Bonus points for elite certifications like
 **Lenel OnGuard Expert, CCURE Level 4, or Genetec** 
 . Bonus points also for any network, VM, or server qualifications.



**Work Environment:** 
 This role involves frequent travel across Europe. You will split your time between dynamic job sites and office work, navigating high spaces, tight corners, and construction zones. The role has physical demands, including the ability to
 **lift to 25 pounds regularly** 
 (and 100 pounds occasionally). You may be required to
 **wear personal protective equipment (PPE)** 
 like hard hats or steel-toed boots and stay sharp in environments with electrical risks. Precision vision abilities are needed.
 



**Why Join Us?** 
 At our core, we’re about pushing limits and delivering excellence. By stepping into this role, you’ll
 **shape the future of data center security** 
 , working on innovative projects alongside a team that’s all-in on operational brilliance. This is more than a job—it’s a chance to
 **lead, explore, and leave your mark** 
 on a fast-evolving industry. If you’re a security or IT pro with a passion for innovation and a hunger to collaborate, apply today.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
**Are you ready to revolutionize technology and play a pivotal role in implementing cutting-edge cloud-based solutions for a leading P&C insurer in the Nordic region?**
**About The Role**
 We are looking for a driven and collaborative DevOps Engineer to join our Engineering Excellence team, the enablers of modern engineering at the Nordics’ leading insurer.
   

  

 This is more than a “pipelines and infra” role: you will coach, mentor, and empower squads, drive the adoption of DevOps and software best practices, and help build a sustainable, learning-focused tech culture.
   

  

 As part of Engineering Excellence, your contributions will include:
   

  

* Coaching and supporting squads to adopt DevOps, test automation, cloud, and security best practices.
* Defining, documenting, and scaling standards for software quality, CI/CD, infrastructure as code, and technical alignment.
* Facilitating knowledge sharing, training and workshops to upskill engineers, foster a growth mindset, and build trust.
* Enabling a culture of collaboration, open feedback, and psychological safety—helping teams work together smarter and safer.


**We offer**
 In the same way that we place high demands on you as an employee, we also expect you to place high demands on us as an employer. Here are some of the benefits of working at If:
   

  

* An including work environment where everyone is welcome
* Career and development opportunities in the biggest insurance company in the Nordics
* Social activities, as well as highly skilled professional environment
* Possibility of hybrid workplace
* Health promoting workplace with e.g., wellness allowance and various sports activities
* Great insurance benefits
* Lunch bonus
* Very good pension saving plan


**About The Team**
 As a DevOps Engineer in Engineering Excellence, you will help set the technical direction for our new cloud-based core systems and enable squads to deliver faster, safer, and more independently. You will collaborate across multiple teams and tech stacks, ensuring technical alignment and consistency, and supporting squads as they modernize their ways of working.
   

  

 We are an agile, innovative, and high-performing team, deeply committed to continuous learning and improvement. Your work will have a multiplier effect, raising the engineering maturity for everyone.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You are a solution-oriented, collaborative engineer who understands that DevOps is as much about people and culture as it is about technology.
   

  

 You thrive in cross-team environments, enjoy helping others succeed, and communicate technical ideas clearly.
   

  

 You are passionate about continuous improvement and always seek new ways to optimize processes and empower your colleagues.
   

  

**You also have:**
* A degree in a tech-related field, or equivalent relevant experience
* Experience as a DevOps Engineer or in a similar role (software development/system administration)
* Expertise in the Azure cloud platform is essential; familiarity with AWS or GCP is a plus
* Understanding of containers and orchestration, especially Docker and Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS)
* Strong scripting skills, particularly in PowerShell and Bash; knowledge of Python is beneficial
* Experience with CI/CD tools - Azure DevOps, GitHub Actions, Jenkins, or similar
* Proficiency in infrastructure as code (Terraform, Bicep, ARM templates) and automation
* Good understanding of networking and security in a cloud context
* Previous experience with coaching, documentation, and enabling teams is a strong advantage
* Certification in Azure DevOps or Azure Administrator is a plus


**Our promise to you**
 You will be part of an international, modern, and dynamic working environment within the leading insurance company in the Nordic region. You will have challenging and exciting tasks driving your personal and skills development. Training opportunities within and outside the organization will support your career growth. You will be at the forefront of delivering solutions aimed at the changing mobility landscape.
   

  

**Additional Facts And The Recruitment Process**
**Application deadline:** 
 Screening and interviewing will start after summer holidays in mid-August. However, application deadline is August 10th, 2025.
   

**To apply for the position:** 
 Please attach your CV
   

**Work location:** 
 Bergshamra, Stockholm.
   

**Start** 
 : As soon as possible or by agreement
   

  

**For more information, please contact:** 
 Burhan Öcüt, DevOps Architect on burhan.ocut@if.se
   

  

 A background check will be conducted on all final candidates.
   

  

 Read more about our Tech Community at If and how we together create tech that matters: www.if.se/tech
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**
  

**About Us**
  

***We are If. Our purpose is to give people confidence today to shape their tomorrow.**
 To make this possible, trust is our backbone. We stay ahead and challenge ourselves to grow. And we always put our hearts into it – because it takes more than bright minds to make brilliant things happen.
   

  

 We are the leading insurance company in the Nordics/Baltics and a stable employer with 7,900 dedicated professionals. But most importantly, we are protectors of people, enablers of companies and encouragers of dreams. With our joint force of expertise and engagement we always stand by our customers’ side. Giving them the security and the confidence to be curious, explore new worlds, start new businesses and live their lives.
   

  

 We are an equal opportunity employer, convinced that a diverse and inclusive work culture boosts innovation and the growth of intellectual capital in many ways. It doesn’t matter who you are, where you come from, or what you look like. It is the different perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences each of us have and share, that will make a difference.
   

  

 Come and join us!*

title: Engineer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Job Description**
* Reverse engineer iOS apps to understand their communications with backend APIs.
* Utilize interactive disassemblers like HexRays IDA to analyze app code.
* Implement injector tools (e.g., frida.re) to manipulate app behavior.
* Analyze traffic patterns using proxies like Charles Proxy.
* Build custom solutions in Java to replicate and utilize the reverse-engineered logic.


**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* Experience with reverse engineering iOS/Android mobile apps.
* Experience in Java programming language.
* Familiarity with HexRays IDA and frida.re tools or similar.


**Meritorious**
* Experience with AWS, Kubernetes, and Docker.
* Knowledge of traffic analysis tools like Datadog.
* Awareness of security practices related to app and API development


**Application deadline:** 
 16-06-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Senior Cassandra SRE
description:
Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.
   

  





 Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.
   

  

  

  




**Job Description**

 Tink was founded in 2012, and a decade later became part of Visa in 2022. Tink was created with the aim of changing the banking industry for the better. We have built Europe’s most robust open banking platform – with the broadest, deepest connectivity and powerful services that create value out of the financial data. We offer the tools that allow anyone – from big banks and fintechs to startups – to build the future of financial services across Europe.
   

  





 Perhaps the most dramatic outcome of the digital revolution is the amount of data that is now collected and analyzed. Tink handles billions of events, and this number is increasing at an exponential rate. We are passionate about enabling data-driven decisions for our clients and internal stakeholders. Our goal is to ensure data is collected, transformed, and presented securely with accuracy and reliability. Building the infrastructure and services to support this is hence a key part of what Tink engineers are doing.
   

  






 What we are looking for:
   

  






 We are currently seeking a talented individual to join the Stateful team. Working from our office in Stockholm and help us maintain, expand and evolve our Cassandra database offering.
   

  





 The Stateful team is the backbone of our data infrastructure and tooling. Playing a vital role in delivering essential database services and developing tools to meet the evolving needs of the Tink organization. We are actively expanding our team, seeking talented Site Reliability Engineers (SREs) and DevOps engineers who can bring their expertise to drive our database services to new heights.
   

  






 What we offer you:
   

  






 A position in the Stateful team means working in an international environment where you will be involved in:
   

  




* Ensuring scalability and reliability of our most critical operational data store. Primarily Cassandra.
* Collaborating with stakeholders to ensure that the database services and tools align with their evolving requirements and use cases.



 This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your hiring manager.
   

  





  

  

  

  




**Qualifications**

 Basic Qualification
   

  

 ●5+ years of relevant work experience with a Bachelor’s Degree or at least 2 years
   

  

 of work experience with an Advanced degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD) or 0
   

  

 years of work experience with a PhD, OR 8+ years of relevant work experience.
   

  

 ●Proven experience in managing Cassandra databases at scale.
   

  

 ●A strong desire to foster teamwork and collaborative efforts.
   

  

 ●Working in an IaC environment using tooling such as Terraform, or Ansible
   

  

 ●Experience with monitoring tools like Prometheus, Grafana, Datadog
   

  

  

  

 Preferred Qualification
   

  

 ●6 or more years of work experience with a Bachelors Degree or 4 or more years
   

  

 of relevant experience with an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD) or
   

  

 up to 3 years of relevant experience with a PhD
   

  

 ●Familiarity with AWS, RDS, Aurora, DynamoDB, Zookeeper, and Kafka
   

  

 ●Extensive industry experience, including mentoring of junior engineers.
   

  

  

  




**Additional Information**

 Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

title: Data Engineering Intern
company_industry: Financial Services and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**Join AiMi and build the future of Capital Markets**
 At AiMi, we're on a mission to simplify and accelerate access to Capital Markets infrastructure. through automation and operational middleware. We’re using technology to drive greater productivity and agility, for a dynamic, data-driven and digital first future. If you’re tech-driven, curious, and ready to work hands-on with agentic AI and automation to solve complex problems, we want you!
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Monitor, process, and validate email notifications from global exchanges, ensuring critical updates are seamlessly integrated into our platform
* Automate data ingestion, transformation, and monitoring processes
* Build prompt libraries, engineer new prompts, and monitor effectiveness
* Expand and refine service catalogues with new venues, APIs, and data sets
* Work closely with the product and engineering teams, reviewing new features and releases from a data flow and integrity perspective.
* Directly support client onboarding, troubleshoot data queries, and propose innovative solutions to operational challenges.


**What We’re Looking For**
* Experience or strong interest in data modelling, agentic AI frameworks, scripting languages or database technologies.
* A process-driven, analytical mindset and high attention to detail.
* Familiarity with tools like Jira, GitHub, Slack, or similar.
* Passion for data engineering, automation, and fintech innovation.
* Eagerness to learn new technologies in a fast-paced, supportive environment.


**What You’ll Gain**
* Real-world impact and rapid professional growth in an early-stage tech startup.
* Hands-on exposure to automation, data ops, and Gen-AI tools in the capital markets space.
* Opportunity to influence product direction and data strategy.
* Hands-on experience in a cutting-edge AI-driven B2B fintech
* Collaborative, flexible, remote-first team culture.


 Whilst there is no salary initially, you’ll receive a small monthly stipend to cover expenses, whilst also on-the-job training and the opportunity to convert to a permanent, paid role as the company grows.
   

  

**Let’s Go!**
 If you’re excited to be part of a forward-thinking company at the intersection of finance and technology, we’d love to hear from you. Apply now and help shape the future of AiMi!

title: iOS Engineer
description:
**Description**
**ABOUT US**
 Board Intelligence is a technology and advisory firm, that supercharges boards with the science of board effectiveness. We build better businesses and benefit society.
   

  

 Through a suite of AI-powered software tools, evaluation frameworks, and advisory services that distil twenty years of boardroom experience, we improve the efficiency of board processes and the effectiveness of boards.
   

  

 We work with over 70,000 leaders and 3,000 organisations across the world, with clients across the Fortune 500, FTSE 100, and OMX 30. In 2024 we received substantial backing from K1 Investment Management – the leading B2B Enterprise SaaS investors. We are at the beginning of significant growth, and we are looking for superb talent to join us on this journey.
   

  

 As we grow, we are fiercely protective of our culture and values. Many of us, including our founders, have families and other priorities, so we know the value of a supportive company.
   

  

 With three international locations (UK, Sweden, Mauritius) and over 15 nationalities represented, the team is diverse and friendly. We value fun: most days you will find a social event or learning opportunity to get involved with, including company socials, away days, philanthropic activities and lunch & learns.
   

  

**Our Mission**
 We unleash the potential of organisations through the science of board effectiveness, building better businesses and benefiting society.
   

  

**Our Engineering Team**
 We build, maintain, and improve the software that our clients rely on. Our work ensures that Board Intelligence product suite is efficient, scalable, and capable of adapting to changing customer needs.
   

  

 This role offers full-time working from our Central Stockholm office.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
 At Board Intelligence, we're looking for a motivated and enthusiastic Junior iOS Engineer to join our expanding team. In this role, you'll be involved in the development and maintenance of our iOS applications using Swift (and potentially some Objective-C). Reporting to a Senior Engineer, you'll work with different teams, including Product, Design, and QA, to help build and deliver new features that support our company's aims.
   

  

**What will you be responsible for?**
* Write and maintain good quality code in Objective C and/or Swift
* Work with cross-functional teams to understand requirements and contribute to building new features for our product and users
* Participate in technical discussions and learn about the architecture of our mobile applications
* Take responsibility for specific tasks or smaller features, ensuring they meet our quality standards
* Learn from and be supported by senior engineers within the team
* Help to identify and fix bugs based on user feedback and testing
* Be encouraged to stay up-to-date with new technologies and best practices in the industry


**Requirements**
**What We're Looking for**
 We’re looking for someone that has a hunger to change our working environment for the better, driving performance from our people and protecting our culture and values to make sure we remain a caring, entrepreneurial and client-first workplace.
   

  

 We’re open-minded on the background someone may have coming into this role, but things that could help a candidate to be successful would be:
   

  

  

* Some experience with Swift and the iOS environment is helpful. Any understanding of the app development process would be a bonus
* A basic understanding of different ways to structure iOS apps (like MVVM or MVC) and a willingness to learn more about building scalable and maintainable applications
* A desire to contribute to good user experiences and the ability to work both independently on tasks and collaboratively within a team to solve problems
* A willingness to learn from and be supported by more senior developers and share knowledge as you grow
* An interest in maintaining good code quality and performance, and an openness to learning about tools like testing and code reviews


**Our iOS Tech Stack**
* Swift & Objective-C for iOS, iPadOS, and macOS Catalyst applications.
* MVVM architecture with functional reactive programming patterns.
* Realm database with encryption for local storage.
* Cocoapods and Swift Package Manager for dependency management.
* GitLab, JIRA, Confluence, Testflight, Fastlane for CI/CD and collaboration.


**Benefits**
 We pride ourselves on our great working environment and package. Here’s some of what’s on offer:
   

  

  

* 25 days of Vacation with Advanced Vacation days
* Wellness benefits including a wellness hour per week for exercise and up to SEK 2,000 per year for wellness activities
* Parental leave with 90% salary coverage for up to 6 months
* Comprehensive insurance including Group Life, TFA Safety and Travel
* Regular team lunches and fikas
* ITP1 + Flexpension
* Vision benefit with free eye test & terminal glasses
* Tax-free daily allowances for travel
* Activities such as conferences, kick-offs, and other events

title:
Jobb
Teamchef till SJs Cloud Operations-team
description:
Teamchef till SJs Cloud Operations-team
   

  

**SJ AB**
 Stockholm
   

  

 Ansök senast: 2025-06-30
   

  

 Sök jobbet här
   

  

*Vill du vara med och bygga upp ett nytt team och leda en organisation i molntransformationens slutskede? Nu söker vi en trygg och tekniskt kunnig ledare som vill ta ansvar för både drift, utveckling och strategisk riktning för vårt nya Cloud Operations-team. Hos oss får du jobba i en kritisk verksamhet som måste fungera dygnets alla timmar.*
**Din kommande roll** 
  

  

 Som teamchef för Cloud Operations kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i vår fortsatta resa till molnet. Du ansvarar för att bygga upp ett helt nytt team och leda en viktig del av verksamheten med fokus på stabil drift och proaktiv incidenthantering i en modern, molnbaserad infrastruktur i Azure.
   

  

 Du Kommer Att Ha Ett Helhetsansvar För Drift Och Utveckling Inom Operations-området, Leda Ett Team Om Ca. 10 Personer Och Hantera Både Leveranser Och Budget. Utöver Detta Kommer Du Också
   

  

* Samordna externa leverantörsrelationer och implementera DevSecOps-principer i det dagliga arbetet.
* Arbeta nära andra team och intressenter inom plattform, IDP, IAM och digital arbetsplats.


**Förväntningar på den vi söker**
 Vi söker dig som är en trygg ledare med god förmåga att växla mellan strategisk överblick och detaljfokus. Som teamchef hos SJ önskar vi att du tar initiativ, agerar proaktivt och skapar tillit och struktur i förändringsresor. Du gillar att vara nära verksamheten och bidra till att bygga något långsiktigt tillsammans med ditt team.
   

  

 För att trivas i rollen så tror vi att du har:
   

  

* Teknisk bakgrund och flerårig erfarenhet som chef med driftansvar.
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet från större organisationer och arbete med produkter som måste fungera 24 timmar om dygnet.
* Erfarenhet av infrastruktur och molndrift, gärna i Azure.
* Erfarenhet av leverantörshantering, beredskap och incidenthantering.
* God förståelse för säkerhet och leverans i komplexa IT-miljöer.
* Du talar och skriver flytande svenska och engelska och har en akademisk examen som är aktuell för tjänsten.


 Vi ser det som meriterande om du har erfarenhet inom DevSecOps, SRE-konceptet och säkerhetsprodukter inom Microsoft-stacken.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Vi arbetar med en komplex domän där stabilitet, innovation och säkerhet står i centrum. I plattformsteamet jobbar vi med att möjliggöra självbetjäningsverktyg och infrastruktur som gör det enklare för våra DevOps-team att fokusera på det som verkligen skapar värde – utveckling och innovation. Vår organisation växer och förändras – och vi är stolta över att få göra den här resan tillsammans. Hos oss får du vara med och forma framtiden för vår digitala plattform på riktigt.
   

  

**Ansökan och information**
 Urval sker löpande så skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Anställningen är på hundra procent och vårt kontor är beläget i Stockholm på Vasagatan 10. Vi erbjuder en hybrid-modell med möjlighet till flexibilitet.
   

  

 Om SJ AB
   

  

 SJ är ett svenskt reseföretag som erbjuder hållbara tågresor i egen regi och i samarbete med andra. SJ är ett av Sveriges grönaste varumärken och en del av lösningen för att klimatmålen ska nås. Koncernens drygt 6 600 medarbetare i Sverige och Norge bidrar alla till ökat tågresande – SJ för Sverige framåt.
   

  

**Grundades** 
 1856
   

  

**Medarbetare** 
 6600
   

  

**Omsättning** 
 10 600 msek
   

  

 Sök jobbet här

title: Senior Platform Engineer, IGA
description:
Are you a talented IAM specialist and experience in modern IGA & PAM solutions? Fortum is on the lookout for someone to join our CloudOps & Platform Engineering team within the IAM & M365 technical squad.
   

  

 You can work from our offices in Espoo, Solna, or Wroclaw, with the added flexibility of hybrid work arrangements.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Senior Platform Engineer, IGA you'll be at the heart of managing and optimizing Fortum's core authentication and collaboration environment. Your day-to-day will involve hands-on development in modern IGA & PAM solutions, installing, configuring, deploying, developing, and optimizing these solutions. You'll be the go-to person for operating the IGA & PAM solutions and developing workflows for identity lifecycle management. Plus, you'll manage and maintain together with the rest of the squad our Microsoft hybrid identity environments and support and optimize Microsoft hybrid Exchange environments.
   

  

 This role is all about collaboration. You'll work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure our IAM and M365 services run smoothly. You'll be part of a dynamic team that focuses on security optimization, identity lifecycle management, and supporting various IT and business functions with their IAM needs. It's a great opportunity to grow your skills in a supportive and innovative environment.
   

  

**About You**
 We're looking for someone with the following:
   

  

  

* Fluent English language skills, both written and spoken.
* Experience with one or more complex IGA and/or PAM solutions (e.g., Sailpoint, Saviynt, OneIdentity, Delinea, SSH PrivX).
* A good understanding of IAM/IDM processes.
* Hands-on experience with LinuxOS and shell scripting, as well as PowerShell for AD & EntraID.
* A solid understanding of networks.
* Knowledge of AWS, Azure and/or on-prem datacenter environments.
* ITSM integration knowledge (ServiceNow) is a plus.
* Strong collaboration and communication skills.
* A team-oriented approach and a commitment to working together.


 Your ability to work collaboratively and communicate effectively will be key in this role. We're looking for someone who is proactive and committed to team working.
   

  

**We offer you**
 At Fortum, we believe in a better future and want to be involved in shaping it. Our workplace is a safe place, both physically and mentally. You will grow with professional colleagues, being trusted and free to challenge yourself. We offer comprehensive benefits, flexible working hours, and hybrid work model to support your productivity, development and wellbeing. We are committed to build diverse teams where everyone feels included and is treated equally.
   

  

 More information about our culture and benefits can be found here.
   

  

**Interested?**
 Submit your application in English latest on 29th of June. No cover letter needed. We start contacting suitable candidates already during the application period. If you have questions and would like to hear more about the position, please contact Hiring Manager Petri Miettinen at petri.miettinen@fortum.com or Recruitment Partner Lisa Kylberg at lisa.kylberg@partners.fortum.com.
   

  

 Contact details to union representatives in Sweden can be found on the bottom of
 **this page.**
 To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance and a health examination including drug testing.
   

  

**We are Fortum**
 Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our :5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

title: Senior Test Automation Engineer
description:
**Why join us?** 




  





 We’re on a mission to empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. As the world-leader in assistive communication solutions, we empower our customers to
 
 express themselves, connect with the world, and live richer lives
 
 .
 



  





 At Tobii Dynavox, you can grow your career within
 
 a dynamic, global company
 
 that has a clear, impactful purpose - with the flexibility to also do what truly matters to you outside of work. What’s more, you’ll be part of a work culture where collaboration is the norm and individuality is welcomed.
 



  





 As a member of our team, you’ll have the power to innovate for good. You’ll see your ideas in use in new applications, work with the latest technology on leading platforms, and deliver meaningful solutions for our customers.
 



 We’re at an exciting stage in our journey—growing rapidly and expanding our Product & Development team in Stockholm to build a vibrant hub for innovation, product design, and technology. This is a unique opportunity to join a thriving organization where you can help shape the future of assistive communication, defining how we work and delivering impactful solutions for our users.
 



  





 We are building a culture of empowered, collaborative teams who are passionate about helping individuals with disabilities find their voice and connect with the world. Our teams thrive on trust, collaboration, and a positive environment where everyone lead and contributes. We deeply understand the people we serve, empathize with their challenges, and use our expertise to make a real difference.
 



  





**About the Role:** 




 As a
 **Senior Test Automation Engineer,** 
 you will take on the important role of defining, maintaining and executing on test suites, both manual and automated, but with an emphasis on modernizing test suites and moving towards automation. You’ll drive our efforts in assuring the highest quality in our mobile, desktop and/or web applications targeting a complex, cross-platform environment.
 



  





**In this role, you will:** 



* Take ownership of and maintaining test suite definitions in collaboration with stakeholders
* Design, develop and deploy automation to existing and new test suites when possible
* Lay and maintain the foundation of a mature, quality-first way of working, supporting development teams and other stakeholders in making the right choices for shared future success
* Provide comprehensive recommendations for test automation tools and the use of the same
* Taking a lead role in supporting, training and coaching junior team members, building a positive environment of collaboration and continuous, actionable and constructive feedback between peers
* Collecting and structuring data on test suite execution, yielding insights into quality metrics over time



  





**We are looking for someone that has:** 



* Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, engineering, or relevant field
* At least 8 years of working experience in software QA roles and at least 5 years of working experience as a software test automation engineer
* Solid experience in modern test automation practices and tools, e.g. Selenium, Playwright, MSTest, NUnit, xUnit.net, TestCafe, Cypress, Appium
* Working experience from .NET and Azure
* Meriting with cross-platform test environments, e.g. Windows, MacOS, iOS, Android
* Excellent communicator in speech and text, being able to clearly share your ideas, vision and strategic plans
* Experience working close to or directly in software development teams, with a good understanding of software development challenges and common pitfalls



  





 Apply today!
 



  





 We believe in empowering individuals - including our own employees - to reach their full potential. So, if you want to change lives while growing your own career, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Full Stack Engineer with CTO Potential
company_industry: Financial Services and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**Join AiMi and build the future of Capital Markets**
 At AiMi, we're on a mission to simplify and accelerate access to Capital Markets infrastructure. through automation and agentic AI. We’re using technology to drive greater productivity and agility, for a dynamic, data-driven and digital first future.
   

  

 We’re looking for a full-stack engineer to join us on our mission and help build the next layer of operational middleware for Capital Markets Infrastructure. As part of the founding team (CEO, CPO) you’ll play an instrumental role in delivering our roadmap and organically grow into the CTO to lead our technology team as we scale up.
   

  

 If you’re tech-driven, curious, committed, and up for a challenge we want you!
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Collaborate closely with the CEO and CPO to deliver our strategic tech stack and feature roadmap
* Design and build new features, including agentic AI capabilities, MCP servers, ingestion pipelines, automation workflows, and data lakes
* Build a performant, secure and scalable platform that can integrate with multiple different data sources and downstream systems
* Evolve our culture and establish the fondations for an engineering function that scales with our growth


**What We’re Looking For**
* Experience in agentic AI frameworks, scripting languages and/or database technologies.
* A strong understanding of API-driven, cloud-native system architectures that are built to be secure, scalable, and performant
* Interest in AI, prompt engineering, data processing and analysis
* Entrepreneurial mindset to build cutting edge technology that delivers real value for key problem statements
* You can drive delivery, effect change and work independently. You move fast but you never compromise on scalability or security for a quick win
* You have a passion for data engineering, automation, and fintech innovation.
* You have a constant need to challenge the status quo, whilst finding ways to deliver in a fast-paced, supportive environment.
* You value transparency, respect, and collaboration


**What You’ll Gain**
* The opportunity to get in at the beginning for an innovate start-up demonstrating product/market fit
* Executing in a cutting-edge AI-driven B2B fintech
* Exposure to the critical infrastructure that powers global financial markets
* Collaborative, flexible, remote-first team culture.


 The starting salary represents the startup, co-founder nature of this role and is offered along with the opportunity for equity, with the potential for unlimited upside if we succeed in our mission.
   

  

**Let’s Go!**
 If you’re excited to be part of a forward-thinking company at the intersection of finance and technology, we’d love to hear from you. Apply now and help shape the future of AiMi!
   

  

**Visit:** 
 aimi.technology

title: Solution Developer with Cobol skills to SEB Technology | SEB, Solna
description:
SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From Java to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone. Are you ready to take on a new challenge? If so, you'll be interested in this opportunity!
   

  

 We are now looking for a Solution Developer with Cobol skills to join our Accounting Solutions team in Stockholm.
   

  

**About The Job**
 We need to strengthen one of our accounting solution teams that is called EKOT with an additional enthusiastic Solution Developer with strong coding and troubleshooting skills so that we can excel in our exciting journey to implement and modernize our accounting solution that fulfills SEB’s high demands on accuracy, security and quality. The EKOT team is an agile team located in Stockholm and is working on the accounting solution modernization roadmap and maintaining the bank’s daily accounting operations. Ensuring the smooth running of SEB´s financial systems is a very important responsibility performed by the team. Our system setup is mainly Mainframe applications where we are part of the consolidating and reporting flow to our end consumers in Finance. We develop and maintain both the back-end (online and batch) and front-end of the applications.
   

  

 Now we are exploring new technologies and possibilities to implement a future solution. We work together with our Product Owner, Architects, and Stakeholders to define our next steps. As a team member, you will work with design, implementation, testing, deployment, troubleshooting, and maintaining our operations including providing support to our users.
   

  

**Who are you?**
 You are a developer with several years of experience. You have preferrable been working with both back-end and front-end development. You have a genuine interest in technology and its ability to support our business. You share our interests in the areas of DevOps guidelines, and you have good communication skills in English.
   

  

 You can work together with others in the team or individually and you can communicate with stakeholders or vendors in a professional way. We believe that you are comfortable in working in mainframe environment, and you are not afraid to work with troubleshooting in different environments.
   

  

 We would love it if you shared our interests and have some of the team skills needed.
   

  

**What You Bring**
* Experience of both back-end and front-end development
* Strong knowledge in mainframe technologies and languages such COBOL, JCL, REXX, OPC, Easytrieve, SQL
* Databases such as DB2
* Experience in design, implementation, testing and deployment of COBOL/mainframe programs
* Cloud technologies, GitHub and GitHub CoPilot for coding
* Knowledge in additional programming languages such as Javascript, React or Python
* Troubleshooting and resolving issues in existing applications and maintaining smooth operations
* Collaborate with team members to discuss ideas and to design and implement new features
* Investigate new tools and ways of working to become a better team and organization


**Benefits**
**We offer many experiences and benefits to our employees, and there is nuance to every individual’s career experience, but the elements that define the core of our offering are:**
* Extensive training and learning opportunities
* Hybrid Workplace
* Innovative company at the forefront of technology
* Opportunities to help transform an industry
* Mobility within a large global company
* Agile and modern ways of working
* Empowering environment
* Deliver world-class service to customers


**Do you want to be a part of SEB?**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but no later than 9th of June. If you have questions about the position, please contact Helena Åslundh Team Manager at helena.aslundh@seb.se, but we will not process applications via email.
   

  

*Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and history of crime. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.*
**Learn more about working at SEB** 
 on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.
   

  

 https://sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: Senior Javautvecklare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
 Vi söker en modern ingenjör som kan driva testautomatisering, kontinuerlig leverans och teknisk excellens i teamet. Du kommer att bidra till att utveckla vår tekniska stack, införa nya arbetssätt såsom feature toggling och CI/CD, och stötta dina teammedlemmar i att leverera kvalitet i hög hastighet.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Gedigen erfarenhet av Java-utveckling, gärna med Guidewire eller liknande plattformar
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att driva testautomatisering (unit-, kontrakts-, integrations-, delsystems- och end-to-end-tester) samt införande av CI/CD
* Praktisk erfarenhet av att implementera feature toggling/flags med standardverktyg som LaunchDarkly
* Kännedom om modern DevOps, molntjänster och infrastruktur som kod är ett plus
* Erfarenhet av Guidewire eller Gosu är en fördel
* Utmärkta problemlösningsförmågor samt god mentor- och kommunikationsförmåga
* Brinner för att höja den tekniska standarden och stötta andra
* Flytande i engelska, goda kunskaper i svenska är ett plus


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 20-06-2025
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Delivery Consultant, ProServe EMEA North
description:
**Description**
 The Amazon Web Services Professional Services (ProServe) team is seeking a skilled Delivery Consultant to join our team at Amazon Web Services (AWS). In this role, you'll work closely with customers to design, implement, and manage AWS solutions that meet their technical requirements and business objectives. You'll be a key player in driving customer success through their cloud journey, providing technical expertise and best practices throughout the project lifecycle.
   

  

 Possessing a deep understanding of AWS products and services, as a Delivery Consultant you will be proficient in architecting complex, scalable, and secure solutions tailored to meet the specific needs of each customer. You’ll work closely with stakeholders to gather requirements, assess current infrastructure, and propose effective migration strategies to AWS. As trusted advisors to our customers, providing guidance on industry trends, emerging technologies, and innovative solutions, you will be responsible for leading the implementation process, ensuring adherence to best practices, optimizing performance, and managing risks throughout the project.
   

  

 The AWS Professional Services organization is a global team of experts that help customers realize their desired business outcomes when using the AWS Cloud. We work together with customer teams and the AWS Partner Network (APN) to execute enterprise cloud computing initiatives. Our team provides assistance through a collection of offerings which help customers achieve specific outcomes related to enterprise cloud adoption. We also deliver focused guidance through our global specialty practices, which cover a variety of solutions, technologies, and industries.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

 As an experienced technology professional, you will be responsible for:
   

  

* Designing and implementing complex, scalable, and secure AWS solutions tailored to customer needs
* Providing technical guidance and troubleshooting support throughout project delivery
* Collaborating with stakeholders to gather requirements and propose effective migration strategies
* Acting as a trusted advisor to customers on industry trends and emerging technologies
* Sharing knowledge within the organization through mentoring, training, and creating reusable artifacts


**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences: AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job below, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS? Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture - Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth - We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance - We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Experience in cloud architecture and implementation
* Experience in cloud infrastructure
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, related field, or equivalent experience
* Swedish language


**Preferred Qualifications**
* AWS experience preferred, with proficiency in a wide range of AWS services (e.g., EC2, S3, RDS, Lambda, IAM, VPC, CloudFormation)
* AWS Professional level certifications (e.g., Solutions Architect Professional, DevOps Engineer Professional) preferred
* Experience with automation and scripting (e.g., Terraform, Python)
* Knowledge of security and compliance standards (e.g., HIPAA, GDPR)
* Strong communication skills with the ability to explain technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
   

  

 Job ID: A3008424

title: Senior Fullstack Developer - Mortgage Product
description:
**Sambla Group is a fintech company with a clear goal – to make loans better for all. We need you, your ambition and your skills on our journey. We have become the fast-growing fintech company that we are today - bridging the gap between borrowers and lenders - thanks to all the 300+ amazing people who work here.**
**Our success is the result of the commitment to deliver the best customer journey and consumer finance products in the industry. Our vision is to democratize lending and empower customers to improve their personal finances. Through our well known brands such as Sambla, Advisa, Rahalaitos, Omalaina, Rahoitu and DigiFinans we support customers in consolidating and getting the best terms on their loans.**
 Now we need you, your ambition, and your expertise to join us as we continue to grow our product offering within Mortgage. You will be joining a small entrepreneurial team working closely within the dynamics of the larger organisation to provide a top-class mortgage comparison service to our customers.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are looking for a skilled and well-rounded senior developer who enjoys being engaged in the product development process and actively participating in discovery and prioritization, with an ability to balance delivery speed versus technical necessities. Your focus will be on designing, developing, and maintaining mission-critical backend services, while also contributing to the frontend to ensure seamless customer experiences.
   

  

 You will be working closely with your product manager, designers, and fellow developers to take full ownership of the product lifecycle. We expect you not to shy away from interacting with the full team and asking extensive questions as part of the continuous delivery process.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Collaborate in an empowered product team to shape technical solutions that solve real customer problems.
* Participate in all phases of the product development lifecycle, from concept to deployment.
* Design, build, and maintain scalable and secure backend services, including APIs, data models, and infrastructure, that drive customer-facing applications with a focus on performance, reliability, and maintainability.
* Analyse usage data and system performance to inform architectural and product decisions.
* Contribute to frontend development when needed, ensuring a cohesive experience across the stack.
* Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code.


**Qualifications**
* Proven track record as a developer with a minimum of 5 years of relevant experience, preferably with full-stack responsibility and high shipping frequency.
* Relevant Computer Science or Engineering Education (at least at BA level) or equivalent experience from work.
* Solid understanding of software development principles and methodologies.
* Strong collaboration and communication skills.
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Bonus if you have experience working with data science, analytics, or machine learning workflows—whether through building data pipelines, supporting experimentation, or integrating predictive models into production systems.


 We value experience or familiarity with our chosen technologies, such as Node.js, React, Docker, AWS, but for the right candidate who has shown curiosity in different technologies and architectures, we will provide the necessary learning environment to quickly get up to speed with our stack and ways of working.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* Business in mind & people at heart – we deliver results together and celebrate our achievements.
* A varied and challenging role in a multinational and highly innovative company, where we value the development of our employees
* We are strong believers in creating a fun workplace where people enjoy coming to work.
* A friendly culture with openness and respect for one another, with the possibility to influence and make a difference on society and people’s everyday lives.


 Please note!
   

  

 As part of our efforts to foster an unbiased recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to not include picture, gender, ethnicity, religion, disability, sexual orientation or age in your CV.
   

  

 Sambla Group is the new generation of brokers. Our ambition has always been the same - to challenge the banks’ offers so that our customers, regardless of the conditions, should always have the same opportunity to obtain the best possible loan solution. Sambla Group has grown to over 350 employees, established itself in Sweden, Norway, Finland and Denmark with offices in Sweden, Finland and Denmark.

title: Infrastructure Program Management Lead
description:
**About Us:**  

The Capgemini Group is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their businesses. We do this through unleashing human energy, imagination and ingenuity by harnessing the power of technology. By doing so we aim to achieve an inclusive and sustainable future. We are a responsible and diverse organization of nearly 336,000+ people. We have a presence in over 50 countries. Our rich 57-year heritage and deep industry expertise means that our clients trust us to address the entire breadth of their business needs. We provide strategy, design, operations and more, fueled by the fast evolving and innovative world of cloud, data, AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering and platforms.  

  

  



**Your career**  

Joining Capgemini is not just about starting a new job. It means becoming part of something bigger. We are a diverse collective of free-thinkers, entrepreneurs, and experts, who work together to unleash human energy, imagination and ingenuity through technology, with the goal of achieving an inclusive and sustainable future. People are at the heart of everything Capgemini does! You can grow your career exponentially by being part of innovative projects. You can gain knowledge and expertise through our extensive Learning & Development programs. Our inclusive, safe, healthy, and flexible work environment will bring out your best! Participating in our Corporate Social Responsibility and Sustainability initiatives will enable you to make positive social change and build a better world. And while you make a difference, you will also have fun. Get the future you want. With Capgemini.


**Job Description**
-------------------

**Group IT**  

Group IT delivers a comprehensive portfolio of technology services to one client: the Capgemini Group. We look after close to 336,000+ Capgemini employees in over 50 countries around the world, 24/7. We work with a huge variety of business lines, each requiring specific IT solutions and support and with people from diverse cultures, all collaborating with a common set of goals.
   

  

As a strategic partner, Group IT is committed to enabling business success, delivering innovative, human-centric solutions that inspire our people and their customers. With 4,000 employees, Group IT plays a major role in enabling all of the Capgemini Group’s employees, in 50+ countries around the world, to work productively, every day. Access to these diverse geographies, cultures and demands – serviced with innovative technologies – makes Group IT an exciting and rewarding place to work.
  

In support of the Capgemini Group and Group IT’s related goals and ambitions, Group IT is currently engaged in several major transformation programs. These programs represent an exciting opportunity to be involved in positioning and preparing Group IT – and Capgemini itself – to take on the challenges of the immediate future and the years ahead.


A career in Group IT is truly a unique opportunity: to make the most of your skills; learn and grow as part of a world-leading technology organization and collaborate with other talented colleagues to succeed in a constantly evolving environment. Those who join our transformation programs will contribute to the future of Group IT and of Capgemini in a very real sense.
  

Position Summary: We are seeking an experienced and dynamic Program Management Lead to oversee and drive the execution of complex Infrastructure programs and projects within our Global Infrastructure domain scope. The ideal candidate will possess a strong track record in program management, exceptional leadership skills, and the ability to navigate cross-functional teams to achieve strategic objectives. The Program Management Lead will ensure that programs are delivered on time, within scope, and within budget while meeting the highest quality standards.


**Key Responsibilities:**
-------------------------

1. Program Planning and Execution:
  

o Lead the planning and execution of multiple programs and projects simultaneously, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and objectives.
  

o Develop detailed program plans, including scope, timelines, resources, and budget, and manage changes as needed.
  

2. Stakeholder Management:
  

o Engage with key stakeholders, including executives, clients, and team members, to define program requirements and deliverables.
  

o Communicate program status, risks, and issues to stakeholders in a timely and effective manner.
  

3. Risk Management:
  

o Identify, assess, and mitigate program risks and issues to ensure successful program delivery.
  

o Develop contingency plans and ensure that any potential roadblocks are addressed proactively.
  

4. Budget and Resource Management:
  

o Oversee program budgets, ensuring efficient allocation of resources and adherence to financial constraints.
  

o Monitor program expenditures and provide financial reports to senior management.
  

5. Process Improvement:
  

o Continuously assess and improve program management processes and practices to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.
  

o Implement best practices and industry standards to drive program success.
  

6. Reporting and Documentation:
  

o Prepare and present regular program reports and updates to senior management and other stakeholders.
  

o Ensure comprehensive documentation of program activities, decisions, and outcomes.
  

  

**Qualifications:**  

* Bachelor’s degree in business, Project Management, Engineering, or a related field. Master’s degree or relevant certifications (e.g., PMP, PgMP) preferred.
* Minimum of 15 years of experience in program management or related roles, with a proven track record of successfully managing large and complex programs. Infrastructure program/project management experience would be a plus.
* Strong leadership skills with the ability to motivate and guide cross-functional global teams.
* Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
* Demonstrated experience in managing budgets and resources effectively.
* Proficiency in program management tools and software (e.g., MS Project, Jira, Asana).
* Ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic global environment, managing multiple priorities effectively.
* Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities.
**Application**
---------------

In this recruitment process, we review applications and hire on an ongoing basis. As part of our recruitment process, identity verification and background checks may occasionally be conducted.
  

About Capgemini
  

Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries.
  

  

With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
  

  

Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com
