title: Finance Product Specialist
description:
We are looking for a team-oriented and hands-on Finance Product Specialist to join our Head of CFO Office, located in Hyllie, Malmö. As a Finance Product Specialist, you will be the main responsible for our budget and forecasting application PBCS (Oracle Cloud EPM). You will maintain and develop the system and connected process in collaboration with controlling. In addition, you will also be subject matter expert for finance related applications and associated processes, guidelines, and instructions, including Business central, Coupa, and Twin.



You will drive improvements in the Finance area within ERP and integrated systems including associated routines and processes. You will also act as liaison between Finance and IT to agree on user requirement scope, delivery and service levels.



In this role you will be a true business partner and an important part of Ikano Bank’s Finance team and our vision to create possibilities for a better living by providing banking and financial services for the many people. We do it with different perspectives, natural curiosity and long-term focus. A unique chance for greater responsibility and future opportunities. Let’s achieve great things together!


**You will help us simplify finance for the many people**



You will be a part of our work to simplify finance for the many people and specific responsibilities for the role will include:


* Drive and implement improvements in PBCS.
* Designing and deploying infrastructure to support the long-term best solution for the system.
* User support in PBCS.
* Manage and execute business related and accounting master data changes in PBCS, the ERP-system and other integrated systems.
* Take part in projects for implementation of new or improved business system and product solutions.
* Ensure that legal or business requirements from Finance are translated into system change requests and to follow up that these are timely processed, effectively met, tested and implemented.
* Identify if changes in any of the Finance related applications effects integrated systems and if needed make sure that such changes in integrated systems are executed simultaneously.
* Ensure that sufficient internal controls are set up in the respective applications to follow Ikano compliance.
* Plan, perform and review tests during changes and upgrades in Finance applications.


You will also structure and analyze requirements to contribute to the development of long-term system solutions tailored to meet business requirements. As well as plan and conduct training sessions for the related applications within the Finance community.


**Are you the one for Ikano?**



We believe that you have good knowledge of and interest in programing PBCS or similar systems. You also have knowledge of finance procedures, practices and principles. Your computer literacy and technical aptitude is strong, as well as your business understanding.



As a person you are ambitious, hands-on and down-to-earth with a professional but humble approach. You enjoy analytical challenges, are a quick learner and well structured. You believe in the strength of teamwork and appreciate interacting with a heterogenous group of stakeholders where mutual respect is key. You are engaged and self-driven and enjoy working towards continuous improvement. Furthermore, you have the ability to create good relations and act in various environments.



When it comes to background, we believe that you have:


* Experience from working with PBCS or equivalent.
* At least three years of experience from working within IT development and/or finance or in similar.
* Experience from system management and solution design.
* Experience from project management.
* Experience from ERP-systems, preferable from Business central is considered a merit as well as BI-tools.


**Join us now – together we will find a better way**



Operating at the center of events, you will have an active role in various forums, represent us to external partners and create a great foundation for further development. This position is more than what meets the eye. You will get the chance to push boundaries and influence your daily work. All as part of a caring and open culture where we live our values, work hard, have fun and operate with a long-term perspective.



You will be part of Ikano Bank, where we create possibilities for a better living by providing banking and financial services. We do it with different perspectives, natural curiosity, and long-term focus. A unique chance for greater responsibility and future opportunities. Let’s achieve great things together.



The position is full-time permanent and the team is based in Malmö, but there is a possibility of working from our office in Sundbyberg as well.



If you have questions, please contact Andreas Svensson - andreas.svensson@ikano.se


**About us**



Ikano Bank offers simple and fair savings and loan products for consumers, sales support services for retailers, and leasing and factoring solutions for businesses. Ikano Bank has a presence in Sweden, Denmark, Finland, Norway, the UK, Poland, Germany and Austria. Ikano Bank is part of Ikano Group, who is an international group of companies operating in the areas of banking, insurance, production, real estate and retail. At Ikano, our vision is to create possibilities for better living. We do this by working together to create simple and meaningful solutions based on fair terms that bring value to our customers.

title: First line support
description:
#### **We are Mercur**

**Mercur Solutions is part of a software group focused on serving the Office of the CFO, alongside financial close SaaS provider Aico. With nearly 50 years of industry experience, Mercur is a recognized market leader in Sweden and is expanding rapidly across Europe. Our flagship product, Mercur Business Control®, enables our customers to drive better business performance through powerful tools for budgeting, forecasting, reporting, and analysis.**  

  

Today, we support over 300 customers across multiple industries and help them achieve operational efficiency through smart digital solutions.  

  

To continue supporting our growing customer base, we are now looking for a service-minded and tech-savvy First Line Support to join our Service Operations & Support team.

##### **About the role**

  

As a First Line Support, you will be the first point of contact for our customers when they need application support with our product, Mercur Business Control®. You’ll play a critical role in maintaining high levels of customer satisfaction by delivering timely and effective support. Your day-to-day will involve managing incoming requests through our ticketing system (Jira), solving issues where possible, and collaborating closely with our internal teams to escalate more complex matters.  

  

You will be part of our First Line Support team, working closely with one colleague to jointly handle all incoming support requests during our business hours. Together, you are responsible for ensuring smooth and professional service to our clients.  

  

This is an exciting opportunity for someone who enjoys solving problems, working with enterprise software, and supporting clients in a dynamic, collaborative environment.  

  

This is a 12-month temporary position starting on September 1, 2025. There is a strong possibility for extension or permanent employment for the right candidate.

##### **Key Responsibilities**

* Act as the first line of contact for customer inquiries and support requests
* Manage and resolve tickets using our case management system (Jira)
* Prioritize, analyze, and categorize incoming issues
* Communicate clearly with customers regarding status, resolution, and next steps
* Escalate more complex issues to 2nd line support, consultants, developers, or cloud operations
* Follow up on open cases and ensure timely closures

Contribute to internal documentation and continuous improvement of support processes  
* 

##### **What it takes to succeed in this role**

* Degree in IT, Computer Science, or similar (university or vocational/YH)
* 2+ years of experience in technical support, preferably in an application support role
* Strong problem-solving skills and ability to manage multiple priorities
* Comfortable using support and ticketing systems (Jira experience is a plus)
* Service-minded, structured, and eager to learn
* Enjoys working in a collaborative, on-site office environment
* Excellent communication skills in both Swedish and English, written and spoken

##### 

##### **What we offer**

* A monthly salary of 36 000 – 40 000 SEK, commensurate with experience and skillset.
* A dynamic, close-knit team within Service Operations & Support
* Structured onboarding and continuous training to support your development
* Clear growth paths — this role can be a stepping stone to consultant or developer roles
* You can work from one of our offices in Stockholm, Göteborg, or Malmö.

A culture of support, transparency, and fun — we care about each other and our customers  
* **Apply for the position!**  

  

This recruitment process is managed by our Recruitment Manager, Celina Dettner. If you have any questions, please feel free to contact Celina at celina.dettner@mercur.com or by phone at +46 76 125 62 73.  

  

**We warmly welcome your application!**

title: Sales Development Representative - Nordics
description:
**About Nerdio**

  

Nerdio adds value on top of the powerful capabilities in Azure Virtual Desktop, Windows 365, and Microsoft Intune by delivering hundreds of features that simplify management, ensure efficient operations, and lower Azure compute and storage costs by up to 80% via automation.

  

Leveraging Nerdio, partners can manage customers’ cloud environments through streamlined, multi-tenant, workflow-powered technology that allows them to create and grow cloud-based recurring revenues. Enterprise IT professionals can deliver and maintain a wide range of virtual Windows endpoints across hybrid workforces with ease and fine-tune end-user computing (EUC) approaches for maximum effectiveness using powerful monitoring and analytics capabilities.

  

We are a fast-moving, nimble company looking for individuals who are collaborative, empathetic, driven and who love to move at the speed of light. If you want to be part of the AVD and W365 transformation that Microsoft and Nerdio are leading, then we want to speak with you.

 **About the role**

  

As an Enterprise SDR, you will work with sales teams worldwide. You will engage with prospects to uncover opportunities where Nerdio can plug in and help companies deploy, manage, and optimize AVD and W365.

  

We need relationship builders with a strong understanding of VDI and EUC technologies to continue to grow our most prized partnership with Microsoft and its sales teams. You must be highly motivated and take an entrepreneurial approach to growing the relationship and revenue in addition to being a team player.

  

Our ideal SDR is highly skilled and has a partnership-selling approach.

  

You’ll be juggling lots of prospect engagements at the same time, so being organized and having a positive outlook are key. Don’t be afraid to ask those stupid questions; working together is how we roll here!

  

Integrity means everything to us, so you will need to do what you say you are going to do. This may involve coordinating with other departments in the wider team, using your excellent listening, written, and verbal communication skills!

 **What you'll do**

* Collaborate with the sales teams to identify AVD and W365 opportunities and align with Microsoft's sales teams, channel partners, and direct customers.
* Prospect with a focus on both inbound and outbound selling motions
* Achieve quarterly quota targets set by your leadership team
* Leverage sales engagement tools to generate pipeline via phone, emails, and social interactions.
* Use a partnership selling approach to uncover, qualify, and create AVD, W365 and Nerdio opportunities.
* Effectively communicate Nerdio's value proposition, capabilities, and benefits to potential customers.
* Work closely with the sales team to develop and execute strategies to meet sales targets.
* Juggle multiple leads simultaneously, maintaining organization and a positive outlook.
* Coordinate with other departments to ensure customer needs and projects are delivered successfully.
* Demonstrate integrity and follow through on commitments to ensure customer satisfaction.
* Continuously learn and stay up-to-date with industry trends, product knowledge, and sales techniques.

**Qualifications**

* A minimum of 1-3 years of experience in Sales or Business Development or a similar sales role, preferably in the technology industry, selling cloud computing, IT services, or software-as-a-service (SaaS).
* Familiarity with Microsoft Azure and other cloud technologies.
* Proven track record of achieving sales targets and quotas.
* Familiarity with sales techniques and processes, including lead generation, prospecting, qualifying leads, and creating deals.
* Strong communication to effectively convey the value proposition of the company's products or services.
* Ability to understand customer needs and identify opportunities for upselling or cross-selling.
* Experience with CRM software and other sales tools for managing and tracking customer interactions.
* Experience in conducting product demonstrations or presentations to potential customers.
* Proven expertise in partnership selling and building relationships with key stakeholders
* Highly motivated and self-driven with an entrepreneurial mindset.
* Fluent in English and either Danish, Swedish or Norwegian

**Benefits and Incentives**

* Competitive Base + Incentive Plan
* Stock Options
* Health and Welfare Plans\*
* Life and Disability Plans\*
* Retirement Plan\*
* Unlimited Flexible Paid Time Off, including your birthday off!
* Collaborative Team Culture
* Benefits for international employees, outside the US, vary by country.

  

Nerdio is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Nerdio is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

 **The pay range for this role is:**  

50,000 - 70,000 USD per year(Remote)

title: Financial Controller
description:
Do you thrive on analysis, precision, and improving financial processes? Join our dynamic Finance team as a Financial Controller and help drive business insight, reporting excellence, and operational improvements across the organization.

 **About your role**  

As our Financial Controller, you will play a central role in analysing revenues and costs, managing month- and quarter-end financial reporting, and supporting strategic decision-making through ad hoc analysis. You'll be deeply involved in consolidation activities, system administration, IFRS reporting, and continuous process improvements. This is a position with diverse responsibilities and significant impact across the Finance department and the rest of the organization.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Analyse revenues and costs to detect deviations and report insights to department managers, with a key focus on revenue and gross margin.
* Initiate and conduct ad hoc financial analyses to support management decisions.
* Consolidate monthly and quarterly financials using Aaro, including entities operating in multiple foreign currencies.
* Maintain and update internal and external financial reports in compliance with IFRS.
* Prepare financial schedules and statements for quarterly and annual reports, including ESEF tagging.
* Serve as system administrator and/or superuser in financial systems, ensuring data accuracy and tool efficiency.
* Lead or support ongoing improvements in financial processes and routines.
* Perform other accounting and reporting tasks as assigned.

  

Good to knows:

  

* We value work-life balance and have a hybrid work set-up (50/50)
* Full-time, permanent position
* Located in our HQ in Solna, Stockholm
* Our corporate language is English

  

Intregued?


Well, you should be!

 **Your Profile**

  

* University degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration, or equivalent.
* 3–5 years of experience in financial controlling, accounting, reporting, or financial analysis.
* Proven track record in month- and quarter-end closings, revenue/cost analysis, and consolidation processes, preferably within a listed company and across multiple currencies.
* Familiarity with IFRS reporting, ESEF, and annual report preparation is a strong plus.
* Hands-on experience with financial systems—preferably Aaro or similar consolidation/reporting tools.

Comfortable acting as a superuser or system administrator in finance-related tools.  
* We are looking for a highly analytical and detail-oriented individual with strong investigative skills and a structured approach to reporting and financial processes. You have advanced proficiency in Excel and financial modelling, along with excellent communication skills in both Swedish and English. A process-oriented mindset and a passion for continuous improvement are essential.  

  

You are proactive, self-driven, and take initiative to see tasks through independently. Flexibility and a willingness to support various functions within finance and accounting are key to succeeding in this role. We value a true team player—someone with a strategic outlook and a hands-on mentality who thrives in a collaborative environment.

**Our culture and beliefs:**


At Net Insight, **innovation**, **collaboration**, and **trust** are the cornerstones of our success. As one team, we are committed to delivering value to our customers, contributing to the growth and success of our company.


Together we create a dynamic and positive workplace where everyone is valued, engaged and empowered to make an impact

 *Want to learn more about our products and get to know our people? Make sure to check us out on* ***LinkedIn*** *and* ***Youtube****!*

**How to apply and information about the process**


It's super-easy!


Upload you CV , fill in the choice questions and upload relevant documentation of your choice - That's it.


We are recruiting continuously and we aim to get back to you as soon as possible.


Note: We do not offer relocation support at this time.


Note 2: Background check will be part of our recruitment process.

 **This is NET INSIGHT**

*Net Insight (Nasdaq: NETI B) provides the highest performing, most open video transport and media cloud technology for content providers as the industry standard for flexibility and service across live contribution, distribution and remote production media workflows.*

*For over 25 years, the world’s leading content owners, broadcasters, production companies, service providers and enterprises have trusted Net Insight’s Emmy Award winning Nimbra technology to guarantee media delivery. Today, Net InsiEmmy Awardght partners with hundreds of customers in over 70 countries to ensure media flows across managed and unmanaged IP networks, and the cloud – from anywhere, to everywhere. It enables customers to get the best from any mix of virtualized, cloud and IP technology and is the only platform to support all the major industry standards, protocols and clouds.*

  

For more information, please visit *www.**netinsight.net*

title: CRM Marketing Automation Specialist till Hemköp
description:
Roll: Försäljning marknadsföring och produktutveckling
Typ av tjänst: Vikariat
Placering:
Stockholm, Stockholms Län, Sverige
Välkommen till Hemköp, vi erbjuder en arbetsplats med familjär stämning och tydliga gemensamma värderingar - kärleken till mat genomsyrar allt vi gör.

  


Hemköp erbjuder en jämställd arbetsmiljö och hos oss får du en bra balans mellan jobb, fritid och familj.

  


För Hemköp är mångfald en styrka. Medarbetarnas kunskaper, kompetenser och perspektiv skapar nya möjligheter och bättre beslut. Vi uppmuntrar därför en mångfald av sökande till alla tjänster.

  


**Bli en av oss**
-----------------



Vi söker nu en vikarierande Marketing Automation Specialist för ett vikariat med start så snart som möjligt fram till september 2026 med eventuell möjlighet till förlängning. Klubb Hemköp, där vi ser en stark tillväxt och behöver bibehålla och förstärka vår position på marknaden tillsammans med övriga inom CRM tar vi oss vidare mot målet att bli Sveriges bästa kundklubb.

  



I rollen som Marketing Automation Specialist arbetar då både operativt och strategiskt med att utveckla vår digitala klubbkommunikation för att öka relevans, engagemang och lojalitet med fokus på mail och sms. Du har som mål att öka lönsamhet och kundlojalitet, genom att optimera innehållet och ansvara för strategin.

  



I rollen tillhör du Hemköps marknadsavdelning och ingår i CRM-teamet där du rapporterar till Chef CRM. Vi sitter på Torsplan i samma hus som Axfoods huvudkontor i centrala Stockholm och tillämpar en hybrid arbetsplats med möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån 1-2 dagar i veckan.

  



För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du:

  


* Minst 5 års erfarenhet och kompetens inom Salesforce Marketing Cloud.
* Äger, driver och definierar kundresor och innehåll för att uppnå mål och leverera enligt strategisk inriktning.
* Samarbetar tätt med vårt kreativa team och externa partners.
* Planera och skapar all kommunikation inklusive veckovisa utskick i vårt CRM system Salesforce till våra medlemmar.
* Följer upp och analyserar relevanta nyckeltal för att mäta effekten av genomförd kommunikation och vidareutveckla all vår kommunikation.
* Kommer med förslag på förbättringar och utvecklingsmöjligheter.
* Projektleder samtliga utskick mot kund- A/B tester, content etc samt vid behov leda utvecklingsprojekt kopplat till kanalerna.
* Ta fram årsplan för mail kanalen.
**Vem är du?**
--------------



Vi tror och ser gärna att du har tidigare erfarenhet, gärna inom marketing automation. Vi ser gärna att du har en relevant utbildning inom marknad eller liknande. För att lyckas i rollen och att ta dig an kommunikationen till våra medlemmar både digitalt och postalt tror vi att du har 3-5 års kunskap och erfarenhet från flera av dessa områden:

  


* Arbetat minst 3-5 år i Marketing cloud med goda kunskaper av marknadsföring genom e-mail.
* Erfarenhet av personalisering och segmentering i e-post kanalen.
* Meriterande är kunskap inom MarTech
* Van att projektleda och skapa kommunikation för flera CRM kanaler
* Erfarenhet av att göra veckovisa utskick i Salesforce eller liknande CRM system.
* Förståelse för konverterande metodiker som driver försäljning och kundlojalitet
* Förståelse för omnikanals strategi och kunna agera på interna och externa kundinsikter

  



Vidare har du förmågan att hålla koll på detaljerna samtidigt som du kan behålla ett övergripande perspektiv. Du har en hög förståelse för hur vi kan möta våra medlemmar i olika kanaler och du stimuleras av att förbättra kundupplevelsen genom löpande optimering.



Som person har du ett inre driv, uppskattar förändringar, har en vilja att skapa resultat och nå både egna och gruppens gemensamma mål. Du är ständigt intresserad av att lära dig nya saker som kan hjälpa dig framåt i din roll.

  

Om du vill veta mer om vad tjänsten innebär, kontakta Joel Bergman, joel.bergman@hemkop.se. Vi ser gärna att du vid intresse skickar din ansökan så snart som möjligt, då tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas före sista ansökningsdag den 2025-06-19. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via våra jobbsidor.

  


*För att ta reda på om just du är den vi söker så innehåller vår rekryteringsprocess både tester och intervjuer.*


*Vi gör även bakgrundskontroll vid samtliga rekryteringar. Läs mer:* Så går det till när du söker jobb inom Axfood

  


Observera att vi inte under denna rekryteringsprocess kommer be dig logga in med ditt Bank-id eller scanna någon QR-kod. Vid frågor kontakta Medarbetarsupporten på jobb@axfood.se.

  


**Om Hemköp**


Vi inom Hemköp och Tempo är stolta över att för tredje året i rad ha utsetts till "Årets Karriärföretag" när Sveriges främsta arbetsgivare listas av Karriärföretagen. Utmärkelsen delas ut till de arbetsgivare i Sverige som anses vara mest attraktiva för studenter och yrkesverksamma att göra karriär på.

  


Vi är även stolta över att vi 2023 blev utsedda till “Årets Employer Branding-företag” av Universum.

  


På Hemköp arbetar vi mot ett gemensamt mål att vara ledande inom hållbarhet genom att erbjuda alla matälskare ett godare sortiment, verka för en godare miljö, inspirera till godare vanor och vara en godare aktör.

title: Operations Technician
description:
**The team, position & mission:**  

Our Operations Center is at the center of most of what is going on at Digital Services business line of Orange Business. The primary goal for Operation Center is to handle incoming tickets according to the respective process, communicate with customers and involved stakeholders. Troubleshoot and/or escalate incidents and events to ensure that services are back into normal production as fast as possible. Handle standard changes and other predefined changes.


In the role as Operations Technician, you will perform day-to-day activities in system and application management for our customers as well as internally. The main task is to ensure 24/7 operations of all systems and respond to tickets and phone calls generated by our monitoring tool and our customers. In Operation Center you will handle and be responsible for a variety of tickets and tasks, such as:

* User and access management
* Network related changes
* System and application update/upgrades
* Troubleshooting any operational disturbance
* 24/7 on call service


The Swedish Operation Center team consists of 8 experienced Operations Technicians ready to welcome you into a team with a common passion for technology, who always strive to learn more through collaboration and self-studies! Some start in Operation Center after completing relevant IT education at university or vocational education whilst others have a couple of years relevant working experience before joining us.


The Operation Center department is a great place to start your journey with Orange Business, Digital Services business line to learn more about our customers and technologies to develop and eventually take the next step in your career internally. Today’s Operations Technicians are our future System Engineers, Technical Account Managers and Cloud Engineers.

**As an ideal candidate for this position you have:**

* Relevant work experience within this area, for example a service desk function, NOC, etc and/or relevant IT education at university or vocational education level
* Be comfortable in a server environment, (Linux/Unix and/or Windows)
* Very good verbal and written communication skills in both English and Swedish

**It is not a requirement, but other preferred qualifications would be:**

* Experience of Powershell, Python or similar
* Experience within security and network
* Knowledge of Kubernetes or other container systems

**What we offer you:**

* Hybrid ways of working with access to our modern & collaborative office in Stockholm
* We may work with tomorrow’s technology, but at our core we are a people-oriented organization and we are proud to have our Great Place to Work certification
* An open and inclusive culture, that enables us to reach our full potential
* A community of experts - as Digital Natives, we put innovation at the heart of our expertise
* Read more about the benefits we offer here.

**About Orange Business:**


Orange Business is a leading network and digital integrator company with offices in 65 countries worldwide, and part of the Orange Group.


Digital Services, a business line of Orange Business is a newly created division within Orange Business. In Europe the business line consists of approximately 1500 people distributed across 10 countries. We are digital natives, with innovation at the core of our business, which makes us a reliable partner close to our customers. Our joint mission is to help innovate, drive and lead them in their digital transformation challenges and business strategies in key digital domains, including Cloud, Customer Experience, Digital Workspace and Data & AI. As an agile and fast-moving digital business partner, the business line offers trusted end-to-end solutions and products that help businesses in a wide range of industries in the private and public sector transform their operations, enhance customer experience, and drive growth.


With our digital expertise, we are a strategic partner of Orange Business objectives to be a leading network and digital integrator with our team as a key growth engine.

**The process:**  

We screen applications on an ongoing basis, with the aim of conducting conversations and interviews as we receive them.


Interested but feel that you don´t match the criteria 100%? We encourage you to apply anyway! We believe in the potential of diverse skill sets, perspectives and individuality. We want to encourage everyone to be their authentic selves and your unique capabilities may align perfectly with our team's needs! Your perfect match might be the next job we are announcing, so why not have a head start and apply now!


Are you interested to read more about Orange Business? Visit our Website or follow our LinkedIn account.


**Contrat**
-----------

CDI

title: Senior AI Security Technology Specialist
description:
Stockholm,Stockholm,Sweden

+1 more
Job ID**767404**
Grow with us  

Ericsson is a world-leading provider of telecommunications equipment and services to mobile and fixed network operators. Over 1,000 networks in more than 180 countries use Ericsson equipment, and more than 40 percent of the world's mobile traffic passes through Ericsson networks. Using innovation to empower people, business and society, Ericsson is working towards the Networked Society: a world connected in real time that will open opportunities to create freedom, transform society and drive solutions to some of our planet’s greatest challenges.

 **Exciting Opportunity**

  

Join our Security Technologies unit within the Ericsson Product Security organization - a global hub for cybersecurity excellence within the CTO office. As a prime driver in security and privacy at Ericsson, we work collaboratively with Business Areas, Market Areas and Group Functions - fully end-to-end.

 **Role Overview**

  

As a Senior AI Security Technology Specialist, you will play a pivotal role in shaping Ericsson’s security technology landscape. Your responsibilities will include maintaining awareness of our current security posture, identifying technology improvement opportunities, and steering our long-term security strategy with a focus on AI. Collaboration is key: you will work alongside technology specialists across Ericsson and interface with external partners and vendors. Additionally, you will represent Ericsson in international security communities and forums, offering a unique opportunity to expand your expertise and network with industry leaders.

  

If you are driven to make a global impact and thrive on tackling complex challenges, this is the perfect opportunity for you!

  

Join our Team **Key Responsibilities**

* Serve as the subject matter expert on AI Security across the organization, providing strategic insights and guidance to ensure robust security measures are in place.
* Define and establish security requirements and design principles for AI, ensuring alignment with industry standards and best practices.
* Analyze global regulations and industry standards with a focus on AI security, advising on necessary adaptations for Ericsson's product portfolio to meet evolving legal and ethical requirements.
* Support the integration of AI security technologies in products, solutions, and services developed across Ericsson.
* Drive competence development in AI security; teach, coach, and mentor colleagues on various aspects of the domain.
* Provide technical guidance to advance Generative AI Risk Management and Governance processes.
* Support Business and Market Areas in security-related engagements.
* Demonstrate technological innovation leadership and support standardization efforts.
* Represent Ericsson internally and externally in AI security-related forums and disseminate knowledge at industry events.
* Conduct technical Proof-of-Concepts (PoCs) in AI security.

 **Qualifications**

* A passion for driving change on a global scale.
* A natural curiosity and ambition to learn and grow.
* Proven ability to drive cross-functional collaboration in an international setting and influence across organizations.
* Excellent presentation and communication skills in English.
* Proficiency in customer interaction.
* Demonstrable experience in security technologies, with a minimum of 5 years in IT or telecom.
* Solid knowledge of telecom security.
* Strong background and proven experience in AI technologies and their security implications.
* Familiarity with AI standardization efforts and technical specifications.
* Understanding of securing AI pipelines in cloud deployments, MLOps, and MLSecOps.
* Knowledge of responsible and trustworthy AI governance.

 **Preferred Experience**

* Expertise in cloud security.
* Familiarity with cloud-native network functions, telecom networks, nodes, and architecture.
* Experience with hardware and software security.
* Leadership in security technology.
* Insight into the security business landscape, including key players, trends, and market dynamics.
* Experience in business development and innovation.

  

Approved security clearance is required for the position and will be carried out for the selected applicant.


(Security Clearance Act 726/2014)

  

!

 **Why join Ericsson?**

  

At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build never seen before solutions to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.

  

Location: Jorvas, Finland or Stockholm, Sweden

title: Industrial Network & Cybersecurity Architect
description:
**Join Our Team: Seeking a Industrial Network & Cybersecurity Architect**
-------------------------------------------------------------------------


The energy transition is accelerating, and battery energy storage systems are at the heart of making it work. At Capture Energy, we’re building the infrastructure to support a smarter, more flexible, and secure electricity system — and we’re looking for an experienced **Industrial Network & Cybersecurity Architect** to join us on that mission.


Founded in 2023, Capture Energy is a fast-growing company with 31 team members across the Nordics. Our ambition is to lead the Nordic and European market in battery energy storage — an area experiencing rapid growth as grids decarbonize and electrification surges.


As a small but agile team, we do things differently. That means fewer silos, faster decisions, and more room for meaningful impact. We bring good energy to everything we do — from the systems we deliver to the people we work with.

### **About The Role**


We are currently seeking to hire a Industrial Network & Cybersecurity Architect to join our dynamic team. This opportunity is ideal for a candidate who is not only responsible and independent but also has a driven mindset. You’ll be joining our Automation team, working with the in-house developed **Capture Controller** — the brain behind our battery energy storage systems. You’ll play a key role in strengthening our capabilities in network architecture and cybersecurity as we scale. This role is central to ensuring our systems are secure, robust, and ready for the future.

### **Work assignments and Key responsibilities**

  

**1. Network Architecture & Design**  
* + Design, document, and maintain secure network architectures for industrial energy systems (OT), including site-level and system-level topologies.
	+ Define best practices for segmentation, remote access, firewalling, and industrial protocol handling (e.g. Modbus, MQTT, OPC UA, IEC 104, IEC 61850).
**2. Cybersecurity Strategy & Implementation**  
* + Define and enforce security standards for both OT and IT environments, including threat modeling, access control, patch management, and intrusion detection.
	+ Guide implementation of cybersecurity measures aligned with industry standards (e.g. IEC 62443, ISO 27001, NIS2).
**3. Delivery Support & Project Involvement**  
* + Participate early in new customer projects to ensure secure and robust network and system configurations from day one.
	+ Support commissioning and validation of secure connectivity for energy sites.
**4. Cross-Functional Collaboration**  
* + Work closely with the automation, software, and product teams to define secure interfaces between cloud, control systems, and field equipment.
	+ Act as internal advisor and educator on OT/IT security for engineering, operations, and delivery teams.
**5. Supplier & Partner Coordination**  
* + Evaluate and advise on network and security aspects of third-party equipment and supplier integrations (e.g. aggregators, SCADA platforms, routers).
	+ Develop secure integration patterns for partners and remote access solutions.<
**6. Continuous Improvement & Monitoring**  
* + Develop internal processes for network and security audits.
	
	Stay ahead of cybersecurity trends, vulnerabilities, and regulatory developments relevant to BESS and critical infrastructure.  
	+

#### **Skills and Qualifications**

* Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Industrial IT, or equivalent hands-on experience
* 5+ years of experience in industrial network design and/or OT cybersecurity
* Solid understanding of OT/ICS cybersecurity frameworks (e.g. IEC 62443, ISO 27001) and secure network architecture
* Familiarity with industrial communication protocols (Modbus, MQTT, OPC UA, IEC 104, IEC 61850)
* Experience with firewalls, VPNs, and segmented network configurations in industrial environments
* Background in energy systems, critical infrastructure, or automation (e.g. SCADA, substations, BESS) is a strong plus
* Strong collaboration skills and ability to work cross-functionally with engineering, product, and delivery teams

##### **Why Join Us?**


At Capture Energy, you’ll join a passionate and collaborative team driving the energy transition forward. We offer an environment that values initiative, encourages learning, and supports your professional growth. As a fast-growing company, we believe our people are our greatest strength — and we’re committed to making sure every team member feels empowered, appreciated, and inspired.

##### **We offer**

* A purpose-driven and people-focused workplace
* Competitive salary
* Generous wellness allowance to support your health and lifestyle
* Comprehensive pension and private health insurance

###### **Application Process**


If you believe you have the responsibility, independence, and drive we are looking for, please submit your CV and a covering letter detailing your suitability for the role. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace.


We look forward to hearing from you and possibly welcoming you to our team.

###### **About the company**

**Capture Energy, founded in 2023, is on a mission to become a leading provider of large-scale battery energy storage systems (BESS).**  

What sets us apart is our end-to-end approach — we support our clients throughout every stage of their BESS projects. This is made possible by our advanced in-house technologies — the **Capture Controller** and **Capture Cloud** — as well as our experienced team of experts who bring deep industry knowledge and hands-on execution to every project.


Visit our website for more information: www.captureenergy.eu

title: Automation Engineer
description:
**Join Our Team: Seeking an Automation Engineer**
-------------------------------------------------


The energy transition is accelerating, and battery energy storage systems are at the heart of making it work. At Capture Energy, we’re building the infrastructure to support a smarter, more flexible, and secure electricity system — and we’re looking for an experienced **Automation Engineer** to join us on that mission.


Founded in 2023, Capture Energy is a fast-growing company with 31 team members across the Nordics. Our ambition is to lead the Nordic and European market in battery energy storage — an area experiencing rapid growth as grids decarbonize and electrification surges.


As a small but agile team, we do things differently. That means fewer silos, faster decisions, and more room for meaningful impact. We bring good energy to everything we do — from the systems we deliver to the people we work with.

### **About The Role**


We’re looking for an **Automation Engineer** to join our growing team at Capture Energy. In this hands-on role, you’ll support the delivery of our battery energy storage systems from design through to operation – including testing, commissioning, and ongoing service. You’ll be the bridge between engineering and operations, sometimes representing the team on-site when needed.


This role is well-suited for someone who wants to learn and grow in the sustainable energy transition space. You’ll work closely with experienced engineers and gain exposure to real-world energy systems, with the opportunity to take on more responsibility over time.


### **Work assignments and Key responsibilities**

* ##### **1.** **Project Support from Design to Delivery**
* + Participate in design reviews for control systems and automation architecture
	+ Prepare and configure PLC/HMI software (primarily Beckhoff)
	+ Ensure smooth handover from engineering to operations
* ##### **2.** **Testing, Commissioning & Site Work**
* + Support testing, commissioning, and validation of automation systems
	+ Perform site acceptance tests (SATs) and remote diagnostics
	+ Travel to sites to provide hands-on technical support during delivery and service
* ##### **3.** **Operations & Troubleshooting**
* + Act as technical point of contact for operations and service teams
	+ Troubleshoot automation-related issues and perform root cause analysis
	+ Maintain system performance and support uptime improvements
* ##### **4.** **System Maintenance & Documentation**
* + Maintain and update automation configurations and documentation
	+ Ensure version control and traceability of changes to control systems
	+ Contribute to long-term maintainability of delivered systems
* ##### **5.** **Quality & Compliance**
* + Uphold safety, cybersecurity, and reliability standards in automation solutions
	+ Ensure compliance with Capture Energy’s technical and quality requirements
	+ Coordinate with suppliers and partners to resolve technical issues
* ##### **6.** **Continuous Improvement & Feedback**
* + Identify process improvements based on project and field learning
	+ Provide structured feedback to engineering and product development teams
	+ Help shape internal tools, standards, and best practices

#### **Skills and Qualifications**

* BSc or MSc in Automation, Electrical Engineering, Control Systems, or a related field
* Experience with PLC programming, preferably using Beckhoff (TwinCAT)
* Understanding of industrial networking protocols (e.g., Modbus, CAN, OPC UA)
* Hands-on experience with testing, commissioning, and site acceptance of automation systems
* Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills in real-world environments
* ️ Ability to maintain structured documentation and manage configuration changes
* ️ Willingness to travel to project sites across the Nordics and Europe
* Team player with a proactive, learning-oriented mindset

##### **Why Join Us?**


At Capture Energy, you’ll join a passionate and collaborative team driving the energy transition forward. We offer an environment that values initiative, encourages learning, and supports your professional growth. As a fast-growing company, we believe our people are our greatest strength — and we’re committed to making sure every team member feels empowered, appreciated, and inspired.

##### **We offer**

* A purpose-driven and people-focused workplace
* Competitive salary
* Generous wellness allowance to support your health and lifestyle
* Comprehensive pension and private health insurance

###### **Application Process**


If you believe you have the responsibility, independence, and drive we are looking for, please submit your CV and a covering letter detailing your suitability for the role. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace.


We look forward to hearing from you and possibly welcoming you to our team.

###### **About the company**

**Capture Energy, founded in 2023, is on a mission to become a leading provider of large-scale battery energy storage systems (BESS).**  

What sets us apart is our end-to-end approach — we support our clients throughout every stage of their BESS projects. This is made possible by our advanced in-house technologies — the **Capture Controller** and **Capture Cloud** — as well as our experienced team of experts who bring deep industry knowledge and hands-on execution to every project.


Visit our website for more information: www.captureenergy.eu

title: Säljande konsultchef
company_industry: Hospitals and Health Care, Staffing and Recruiting, and Human Resources Services
description:
**Konsultchef med fokus på bemanning inom vård och omsorg i Norge & nya affärsområden** 




  





 Vi söker en engagerad och driven
 **konsultchef** 
 för att leda och utveckla bemanningslösningar inom vård och omsorg. Vi har särskilt fokus på läkar- och sjuksköterskebemanning i Norge, där efterfrågan är stor och möjligheterna att göra skillnad för både personal och verksamheter är betydande. Erfarenhet av bemanning i Norge är därför starkt meriterande. Vi breddar också vårt fokus och ser potential i nya yrkeskategorier, såsom coacher, ledarutvecklare, psykologer och socionomer och andra professioner inom vård och omsorg.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som konsultchef blir du en nyckelspelare i vår strävan att möta behovet av kvalificerad personal och långsiktiga lösningar. Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden inkluderar:
 


* Att etablera och underhålla långsiktiga kundrelationer.
* Att balansera nykundsbearbetning med rekrytering av sjuksköterskor, läkare och andra vård- och omsorgsprofessioner.
* Att ansvara för att konsulter matchas till rätt uppdrag och säkerställa att de trivs och presterar väl.
* Att hantera avtal och säkerställa att våra lösningar möter krav från offentliga upphandlingar.



  





**Din bakgrund** 




 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi gärna att du har:
 


* Erfarenhet av kvalificerad tjänsteförsäljning med dokumenterat goda resultat.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med bemanning, gärna i Norge, är starkt meriterande.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med olika professioner och kompetensområden i det vi önskar bredda oss mot är meriterande
* God förmåga att organisera och hantera många parallella processer.
* En utbildningsbakgrund inom exempelvis ekonomi, försäljning, marknadsföring, HR eller vård är meriterande.
* Erfarenhet av system som Salesforce är ett plus.



  





**Vi erbjuder** 



* En tillsvidareanställning med fast och rörlig lön.
* Tjänstepension, privat sjukförsäkring och generöst friskvårdsbidrag.
* Flexibilitet med möjlighet att arbeta både på distans och från kontoret.
* Vidareutbildning och möjlighet till personlig utveckling.



  





*Vi använder test som ett första steg i rekryteringen för att säkerställa en fördomsfri och rättvis process som fokuserar på din potential.*

title: Interim Lokalstrateg inom offentlig sektor
description:
📢

 Vi söker just nu en erfaren
