 på interimsbasis – och vi behöver dig
 **nu** 
 . Har du flerårig erfarenhet av strategisk lokalförsörjning och är redo att hoppa in omgående? Då vill vi prata med dig idag!
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som Lokalstrateg kommer du att ha en nyckelroll i att säkerställa en effektiv, hållbar och strategisk användning av lokaler. Ditt fokus kommer att ligga på att planera, analysera och optimera kommunens lokalförsörjning i samverkan med verksamheter, fastighetsägare och andra intressenter.
   

  

**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**
 🏢
 **Lokalförsörjningsplanering** 
 – Identifiera, analysera och optimera kommunens och förvaltningarnas lokalbehov på kort och lång sikt.
   

  

 🤝
 **Samverkan & Dialog -** 
 Samverka med kommunens förvaltningar och bolag för att utveckla och förvalta lokalresursplaner både på kort och lång sikt.
   

  

 📈
 **Verksamhetsutveckling** 
 – Bidra till att utveckla och sätta rutiner, processer och arbetssätt.
   

  

 📊
 **Samordna och analysera** 
 lokalbehov och lokalkapacitet, inklusive fastighetsekonomiska konsekvenser av olika lokalalternativ.
   

  

**🏙️ Väga samman** 
 stadens olika perspektiv vid lokalförändringar.
   

  

 📑
 **Bereda beslutsunderlag** 
 till kommunstyrelsen i strategiska lokalärenden.
   

  

 📞
 **Bistå chefer** 
 i kontakten med fastighetsägare.
   

  

 ✍️
 **Förhandla och upprätta avtal** 
 avseende inhyrda lokaler. 🤝📄
   

  

 🌍
 **Leda lokalförsörjningsforum** 
 genom att bevaka omvärldsutveckling och delta i nätverk.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som har**
 ✅ Högskoleexamen inom ekonomi och/eller juridik, gärna med inriktning mot fastighetsområdet, eller annan relevant utbildning i kombination med erfarenhet som bedöms likvärdig.
   

  

 ✅ Flerårig erfarenhet som Lokalstrateg eller i en liknande roll.
   

  

 ✅ Erfarenhet av lokalförsörjningsplanering inom offentlig verksamhet, med fokus på kommunalförvaltning.
   

  

 ✅ God analytisk, strategisk och kommunikativ förmåga
   

  

 ✅ Förmåga att skapa och implementera strukturer samt säkerställa att rutiner efterlevs
   

  

 Meriterande
   

  

 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet från en politiskt styrd organisation
   

  

**Praktisk info**
 📍
 **Start** 
 : Omgående
   

  

 📍
 **Uppdrag** 
 : Interim
   

  

 📍
 **Ort** 
 : Stockholm

title: Affärsområdesansvarig konsultchef
description:
**En affärsnära roll för dig som vill bygga långsiktiga partnerskap i
   

  

 fastighetsbranschen**
 Hos Estatement arbetar vi nära våra kunder i fastighetssektorn för att skapa skräddarsydda konsultlösningar med kvalitet och långsiktighet i fokus. Vi kombinerar specialistkompetens med djup marknadsförståelse – och vi tror på relationer framför volym.
   

  

 Nu söker vi en konsultchef som vill fortsätta bygga det förtroende vi står för – och som ser det som självklart att både driva affärer och utveckla människor. Rollen är central för vår fortsatta tillväxt och på sikt ta ett övergripande ansvar för vårt interimserbjudande.
   

  

 Ditt uppdrag
   

  

 Som konsultchef hos oss får du en nyckelroll i hela affärsrelationen – från första kontakt till etablerad leverans. Du arbetar rådgivande, med lyhördhet och affärsmässig skärpa i varje steg – oavsett om det handlar om att matcha rätt kompetens, stötta våra konsulter eller identifiera nya affärsmöjligheter.
   

  

 Du kommer bland annat att:
   

  

* Identifiera och utveckla affärer inom fastighetsbranschen
* Bygga och underhålla långsiktiga, förtroendefulla kundrelationer
* Ansvara för konsultbemanning, konsultvård och kontinuerlig dialog
* Driva merförsäljning och bidra till nykundsbearbetning
* Vara delaktig i affärsstrategi, paketering och bolagsutveckling
* Ha möjlighet att utvecklas mot ett utökat ansvar för affärsområdet Interim
* Ha möjlighet till delägarskap – för dig som vill vara med och bygga långsiktigt


 Vi tror att du:
   

  

* Har erfarenhet från fastighetsbranschen, gärna inom ett fastighetsbolag.
* I andra hand erfarenhet från konsultförsäljning, rekrytering eller affärsutveckling – inom fastighet.
* Har arbetat med eller nära konsulter och förstår dynamiken i konsultaffären
* Trivs med att arbeta självständigt, men ser stort värde i samarbete
* Har en god förståelse för fastighetsbranschen, dess behov och aktörer
* Har ett långsiktigt tänkande och bygger förtroende genom närvaro, lyhördhet och kunskap
* Ser det som naturligt att delta i försäljningsarbetet och är bekväm med att initiera och utveckla affärer


 Hos oss får du:
   

  

* En nyckelroll i ett bolag som växer organiskt med kvalitet i fokus
* Möjlighet att påverka arbetssätt, erbjudande och kundrelationer
* Tillgång till ett starkt nätverk och vår community av ca. 20 seniora konsulter med gedigen erfarenhet från branschen som värdefulla resurser i vårt erbjudande.
* En företagskultur som bygger på öppenhet, erfarenhet och professionalism
* Möjlighet till partnerskap – för dig som vill växa med bolaget


 Vill du arbeta i ett bolag där du får utrymme att ta ansvar, skapa resultat och bidra till något långsiktigt och hållbart? Då ser vi fram emot att höra från dig.
   

  

**Välkommen till Estatement.**

title: Automation Engineer
description:
Join Our Team: Seeking an Automation Engineer
   

  

 The energy transition is accelerating, and battery energy storage systems are at the heart of making it work. At Capture Energy, we’re building the infrastructure to support a smarter, more flexible, and secure electricity system — and we’re looking for an experienced
 **Automation Engineer** 
 to join us on that mission.
   

  

 Founded in 2023, Capture Energy is a fast-growing company with 31 team members across the Nordics. Our ambition is to lead the Nordic and European market in battery energy storage — an area experiencing rapid growth as grids decarbonize and electrification surges.
   

  

 As a small but agile team, we do things differently. That means fewer silos, faster decisions, and more room for meaningful impact. We bring good energy to everything we do — from the systems we deliver to the people we work with.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We’re looking for an
 **Automation Engineer** 
 to join our growing team at Capture Energy. In this hands-on role, you’ll support the delivery of our battery energy storage systems from design through to operation – including testing, commissioning, and ongoing service. You’ll be the bridge between engineering and operations, sometimes representing the team on-site when needed.
   

  

 This role is well-suited for someone who wants to learn and grow in the sustainable energy transition space. You’ll work closely with experienced engineers and gain exposure to real-world energy systems, with the opportunity to take on more responsibility over time.
   

  

 Work assignments and Key responsibilities
 **2.
 **Testing, Commissioning & Site Work****
**3.
 **Operations & Troubleshooting****
**4.
 **System Maintenance & Documentation****
**5.
 **Quality & Compliance****
**6.
 **Continuous Improvement & Feedback****
* Project Support from Design to Delivery
+ Participate in design reviews for control systems and automation architecture
+ Prepare and configure PLC/HMI software (primarily Beckhoff)
+ Ensure smooth handover from engineering to operations
+ Support testing, commissioning, and validation of automation systems
+ Perform site acceptance tests (SATs) and remote diagnostics
+ Travel to sites to provide hands-on technical support during delivery and service
+ Act as technical point of contact for operations and service teams
+ Troubleshoot automation-related issues and perform root cause analysis
+ Maintain system performance and support uptime improvements
+ Maintain and update automation configurations and documentation
+ Ensure version control and traceability of changes to control systems
+ Contribute to long-term maintainability of delivered systems
+ Uphold safety, cybersecurity, and reliability standards in automation solutions
+ Ensure compliance with Capture Energy’s technical and quality requirements
+ Coordinate with suppliers and partners to resolve technical issues
+ Identify process improvements based on project and field learning
+ Provide structured feedback to engineering and product development teams
+ Help shape internal tools, standards, and best practices


**Skills And Qualifications**
* 🎓 BSc or MSc in Automation, Electrical Engineering, Control Systems, or a related field
* 💻 Experience with PLC programming, preferably using Beckhoff (TwinCAT)
* 🌐 Understanding of industrial networking protocols (e.g., Modbus, CAN, OPC UA)
* 🔧 Hands-on experience with testing, commissioning, and site acceptance of automation systems
* 🧩 Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills in real-world environments
* 🗂️ Ability to maintain structured documentation and manage configuration changes
* ✈️ Willingness to travel to project sites across the Nordics and Europe
* 🤝 Team player with a proactive, learning-oriented mindset


**Why Join Us?**
 At Capture Energy, you’ll join a passionate and collaborative team driving the energy transition forward. We offer an environment that values initiative, encourages learning, and supports your professional growth. As a fast-growing company, we believe our people are our greatest strength — and we’re committed to making sure every team member feels empowered, appreciated, and inspired.
   

  

**We offer**
* A purpose-driven and people-focused workplace
* Competitive salary
* Generous wellness allowance to support your health and lifestyle
* Comprehensive pension and private health insurance


 Application Process
   

  

 If you believe you have the responsibility, independence, and drive we are looking for, please submit your CV and a covering letter detailing your suitability for the role. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you and possibly welcoming you to our team.
   

  

**About The Company**
**Capture Energy, founded in 2023, is on a mission to become a leading provider of large-scale battery energy storage systems (BESS).**
 What sets us apart is our end-to-end approach — we support our clients throughout every stage of their BESS projects. This is made possible by our advanced in-house technologies — the
 **Capture Controller** 
 and
 **Capture Cloud** 
 — as well as our experienced team of experts who bring deep industry knowledge and hands-on execution to every project.
   

  

 Visit our website for more information: www.captureenergy.eu

title: Service Delivery Engineer Unified Communication & Collaboration
description:
We are excited to welcome a new colleague to our Unified Communications and Collaboration (UC&C) team! Together with our global team, your mission will be to deliver an outstanding customer experience by providing reliable, secure, and compliant Telephony, Call Center, and Collaboration services that support DLL’s growth ambitions.
   

  

 As a successful candidate, you’ll play a crucial role in maintaining, installing, and configuring our systems, all while ensuring our customers’ business needs are met with top priority.
   

  

 You will understand the underlying infrastructure and systems that powers our telephony services and support our internal colleagues, referred to as ‘Members’, with collaboration tools. Your responsibilities will include diagnosing and troubleshooting service issues, providing support, and ensuring system security to protect our infrastructure. Understanding our internal customers’ business needs is essential to ensure that our services continue to align with their requirements and industry best practices. Your support will extend to managers, supervisors, and agents responsible for the contact centers, as well as all our Members who are utilizing modern meeting room equipment and online collaboration software.
   

  

 Sounds good? Join our dynamic team and help us shape the future of communication and collaboration at DLL!
   

  

 Find out more here about how you can unleash your full potential at DLL
   

  

**Day To Day**
* Proactively collaborate with other IT teams, DLL business teams, and DLL partners.
* Coordinate and resolve requests and incidents, from single user issues to major incidents.
* Continuously improve our (internal) customer service processes, including understanding customer needs, solving problems, and enhancing customer satisfaction.
* Communicate with stakeholders, eliminate/escalate impediments, help manage risk, and drive continuous improvement.
* Manage service providers from an operational perspective, ensuring delivery security and compliance, especially as we are a financial institution.
* Stay up to date with the latest UC&C related Cloud technologies and developments.
* Promote our services and best practices within DLL.


**All members enjoy**
* Two working days per year volunteering for a local charity.
* Health and Wellness program including healthy food, free health checks, fun health & vitality activities.
* Flexible hours with possibility to work from home
* Career development opportunities: online learning, member development programs.
* Click this link for an overview of all the benefits in your region.


 “We not only live up to the expectations of our customers for today, but also anticipate their market needs of tomorrow.”
   

  

**Essentials**
* Associate degree or equivalent experience.
* Minimum of 2 years of experience in telecommunication systems, telephony services and call and/or contact center management.
* Excellent customer service skills and a strong interest in managing customer service processes.
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to drive continuous improvement.
* Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.
* Experience with Microsoft365 and AzureDevops
* Genesys Cloud CX


**Extras**
 Technical and service delivery experience with:
   

  

* Anywhere365


**Experience The Following Areas Are Definite Nice To Haves**
* (PowerShell) automation
* Vendor/partner management (including licensing models).


 Choose wellbeing
   

  

 DLL’s wellbeing ambition is to educate, equip and empower members to build connections, manage their mental, emotional, physical and financial wellness and maintain balance between work and the other priorities that make up their lives.
   

  

**Our Four Wellbeing Categories Are As Follows**
* Connection – Build meaningful connections with other DLL members
* Health – Manage mental, emotional and physical health
* Finance – Provide learning opportunities to help members achieve personal financial health
* Lifestyle – Maintain balance between work and life priorities


 These are the things that matter to our members and the wellbeing of our members matters to DLL
   

  

 Settling in
   

  

 At DLL, we are many things. We are team members, family members, community member. We are members of society, members of different cultures and nationalities. Members of change. We each have different beliefs, different passions, different viewpoints, talents and interests. We come from different backgrounds, cultures, nationalities and histories.
   

  

 But for all of our differences, we share one thing in common: each of us are members of DLL.
   

  

 Our company was founded in the Netherlands. But today we are truly a multinational business. Our unique culture is rooted in higher collaboration, less hierarchy and an honest directness that enable us to integrate, ideate and innovate across country lines.
   

  

 Many companies say they are European, American, Asian or Australian, at DLL we are all these places and more.
   

  

 We are a cross-culture collaborative – an interconnected network – that comes together every single day with one goal in mind:
 **Partnering for a better world.**
**Good To Know**
* Deadline for application: June 30th (Due to high volume of applications this requisition may close prior to posted close date)
* The selection process may involve an assessment.
* Applications via email will not be reviewed. Please apply online via our career website.
* DLL’s referral program applies
* For more information, please contact our Talent acquisition partner Omnia Hassan via omnia.hassan@dllgroup.com


 DLL appreciates the time you spend applying to our openings. We advise only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted. Hiring subject to successful completion of a background check.
   

  

 DLL is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes and work environments. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise Human Resources if you require accommodation in accordance with our values and all applicable legislation.

title: Salesforce Technical Lead
description:
**Job Title: Salesforce Technical Lead (Contract)** 




**Location: Stockholm, Sweden (Hybrid)** 




**Contract Length: 12 months (Contract-to-Hire)** 




**Start Date: 31st March 2025** 




**Rate: DOE** 




  





 My customer in the Financial Services industry is seeking an experienced
 **Salesforce Technical Lead** 
 to join their team on an initial 12 months contract to go permanent. You will play a key role in customizing and developing the Salesforce platform to meet business requirements, ensuring optimal integration with other systems, and working on the early phases of a major implementation project.
 



  





 As part of a cross-functional team, you will collaborate closely with business stakeholders, product owners, and technical leads to drive innovation and efficiency in our Salesforce environment.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Develop and customize the Salesforce platform to align with business needs.
* Optimize Salesforce integrations with external systems using REST/SOAP APIs.
* Work on data modeling to ensure efficient storage and access.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to translate business requirements into technical solutions.
* Participate in strategic technology decisions to ensure scalability and efficiency.



  





**Your Experience:** 



* At least 5+ years of experience in Salesforce platform development.
* Salesforce certifications.
* Strong experience integrating external systems, preferably using REST/SOAP APIs.
* Data modeling expertise for efficient storage and access.
* **Fluent in Swedish (both verbal and written).**



  





**Good to haves:** 



* Experience with Financial Services Cloud (FSC).
* Previous experience in the insurance industry.



  





  





***This is a Contract-to-hire opportunity, transitioning to a permanent role after 12 months.***




  





 Please reach out to
 ***Daniel Indranathan***
 if interested.

title: Data Scientist
description:
**What we are looking for:**
 We are looking for a skilled Data Scientist to join our team and drive real impact for our clients. You’ll work with data from various digital channels, such as online, email, and commerce, to analyze and model information that optimizes customer journeys and boosts digital performance. You’re someone who loves working with complex data, productionalizing systems, and econometric modeling to help brands grow and improve efficiency.
   

  

 Your background in data science and statistics enables you to spot trends, devise strategies, and directly influence client success. In this role, you’ll design predictive models, develop algorithms, and deliver end-to-end solutions. You stay on top of evolving technologies like AI, always exploring new ways to push your work forward.
   

  

 You’ll be joining a supportive environment where collaboration is key. While you bring solid experience, we’re committed to your ongoing professional growth in the ever-changing worlds of data science and digital marketing.
   

  

**What you'll be doing:**
* Take e-commerce problems into solutions using statistical and ML models
* Develop predictive models and machine learning solutions
* Present findings and recommendations to clients and stakeholders
* Remain current with the latest data science and digital marketing trends


**Qualifications:**
* Proven experience as a Data Scientist
* Familiarity with commerce data
* Proficiency in Python, SQL, and machine learning frameworks
* Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills
* Hands-on experience deploying and maintaining containerized production-grade ML workloads in production
* Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud) in a deployment context
* Fluent in Swedish and English, residing in Sweden


****What sets you apart:****
* Documented experience in marketing mix modeling projects, causal inference, and Bayesian statistics.
* Hands-on background in building multi-tenant AI and machine learning systems
* Experience with predictive models in commerce.


*This is a full-time position with a preferred start date during Q2, based in our office at Birger Jarlsgatan 7, Stockholm.*

title: Partner Management Senior Specialist
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**We help the world run better**
 At SAP, we enable you to bring out your best. Our company culture is focused on collaboration and a shared passion to help the world run better. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from.
   

  

 As a Partner Business Manager for SAP Sweden, you are responsible for promoting our entire product portfolio through a team of partners. You are the single point of contact for all sales opportunities that have a partner component, both internally and externally. You are the face of SAP and accountable for building and maintaining the relationship with our partners. This position reports to the Nordic head of Partner and Alliances and will be located in our SAP office in Stockholm.
   

  

 To work directly with the sales team and be responsible for the managing of partner relationships and to drive pipeline and revenue sales, will also be your work duties. Additional important tasks are to create awareness for company products amongst assigned team of partners, coordinate training, consulting and joint development activities and to coordinate effective marketing programs within partner channels. You Plans and executes Go-To-Market activities within the market unit for the holistic SAP Portfolio: Builds & executes on annual operational plans to support revenue targets (stakeholder & portfolio coverage, enablement & alignment with key industries & sales teams, marketing plans on country level, etc.). Investigate and initiate product initiatives and business plans, in order to take advantage of market opportunities, including establishment of new offerings or entering new markets together with the Line of Businesses.
   

  

 You act as an SAP ambassador and represent SAP in industry associations and events. To be successful you are a natural networker and influencer, have previous experience in partner driven sales in a cloud software company, you are a problem solver that love challenges and is a trusted partner to the business. You are a team player, have an “eager to develop” mindset and can easily adapt and navigate in large matrix organizations.
   

  

**Education And Qualifications / Skills And Competencies**
* Degree in Business Administration, Engineering or Computer Science or in related discipline preferred
* Good sales or business development/demand generation experience
* Act strong and secure with senior management executives
* Good understanding of how to create value through partnering and how to successfully execute on alliances.
* Familiar with SAP, its products and solutions, partners, markets and competition.
* Business experience, preferably with a major high technology corporation or strategic consulting firm to forge initiatives and go-to-market plans with partners
* High impact interpersonal, networking, presentation and communication skills
* Excellent knowledge of English and Swedish.


**Work Experience**
* 4+ years working experience in the software industry
* 3+ years in a customer or partner facing role (ex. Customer Service, Sales, Consulting)
* Experience of working in a large matrix organization


**#SAPCSCareers**
**Bring out your best**
 SAP innovations help more than four hundred thousand customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with two hundred million users and more than one hundred thousand employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, you can bring out your best.
   

  

**We win with inclusion**
 SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.
   

  

 SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com
   

  

 For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.
   

  

**EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability**
 Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.
   

  

 Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.
   

  

 Requisition ID: 422278 | Work Area: Sales | Expected Travel: 0 - 10% | Career Status: Professional | Employment Type: Regular Full Time | Additional Locations: .

title: Solution Architect till Handelsbanken
description:
Vi söker en senior arkitekt som vill skapa hållbara och effektiva lösningar för att driva våra företagsinterna verksamheter framåt. Du kommer ha ett brett ansvarsområde inom köpta system, egenutvecklade .Net system samt SaaS-lösningar.
   

  

**Ditt team**
 Som Solution Achitect blir du en nyckelperson i ett samarbete mellan verksamhet och utvecklingsteam där du bidrar med teknisk riktning och lösningar som driver förändring och innovation.
   

  

 Teamet består av 28 medarbetare fördelade på 6 agila team, med ett nära ledarskap från två chefer som stöttar både det dagliga samt det långsiktiga arbetet.
   

  

 Området tillhör Corporate IT & Digitala Workplace - ett strategiskt område som utvecklar och förvaltar flera av bankens viktigaste interna system och tjänster. Vi möjliggör digitala arbetssätt och stärker interna funktioner såsom HR, Procurement och Kommunikation. Det vi skapar har direkt påverkan på vardagen för tusentals medarbetare och chefer i banken.
   

  

**Din roll**
 Som Solution Architect ansvarar du för att omsätta verksamhetens krav till hållbara och skalbara IT-arkitekturer. Du sätter ihop tekniska lösningar baserade på olika typer av applikationer, tex SaaS applikationer, egenutvecklade .Net applikationer och outsourcade funktioner som stödjer verksamhetens processer. Det ingår också att bedriva arkitektur governance i enlighet med Handelsbankens interna regler och policys.
   

  

 Du arbetar nära utvecklingsteam och ledning men också i tvärfunktionella forum på roadmapnivå. Vi jobbar enligt agila principer.
   

  

 Vad som gör rollen spännande
   

  

* Du får bland annat vara med och forma framtidens HR-lösningar hos en global bank
* Du arbetar med många tekniker och komplexa system
* Du har stort mandat att driva och påverka framtagna lösningar och arbetssätt inom vårt ansvarsområde
* Du får inom ramen för vårt ansvar identifiera behov och driva ditt egna arbete
* Du får möjlighet att samarbeta med arkitekter inom andra ansvarsområden i banken


 ,
   

  

**Din profil**
 Vi söker dig som har gedigen erfarenhet av arkitekturarbete i större IT-organisationer och som trivs i en roll där du får kombinera strategiskt tänkande med operativt ansvar. Du har en god teknisk förståelse, förmåga att sätta dig in i verksamhetens behov och kan kommunicera tekniska lösningar på ett pedagogiskt och förtroendeingivande sätt.
   

  

 Du har troligen arbetat som lösningsarkitekt i komplexa miljöer med både egenutvecklade system och molnbaserade tjänster. Erfarenhet av HR-relaterade system är meriterande.
   

  

 För att bli framgångsrik i denna roll ser vi att du har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av lösningsarkitektur i större IT-landskap
* God kunskap om både egenutvecklade system och SaaS-lösningar
* Förståelse för teknik, affärsbehov och långsiktigt förvaltning
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta enligt agila metoder
* Förmåga att leda, förankra och kommunicera tekniska lösningar
* Eftergymnasiel utbildning inom datavetenskap, systemvetenskap eller motsvarande


 Meriterande kunskaper
   

  

* Tidigare erfarenhet av att designa lösningar inom HR-domänen
* Grundläggande kunskap inom AI
* Grundläggande kunskap i dataanalys


**Välkommen med din ansökan!**
**Kontaktuppgifter**
**Rekryterande chef:** 
 Ulrica Hultin, ulrica.hultin@handelsbanken.se
   

  

**Talent Acquisition Partner:** 
 Rebecka Kjellström, rebecka.kjellstrom@handelsbanken.se
   

  

**Facklig representant Finansförbundet:**
 Linus Klevebäck, linus.kleveback@handelsbanken.se
   

  

**Facklig representant Akademikerföreningen:**
 Bjarne Nilsson, bjarne.nilsson@handelsbanken.se

title: Konsult / Interim - Data Scientist - Remote
description:
**Är du konsult / interim och söker nytt uppdrag som Data Scientist? Här får du stora möjligheter att jobba remote!**
 Är du konsult eller interim som är redo för nya uppdrag efter sommaren? Just nu letar vi efter en teknisk Data Scientist eller motsvarande med god kunskap inom bla Power BI, DBT, Python och DataBricks som kan börja här efter sommaren. Du kan jobba helt remote eller komma in till kontoret i Stockholm om du önskar. Uppdrag är på 100% och förväntas pågå under en längre period.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
 Som Data Scientist i detta uppdrag får du en central roll i både utveckling och förvaltning av data- och analyslösningar. Uppdraget är brett och varierande, med många kontaktytor inom organisationen. Du blir en del av ett agilt team och bidrar till att stärka en datadriven kultur genom att leverera tillförlitlig data som stödjer verksamhetens beslut.
   

  

**Det här gör du hos oss**
* Jobba i modern miljö med bl.a. DataBricks och Data Lake
* Kravanalys och lösningsframtagning
* Utveckling av nya funktioner
* Jobba mot stakeholder i organisationen
* Dataintegrationer och dataflöden
* Visualisering med verktyg som Power BI


**Ditt team och arbetsplats**
 Du kliver in i ett teknikdrivet team där struktur och arbetssätt byggs upp från grunden, med en tydlig ambition att etablera en stark enhet inom data och analys. Du arbetar nära både ledning, IT och verksamhet och bidrar aktivt till att forma lösningar och arbetssätt.
   

  

 Du kan jobba helt remote då teamet är utspritt över landet. Det finns möjlighet att komma in till kontoret i Stockholm om man önskar.
   

  

**Mer om dig**
* Stark affärsförståelse och produktorienterat tänkande
* En brinnande nyfikenhet att lära sig, äga, förmedla och utnyttja de berättelser som vår data berättar
* God kommunikativ förmåga, med särskild betoning på att kunna förklara tekniska ämnen för personer med olika nivåer av förståelse och arbeta nära tillsammans med analytiker och data science-kollegor – på engelska
* Ett starkt affärssinne med tydligt fokus på affärsvärde och påverkan för användaren
* Erfarenhet av SQL och ETL-verktyg (Airflow, dbt eller liknande)
* Erfarenhet av SaaS-mått, produktanalys eller intäktsdata
* Erfarenhet av BI-verktyg som Metabase, Tableau, Looker eller Power BI
* Bekantskap med Data Mesh-principer och decentraliserat datansvar


 Vi ser gärna att du är tillgänglig efter sommaren, men om du är tillgänglig längre fram kan det ändå vara aktuellt om det är rätt match. Om inte annat så tar vi gärna emot din ansökan och håller kontakten för framtida uppdrag!
   

  

**Så här får vi kontakt**
 Detta är ett konsultuppdrag där du antingen blir anställd av oss på Ada Digital eller anlitas som underkonsult, beroende på vilken lösning som passar dig bäst. I tillsättningen strävar vi efter att ge dig en transparent, inkluderande och snabbrörlig rekryteringsupplevelse. Och vi vill veta mer om dig och din potential! För att ansöka behöver du inte bifoga några dokument. Skriv istället en kort motivering och bifoga din LinkedIn-profil. Urval kommer sker löpande och uppdraget kan bli tillsatt före sista ansökningsdatum. Är du nyfiken och vill veta mer innan du söker? Hör av dig till ansvarig rekryterare. Vi ser fram emot att få kontakt med dig!

title: SAP Sourcing & Procurement consultant
description:
Do you have a passion for transforming businesses with the newest technologies and making them data-driven companies? Are you looking for a place where you could combine your business consulting skills with technology strategy know-how? Then our roles as SAP Sourcing & Procurement consultant in our SAP Business Group are a perfect find for you!
   

  

 Bring your talent and passion to Accenture and help us deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity. Take this opportunity to develop your skills and build an extraordinary career. You will play a key role in transforming organizations and communities around the world. Let there be change!
   

  

**About Our Nordic SAP Business Group**
 Accenture and SAP have a longstanding relationship that extends more than 40 years. As the leading Nordic and Global SAP transformation partner, we work with SAP end-to-end from product innovation to development and delivery. Together, we are revolutionizing the future of business through major SAP S/4 HANA driven business transformation programs with several of the biggest companies.
   

  

 Within our Nordic SAP community, we work with the newest SAP solutions and offerings such as SAP S/4 HANA Cloud, Ariba, Icertis, SAP BTP and SAP RISE. Our proven delivery methods inclde preconfigured industry template and embrace new capabilities introduced by AI .
   

  

 We are now looking to expand our community at scale and are looking at experienced candidates for several positions and seniority levels.
   

  

 To read more about our SAP Practice, visit us at https://www.accenture.com/us-en/services/sap-index
   

  

**What’s in it for you:**
- Work with some of the biggest SAP clients in large global implementation projects.

- Be an integral part of innovative SAP transformation projects.

- Significant development opportunities and support for progressing in your professional career.

- Rich opportunities to develop your business acumen, consulting toolbox, technical and professional skills.

- Access to comprehensive tools and frameworks supported by our global organization, including implementation methodologies, knowledge databases, industry leading add-on software, expert network and benchmarks.

- A dedicated mentor to guide you during your work with continuous feedback.

- Being part of our culture and core values in a truly human work environment.

- Utilize your functional and technical expertise in SAP, by analyzing, designing, and implementing business processes supported by SAP best practice solutions.

- Utilize your Industry expertise in the field of SAP solutions to deliver client value as a professional individual and as part of a team.

- Take part in our highly engaged and diverse global network, for collaboration and delivery.

- Competitive compensation and benefits.

- Help clients’ sustainability agenda through SAP transformations.

- Be a valuable member of our Nordic SAP Smart Procurement Value Tower and contribute to thought leadership, competence development, and sales initiatives.

**SAP Smart Procurement Nordic Value Tower**
 The sourcing & procurement function is shifting. Traditionally driven and managed by deep and complex processes, their future must become digital, data driven and automated. Helping our clients to succeed in this transformation journey is what we thrive for.
   

  

 SAP Smart Procurement Value Tower is one out of 10 different process specialization communities within our Nordic SAP Business Group.
   

  

 We work hand in hand with our procurement strategy colleagues and our global delivery centers.
   

  

 Our cross-Nordics team designs and configure sourcing & procurement processes in S/4 HANA, Ariba upstream and downstream processes and Fieldglass - and we excel both in large, global S/4 HANA engagements (from smart brownfield through full business transformations) as well as in more focused multi-step process capability deployments.
   

  

**Required Qualifications**
- Min. 3 years of hands-on SAP S/4 HANA sourcing & procurement experience as consultant from at least two S/4HANA projects (preferably in the Nordics)

- Based in Nordics or EU, with either EU citizenship or valid work permit

- Good understanding of sourcing and procurement business processes and their key value drivers

- Eagerness to shape and work in a team-oriented environment

- Motivated, persistent, eager to optimize, drive for excellence

- Passionate about SAP, innovation and delivery of the latest technologies to your clients

- Effectively work with cross-functional teams/stakeholders in an international and fast-moving environment

- Strong analytical skills, result-oriented paired with highly structured working style and good sense of responsibility, flexibility, and team player

- Excellent communication (verbal and written) and presentation skills to address technical and non-technical audiences in English

- Strong will to pursue a problem, identify the source, and propose possible solutions in collaboration with other team members in a timely manner

- A Bachelor or Master’s degree

- We recruit at different levels. For manager level and above, we would like you to have:

- at least 7 years of relevant project experience as well as

- having led a team

- demonstrating leadership skills, and ideally also

- some earlier involvement in the acquisition of new projects (business development).

**Preferred Qualifications**
- Experience of the full S/4 project lifecycle including estimating, planning, and delivering a solution end-to-end

- Nordic (Danish, Norwegian, Swedish or Finnish) language spoken

- An SAP certification in relevant area

- Ariba experience in addition to S/4 HANA configuration

- Deep business & industry experience in one or more industries

**Location**
 Stockholm, Gothenburg, Malmö
   

  

**Does this appeal to you?**
 If so, we really wish to hear from you! (We need people who can challenge conventional wisdom, offer unique perspectives, and contribute with innovative solutions.)
   

  

*If you are interested to learn more about Accenture´s recruitment process, great! We have gathered more info for you* 
*here.*
 Pleasenote that due to the summer season, our hiring process may be slower than usual. We apologize for any delay in responding to your applications. Rest assured, we are committed to reviewing each application thoroughly. We appreciate your patience during this time.

title: Senior Product Marketing Manager - Commercial Acceleration
description:
Are you an experienced product marketer with a passion for driving commercial success through data-driven strategies and cross-functional collaboration? Do you want to help shape how Pleo evolves its pitches, pricing, and product adoption strategies to accelerate growth? Then look no further—we have just the role for you!
   

  

 At Pleo, Product Marketing connects product innovation with commercial success. In this role, you’ll drive impactful strategies that empower teams across Sales, Customer Success, and Marketing, ensuring cohesive messaging and tools that support product acquisition, adoption, retention, and monetisation. This is a prime opportunity to shape Pleo’s approach to commercial execution as we scale and maintain alignment across all customer-facing channels.
   

  

 This role focuses on crafting strategic solutions based on data and customer insights, enabling teams to accelerate Pleo’s growth while maintaining alignment between Marketing, Sales, and Product teams. From building pitches to refining ICP’s and pricing strategies, this position keeps our products relevant, impactful, and scalable in competitive markets.
   

  

**You’ll thrive in this role if you…**
* Have a strong product marketing background, with experience of working closely with Sales, CX, or other commercial teams
* Are highly data-driven, capable of developing strategies informed by pipeline metrics, conversion data, and customer insights
* Bring expertise in sales enablement and cross-channel campaigns
* Know how to create impactful pitches and messaging that resonate across a variety of channels
* Have a proven ability to optimise pricing and product adoption strategies while ensuring messaging aligns with market conditions and customer needs
* Love crafting solutions that scale across product launches, pitches, and marketing content while ensuring all channels are aligned
* Have a deep curiosity about market dynamics, customer behaviour, and ways to continuously improve your approach
* Are collaborative, proactive, and thrive in cross-functional settings


**Things you’ll be doing**
* Actively bridge Product, Sales, Customer Success, and Marketing teams to create cohesive commercial strategies and go-to-market (GTM) plans
* Optimise pitches for products and value bundles across features like sub-wallets, vendor cards, and renewals, ensuring alignment with the market and customer needs
* Analyse customer insights and adoption metrics to refine sales angles, drive pricing optimisation, and fine-tune messaging strategies
* Keep intact a consistent customer experience across all channels
* Work closely with our team of Product Marketing Managers to pull data, insights, and messaging into unified pitches and strategies
* Review data to measure conversion rates, uncover areas for growth, and adapt strategies to pull in the right leads
* Think creatively about campaigns and initiatives which can drive customer value
* Collaborate with sales and product stakeholders to ensure pricing reflects customer needs and optimises monetisation
* Consistently gather customer feedback and competitor data to inform decision-making


**Show me the benefits!**
* Your own Pleo card (no more out-of-pocket spending!)
* Lunch is on us - with catering in our Lisbon, Copenhagen and London offices or a monthly lunch allowance paid directly together with your salary in other markets 🍜
* Private health insurance to ensure you’re fit in body and mind to do your best work
* We offer 25 days of holiday + your public holidays
* For our Product Marketing Team, we offer a hybrid model (two days in the office per week)
* Option to purchase 5 additional days of holiday through a salary sacrifice
* Wellbeing days - fully paid days off designed for a slower pace, allowing you to take time to recharge and prioritise self-care
* We’re trialling MyndUp to give our employees access to free mental health and wellbeing support with great success so far ❤️‍🩹
* Access to LinkedIn Learning - acquire new skills, stay abreast of industry trends and fuel your personal and professional development continuously
* Paid parental leave - we want to make sure that we're supportive of families and help you feel that you don't have to compromise your family due to work 👶
* All of us have a stake in Pleo’s success - ask us about our equity grant scheme


**Why join us?**
 Working at Pleo means you're working on something very exciting: the future of work. Our mission is to help every company go beyond the books. Pleo itself means ‘more than you’d expect’, and it’s been the secret to our success over the last 8 years. So it’s only fitting that we’d pass this philosophy onto our customers to help them make the most of their finances.
   

  

 We think company spending should be delegated to all employees and teams, that it should be as automated as possible, and that it should drive a culture of responsible spending. Finance teams shouldn’t be siloed from the rest of the organisation – they should work in unity with marketing, sales, IT and everyone else.
   

  

 Speaking of working in unity, our values tell the story of how we work at Pleo. We have four core values, the first of which is ‘champion the customer’, which means we address real pain points that businesses face. Next up is ‘succeed as a team’, which highlights how our strength lies in our diversity and trust in each other. We also ‘make it happen’ by taking bold decisions and following through to deliver results. Last but not least, we ‘build to scale’, creating lasting solutions that address today’s challenges and anticipate tomorrow’s needs.
   

  

 So, in a nutshell, that's Pleo. Today we are a 850+ team, from over 100 nations, sitting in our Copenhagen HQ, London, Stockholm, Berlin, Madrid, Montreal and Lisbon offices —and quite a few full-time remotes in 35 other countries! Being HQ'd out of Copenhagen means we're inspired by things like a good work-life balance. If you don't work in the office with us, we'll help you set up the best remote setup possible
 *and* 
 make sure you still have time to connect with your team.
   

  

**About Your Application**
* Please submit your application in English; it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join 💕
* We treat all candidates equally: If you are interested please apply through our application system - any correspondence should come from there! Our lovely support isn't able to pass on any calls/ emails our way - and this makes sure that the candidate experience is smooth and fair to everyone 😊
* We’re on a mission to make everyone feel valued at work. That’s only achievable if our team reflects the diversity of the world around us - and that starts with you, hitting apply, even if you are worried you might not tick all the boxes! We embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply - regardless of race/ethnicity, colour, religion, nationality, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, socio-economic status, culture or beliefs
* When you submit an application we process your personal data as a data processor. Find out more about how your data is used in the FAQs section at the bottom of our jobs page

title: Senior IT Security Officer
description:
**Do you want to work internationally on securing our IT landscape? Both act in projects as our IT Security Officer and in others provide internal Consultancy?**
 IT Security is continuously increasing its importance at Vattenfall. Our highly secured assets spread over different European countries; the fast evolving digitalization; cyber threats and local security regulations makes our work both challenging and interesting.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities**
 You will work in an international team of experts in IT Security. We advise and steer on group policy towards all levels of the organization and external partners. You do this by:
   

  

* identifying, assessing and reporting IT Security risks
* performing security reviews and threat modelling sessions, as well as reporting the findings on a risk-based approach
* developing IT security standards and guidelines
* validating and assessing the risk for certain IT security changes
* ensuring compliance with IT Security standards
* embedding security in IT architectural building blocks and solution designs
* development of IT security architecture and initiating security improvement initiatives
* consulting and guiding the Security Operations teams based on the Cyber Kill Chain Models and Cyber Threat Intelligence.


**Company Description**
 Vattenfall is one of Europe’s largest producers and retailers of electricity and heat. Our main markets are Sweden, Germany, the Netherlands, Denmark, and the UK. The Vattenfall Group has approximately 21 000 employees. We have been electrifying industries, powering homes and transforming life through innovation for more than 100 years.
   

  

**Qualifications**
**We are looking for** 
 an experienced and ambitious person who is not afraid of asking critical questions and that constantly strives for improvement. On top of that you will bring:
   

  

* a Bachelor or Academic degree
* at least five years of experience in a security expert role in an international or corporate environment


**Furthermore Ideally You Bring**
* working knowledge of cybersecurity principles, techniques and technologies
* experience in application security and network security related concepts
* deep understanding on how threat actors operate, execute their kill chain and laterally move within the network.
* experience in the creation of a secure software development lifecycle
* experience in Cloud Security on Microsoft Azure
* good level understanding on how operating systems such as Windows and Linux work and how to implement security hardening
* experience in relevant IT/Information Security legislations in the European countries where Vattenfall operates
* good knowledge of relevant standards, such as ISO27001/2, NIST, CIS
* relevant IT Security certifications are plus. (e.g. CISSP, CSSLP, GWEB, GWAPT)
* other relevant cyber security relevant security certifications are bonus (e.g. CISM, CISA, CRISC, OSCP)


**As a person we are looking for you** 
 who is structured and a good planner. In this position you will work together with a lot of different people and stakeholders, that's why we do value great collaboration skills. We believe you are a trustworthy person who is honest and have integrity.
   

  

 Additional Information
   

  

**Location:**
 You can choose to be based in Stockholm, Amsterdam, Berlin, Hamburg, Katowice or Gliwice. Hybrid working is the norm, so you can combine home office, with visiting your main location and sometimes international travelling to one of the other locations above.
   

  

 We are only considering candidates already working and living close to one of our above-mentioned locations.
   

  

 Hybrid working is the norm, so you can combine home office, with visiting your main location and sometimes international travelling to one of the other locations above.
   

  

**For more information** 
 about the position you are welcome to contact a recruiter Marta Jura via e-mail: marta.jura@vattenfall.com
   

  

**We welcome your application in English.** 
 We kindly request that you do not send applications by any means other than via our website.
   

  

 At Vattenfall we are convinced that diversity contributes to build a more profitable and attractive company and we strive to be a good role model regarding diversity. Vattenfall works actively for all employees to have the same opportunities and rights regardless of gender, ethnicity, age, transgender identity or expression, religion or other belief, disability or sexual orientation. Click here for further information.
   

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**

title: Finance Product Specialist
description:
We are looking for a team-oriented and hands-on Finance Product Specialist to join our Head of CFO Office, located in Hyllie, Malmö. As a Finance Product Specialist, you will be the main responsible for our budget and forecasting application PBCS (Oracle Cloud EPM). You will maintain and develop the system and connected process in collaboration with controlling. In addition, you will also be subject matter expert for finance related applications and associated processes, guidelines, and instructions, including Business central, Coupa, and Twin.
   

  

 You will drive improvements in the Finance area within ERP and integrated systems including associated routines and processes. You will also act as liaison between Finance and IT to agree on user requirement scope, delivery and service levels.
   

  

 In this role you will be a true business partner and an important part of Ikano Bank’s Finance team and our vision to create possibilities for a better living by providing banking and financial services for the many people. We do it with different perspectives, natural curiosity and long-term focus. A unique chance for greater responsibility and future opportunities. Let’s achieve great things together!
   

  

**You will help us simplify finance for the many people**
**Responsibilities**
 You will be a part of our work to simplify finance for the many people and specific responsibilities for the role will include:
   

  

* Drive and implement improvements in PBCS.
* Designing and deploying infrastructure to support the long-term best solution for the system.
* User support in PBCS.
* Manage and execute business related and accounting master data changes in PBCS, the ERP-system and other integrated systems.
* Take part in projects for implementation of new or improved business system and product solutions.
* Ensure that legal or business requirements from Finance are translated into system change requests and to follow up that these are timely processed, effectively met, tested and implemented.
* Identify if changes in any of the Finance related applications effects integrated systems and if needed make sure that such changes in integrated systems are executed simultaneously.
* Ensure that sufficient internal controls are set up in the respective applications to follow Ikano compliance.
* Plan, perform and review tests during changes and upgrades in Finance applications.


 You will also structure and analyze requirements to contribute to the development of long-term system solutions tailored to meet business requirements. As well as plan and conduct training sessions for the related applications within the Finance community.
   

  

**Are you the one for Ikano?**
 We believe that you have good knowledge of and interest in programing PBCS or similar systems. You also have knowledge of finance procedures, practices and principles. Your computer literacy and technical aptitude is strong, as well as your business understanding.
   

  

 As a person you are ambitious, hands-on and down-to-earth with a professional but humble approach. You enjoy analytical challenges, are a quick learner and well structured. You believe in the strength of teamwork and appreciate interacting with a heterogenous group of stakeholders where mutual respect is key. You are engaged and self-driven and enjoy working towards continuous improvement. Furthermore, you have the ability to create good relations and act in various environments.
   

  

 When it comes to background, we believe that you have:
   

  

* Experience from working with PBCS or equivalent.
* At least three years of experience from working within IT development and/or finance or in similar.
* Experience from system management and solution design.
* Experience from project management.
* Experience from ERP-systems, preferable from Business central is considered a merit as well as BI-tools.


**Join us now – together we will find a better way**
 Operating at the center of events, you will have an active role in various forums, represent us to external partners and create a great foundation for further development. This position is more than what meets the eye. You will get the chance to push boundaries and influence your daily work. All as part of a caring and open culture where we live our values, work hard, have fun and operate with a long-term perspective.
   

  

 You will be part of Ikano Bank, where we create possibilities for a better living by providing banking and financial services. We do it with different perspectives, natural curiosity, and long-term focus. A unique chance for greater responsibility and future opportunities. Let’s achieve great things together.
   

  

 The position is full-time permanent and the team is based in Malmö, but there is a possibility of working from our office in Sundbyberg as well.
   

  

 If you have questions, please contact Andreas Svensson - [email protected]
   

  

**About Us**
 Ikano Bank offers simple and fair savings and loan products for consumers, sales support services for retailers, and leasing and factoring solutions for businesses. Ikano Bank has a presence in Sweden, Denmark, Finland, Norway, the UK, Poland, Germany and Austria. Ikano Bank is part of Ikano Group, who is an international group of companies operating in the areas of banking, insurance, production, real estate and retail. At Ikano, our vision is to create possibilities for better living. We do this by working together to create simple and meaningful solutions based on fair terms that bring value to our customers.

title: Line Manager HVDC Simulation Model Design
description:
**Description**


**The opportunity**


The System Performance team in Ludvika, Sweden is looking for a manager to take on the role as the leader to support and develop the individuals, the group, and the team. In this role, you will have the opportunity to lead the team that is responsible for the development and maintenance of digital models for system performance studies. As the Line Manager of HVDC Simulation Model Design, you will have personnel responsibility for a team of approximately 15-20 professionals reporting to you. You will be tasked with ensuring that the team is adequately resourced, developed, and equipped to meet business needs, as well as ensuring that the company's culture and values are reflected in all employee practices and policies. Your primary objective will be to motivate and engage your team and to support them to achieve their full potential, while ensuring compliance with all relevant regulations.

*“We are searching for you who is interested in people and prepared to support and enthuse your coworkers. We believe everything can be improved and it is vital that you have a positive mindset to a learning organization that is continuously improving its knowledge, methods, and skills."* - Hiring Manager Magnus Öhrström.

**How you'll make an impact**

* Building and developing the team and the individuals in it by managing recruitment of new members, employee training and development initiatives, as well as providing strategic direction, leadership, and coordination of the function.
* Contribute to the HVDC System Performance Management team and collaborate with other managers in the organization related to system studies.
* Planning for project staffing and adjusting it according to business needs, as well as planning for both short-term and more strategic long-term changes in the team structure.
* Develop the processes and tools within your team.
* Preparing annual budget and manage within budget and resource constraints.
* Take part of the entire design process from technology development, marketing support & tender work to final design and verification in HVDC projects.

**Your background**

* You have experience from HVDC technology or Simulation Model Design for EMT- and RMS simulation software, and/or previous experience as Line Manager or from another leading role, for example Project Manager.
* Strong communication, social, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build strong relationships with employees and management.
* Fluency in English is required, knowledge of Swedish is a plus.
* A true team player and ability to work in an analytical and structured manner.
* You take responsibility for your work, your coworkers and deliver quality results on time.

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks

**More about us**


If you think the above description sound interesting, we look forward to receiving your application. Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis, so don’t delay – apply today!


Recruiting Manager Magnus Öhrström, magnus.x.ohrstrom@hitachienergy.com will be happy to answer your questions regarding this position. Union representatives - Sveriges Ingenjörer: Mikael Hjort, +46 107-38 29 86; Ledarna: Frank Hollstedt, +46 107-38 70 43; Unionen: Fredrik Holmgren, +46 107-38 21 85.


All other questions should be directed to Talent Partner Tobias Nilsson, tobias.n.nilsson@hitachienergy.com

**Qualified individuals with a disability may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Hitachi Energy career site as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by completing a** **general inquiry form** **on our website. Please include your contact information and specific details about your required accommodation to support you during the job application process.**
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**This is solely for job seekers with disabilities requiring accessibility assistance or an accommodation in the job application process. Messages left for other purposes will not receive a response.**

company_description: Advancing a sustainable energy future for all

title: Planning Engineer
description:
**Join Crane Currency as a Planning Engineer in TUMBA and make a difference where people truly matter.**

**Who we are:**


Crane Currency is a premier industrial technology company and a pioneer in currency manufacturing and advanced micro-optics technology for securing physical products. Yes, chances are you have our product in your wallet right now! Our sophisticated equipment and software leverage proprietary core capabilities with detection and sensing technologies. Around the world, our customers trust us to anticipate their needs with innovative, reliable, and high-quality currency & authentication solutions and services—just as they have for generations. Learn more at www.cranecurrency.com

**How you will make an impact:**


As a Planning Engineer at Crane Currency, you will play a crucial role in enhancing our processes and ensuring high-quality materials are ready for production. You will be responsible for maintaining the production schedule, identifying and mitigating potential issues, and ensuring timely delivery to our customers. Your role involves efficient and stable planning of banknote paper production in Tumba, aligning the requirements of Customers, Management, Factory, and Finance. Both short-term and long-term planning, along with follow-ups, are essential to ensure consistency and efficiency.


In your role you will:

* Be responsible for the factory production planning with a sense of ownership to make sure planning is performed well and information reaches receivers in the agreed way and via the agreed communication tools. Special attention should be directed towards clarity, efficiency and reduced waste.
* Count down of production including making sure relevant communication is forwarded within the company. Make sure count down time is efficient to avoid re-runs and too much overproduction.
* Be the central point of information in the process to plan efficiently, share information with internal and external departments about the current situation.
* Support the Master Planning process and discuss with all related internal parties regarding the Master Planning fulfilment of the Sales plan
* Participate in all parts of the Central Planning process together with the other factories in the group. Co-ordinate and align details with all internal and external departments.
* Understand the requirements of the Bid process to make sure the promises to customers can later be met
* Follow up production results and publish reports daily, weekly and monthly.
* Participate in work to develop tools for planning and countdown to automate the process within Tumba and together with other sites.

**Knowledge and expertise that matter most for this role:**

**Required:**

* Relevant university education in Engineering or Business Administration.
* Experience from Production planning, preferably in a distributed environment.
* Experience working in logistics.
* Documented leadership skills (formal / informal / projects)
* Detail oriented, curious, good with numbers.
* Very good knowledge of Swedish and English, with strong verbal and written communication skills, including presentation abilities
* IT:Good knowledge of Office and ERP.

**Preferred:**

* Education in Planning, Logistics, statistics or the like.
* Knowledge of PowerBI, Excel programming etc.

**Tumba-Benefits**

**How we will care for you:**


We offer top-notch medical benefits including a wellness allowance and reimbursement for medicines and medical care, opportunities for personal development, community engagement activities, competitive compensation, vacation, parental leave, and multiple tiers of retirement plans. Discover more about our benefits here **https://www.cranecurrency.com/careers/benefits/**

**What drives our team:**


We are a passionate team of 1,200 creators and problem solvers, united by our purpose, we give people confidence every day in moments that matter. This comes to life through our Shared Values:

* People Matter
* Do the Right Thing
* Trusted Partner
* Innovate for Growth
* Always Improving

title: Planning Engineer
description:
**Join Crane Currency as a Planning Engineer in TUMBA and make a difference where people truly matter.**
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Who we are:**
---------------


Crane Currency is a premier industrial technology company and a pioneer in currency manufacturing and advanced micro-optics technology for securing physical products. Yes, chances are you have our product in your wallet right now! Our sophisticated equipment and software leverage proprietary core capabilities with detection and sensing technologies. Around the world, our customers trust us to anticipate their needs with innovative, reliable, and high-quality currency & authentication solutions and services—just as they have for generations. Learn more at www.cranecurrency.com

**How you will make an impact:**
--------------------------------


As a Planning Engineer at Crane Currency, you will play a crucial role in enhancing our processes and ensuring high-quality materials are ready for production. You will be responsible for maintaining the production schedule, identifying and mitigating potential issues, and ensuring timely delivery to our customers. Your role involves efficient and stable planning of banknote paper production in Tumba, aligning the requirements of Customers, Management, Factory, and Finance. Both short-term and long-term planning, along with follow-ups, are essential to ensure consistency and efficiency.


In your role you will:

* Be responsible for the factory production planning with a sense of ownership to make sure planning is performed well and information reaches receivers in the agreed way and via the agreed communication tools. Special attention should be directed towards clarity, efficiency and reduced waste.
* Count down of production including making sure relevant communication is forwarded within the company. Make sure count down time is efficient to avoid re-runs and too much overproduction.
* Be the central point of information in the process to plan efficiently, share information with internal and external departments about the current situation.
* Support the Master Planning process and discuss with all related internal parties regarding the Master Planning fulfilment of the Sales plan
* Participate in all parts of the Central Planning process together with the other factories in the group. Co-ordinate and align details with all internal and external departments.
* Understand the requirements of the Bid process to make sure the promises to customers can later be met
* Follow up production results and publish reports daily, weekly and monthly.
* Participate in work to develop tools for planning and countdown to automate the process within Tumba and together with other sites.

**Knowledge and expertise that matter most for this role:**
-----------------------------------------------------------

**Required:**
-------------

* Relevant university education in Engineering or Business Administration.
* Experience from Production planning, preferably in a distributed environment.
* Experience working in logistics.
* Documented leadership skills (formal / informal / projects)
* Detail oriented, curious, good with numbers.
* Very good knowledge of Swedish and English, with strong verbal and written communication skills, including presentation abilities
* IT:Good knowledge of Office and ERP.

**Preferred:**
--------------

* Education in Planning, Logistics, statistics or the like.
* Knowledge of PowerBI, Excel programming etc.

**Tumba-Benefits**
------------------

**How we will care for you:**
-----------------------------


We offer top-notch medical benefits including a wellness allowance and reimbursement for medicines and medical care, opportunities for personal development, community engagement activities, competitive compensation, vacation, parental leave, and multiple tiers of retirement plans. Discover more about our benefits here https://www.cranecurrency.com/careers/benefits/

**What drives our team:**
-------------------------


We are a passionate team of 1,200 creators and problem solvers, united by our purpose, we give people confidence every day in moments that matter. This comes to life through our Shared Values:

* People Matter
* Do the Right Thing
* Trusted Partner
* Innovate for Growth
* Always Improving


Learn more about our values and culture: https://www.cranecurrency.com/careers/life-at-crane-currency/


You can also check us out at: https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Crane-Currency-Reviews-E1187198.htm

**Where we are:**
-----------------


Your role is in Tumba, Stockholm, located in the historic Tumba Bruk area, ten-minute walking distance from the train station, 30 km south of Stockholm, and about 20 minutes from Stockholm Central Station. Check out what makes Tumba a great place to live and work here: https://www.cranecurrency.com/media/12rbruyv/0133-ex55-crane-currency-tumba-sweden-site-location-package-october-2024-lr.pdf
