title: Lead Full Stack Engineer - Internal Tooling (d/m/w)...
description:
Your Benefits:


* Join one of the most driven and innovative SaaS Scaleups.
* As one of the first hires in the internal tooling field, you shape the workflows of a highly innovative ScaleUp from day one.
* Work for a globally established market leader with a presence in Barcelona, Spain and colleagues around the globe.
* Work from the headquarter in Barcelona, or from one of the offices in Madrid, Valencia, Berlin, London; or from home within EU.
* You will have built a first class software system integrating and using tools like HubSpot, Salesforce, BigQuery, Amplitude, Intercom, Zendesk, Stripe, Chargebee, Intercom, Notion, Slack, Discord, Emails, Tinybird, Zapier, Retool and Make.com.
* You have the possibility to move to Spain and work at the headquarter.


Your Responsibilities:  

  

Your key mission is to facilitate the productivity of internal stakeholders - from Customer Support and Sales to Marketing and Finance - by building the tools, automations, and workflows they need to thrive:

  

* You develop full-stack internal tools that boost productivity across the company.
* You create in-house solutions like dashboards, automated workflows, and system connections to support teams throughout the company, from Business Development and Support to Customer Care and Analytics.
* You own your projects end-to-end within productivity engineering.
* You work closely with internal stakeholders to map their workflows, pain points, and tool requirements.
* You design communication workflows that push timely insights and notifications through Slack, Discord, and Email.
* You remove bottlenecks and build tools tailored to the needs of non-technical teams.
* You take on strategic and operational ownership of the development in close collaboration with the CEO and business leads.
* You design internal permissioning, audit, and error-reporting systems for critical flows.
* You create guides so teams can self-serve.


Your Profile:


* Minimum of 8 years of professional experience in full-stack development.
* Minimum of 5 years of professional work experience in the development of internal tools in roles like BizOps, Productivity Developer, or Internal Platform developer.
* Experienced in building MVPs, test them, iterate them end-to-end.
* Expert in REST APIs and third-party integrations.
* Have worked with webhooks and background jobs.
* Proficient in React.
* Experienced in delivering real-time analytics and alerts while building internal dashboards, CRMs, workflow automations, bots, and system integrations.
* Have built tools that talk to CRMs (HubSpot, Salesforce), analytics (BigQuery, Amplitude), ticketing (Intercom, Zendesk), billing (Stripe, Chargebee), or similar.
* Know how to deliver insights in real-time.
* Possess strong business curiosity and are able to make technical decisions guided by business outcomes.
* Enjoy transforming abstract concepts into practical tools.
* Ability to go beyond traditional development by exploring new business domains (finance, sales, BI) to build better solutions.
* Thrive in a remote work setting and ensure visibility across teams.
* Excellent verbal communication skills in English, with experience collaborating cross-functionally with product, marketing, sales, and customer support teams.
* Excellent written communication skills, demonstrated through a clear, concise, and tailored CV no longer than two pages, that highlights your relevant experience and shows why you’re a strong match for this specific role, including your Linkedin and GitHub profile.


Interested? Please apply via our homepage with your current CV to Melissa.


If you have any questions, feel free to reach out via email (melissa@the-formula.de) or WhatsApp (+491712080564).

**We celebrate diversity.**  

That’s why we explicitly welcome all applications - regardless of gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, ethnic or social background, nationality, religion or belief, physical or mental abilities, family status, appearance, or any other characteristic that must not be a factor under applicable law.


We firmly believe that diverse perspectives, experiences, and life journeys enrich teams and lead to better decision-making.

title: Backend Engineer (C++)
description:
Avalanche Studios Group is currently looking for a Backend Engineer (C++) , who will be working on our upcoming AAA title Contraband - a co-op smuggler’s paradise game set in the fictional world of 1970s Bayan. Contraband is a brand-new IP published by Xbox Game Studios.
   

  

 You will work within a team of backend engineers, designing, implementing and scaling a dynamically evolving ecosystem of services for a live service game. In this role, you will design and implement high-performance systems that power our gaming experiences, working with both modern and traditional programming paradigms.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Develop and maintain backend systems and infrastructure using C++ in a gaming environment
* Implement efficient, scalable, and robust code following object-oriented principles
* Apply appropriate design patterns to solve complex programming challenges
* Create and maintain comprehensive unit and integration tests to ensure code quality
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate backend systems with other components
* Optimise code for performance, memory usage, and scalability
* Contribute to technical documentation and code reviews


**Who You Are**
* Strong experience with modern C++ programming (C++11 and C++17 standards)
* Solid understanding of traditional C programming concepts and practices
* Commitment to quality through unit and integration testing
* Experience working in Microsoft Windows environments
* Advanced skills with Visual Studio Professional/Enterprise (2019, 2022)
* Experience with version control systems, particularly Perforce and Git
* Proven ability to work with third-party tools and libraries
* Experience in cross-platform development environments
* Problem-solving skills and attention to detail
* Strong communication and teamwork abilities
* Experience working in an Agile environment


**Nice to Have**
* Experience in PlayFab SDK
* Experience in the gaming industry


*Note: Research shows under-represented groups in the industry (especially women) might not apply to a job if they don’t check off every requirement. At Avalanche, we’re more about your drive to learn and interest in tackling challenges than what’s on your resume! So don’t stress if you don’t tick every box— shoot us your application anyway! Diverse opinions and different experiences are what make our teams so great, not itemized lists of qualifications.*
**The Stockholm location**
 Our Stockholm office is situated in Södermalm, the beating heart of the city’s game industry. It’s a physical representation of our games – the lush vegetation of Just Cause and theHunter: Call of the Wild meets corroded metal straight out of Mad Max. It has everything you need to make it your creative base camp.
   

  

**Our values**
 At Avalanche Studios Group, we create worlds beyond limits. But that’s not exclusive to our games, so we’re committed to developing a diverse and inclusive workplace. All Avalanchers have a shared responsibility to create an open work environment where everyone is treated equally and respectfully. Being part of our world is not contingent on your heritage, your gender, or sexual orientation. It’s all about your passion and creativity.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 To apply for this position, please register below and provide your CV in English. We review applications continuously. All further studio-related information is provided under a non-disclosure agreement.
   

  

*At Avalanche Studios Group we're always on the lookout for talented individuals to join our passionate team, but please note that relocation assistance is not available for this role.*

title: Data Scientist
description:
**Description**
**What We're Looking For:**
 We are looking for a passionate Data Scientist specializing in Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Machine Learning (ML) to contribute to Data Enrichment efforts within Meltwater. As a part of this role, you will work with experienced team members and product managers to design, test, and implement machine learning solutions.
   

  

 Through Meltwater's innovative social listening platform, we ensure our clients never miss any mention of their brand or essential topics across various platforms, automating the entire social listening process.
   

  

 Partner with us and be part of a diverse community that values your unique contributions, empowering you to reach new heights. Join us in crafting something extraordinary.
   

  

**What You’ll Do:**
* Contribute to the development of scalable algorithms for processing large datasets, implement and evaluate machine learning and deep learning algorithms for tasks such as text classification, sentiment analysis, entity recognition, and summarization.
* Assist in the design, development, and testing of ML models for real-time processing of unstructured data.
* Collaborate with senior team members to analyze the impact of algorithm changes.
* Learn and grow under mentorship, gaining exposure to industry-standard NLP tools and techniques.


**What You’ll Bring:**
* Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or a related field, with 2-4 years working experience OR a Master’s Degree in Computer Science or a related field, with 0-2 years working experience.
* Programming Language: Proficiency in Python.
* Solid understanding of data structures and algorithms.
* Proficient in Machine Learning, including understanding Neural Networks and foundational concepts of NLP tasks such as Tokenization, Named Entity Recognition (NER), Sentiment Analysis, Part-of-Speech (POS) Analysis.
* Experience or coursework in Deep Learning frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch.
* Strong problem-solving skills and a curiosity for learning new technologies.
* Good verbal and written communication skills.
* Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., Azure (preferable), AWS, or Google Cloud).
* Basic knowledge of containerization tools like Docker and orchestration platforms like Kubernetes.
* Interest in infrastructure-as-code tools like Terraform.
* Passion for exploring the intersection of NLP and emerging fields such as generative AI or multimodal systems.


**What We Offer:**
* Enjoy 25 days of annual paid time off plus an additional day off on your birthday!
* Gain exclusive access to Avanza Avanza, enhancing your financial opportunities and investment options
* Enjoy automatic enrollment into the comprehensive PlanSjuk Silver and PlanLov, ensuring seamless access to healthcare benefits and financial security.
* Complimentary CalmApp subscription for you and your loved ones, because mental wellness matters.
* Energetic work environment with a hybrid work style, providing the balance you need
* Benefit from our family leave program, which grows with your tenure at Meltwater.
* Thrive within our inclusive community and seize ongoing professional development opportunities to elevate your career.


**Where You'll Work:** 
 Brahegatan 10, 11437 Stockholm
   

  

**Our Story**
 The sky is the limit at Meltwater.
   

  

 At Meltwater, we believe that when you have the right people in the right working environment, great things happen. Our best-in-class technology empowers our 27,000 customers around the world to analyze over a billion pieces of data each day and make better business decisions.
   

  

 Our award-winning culture is our north star and drives everything we do – from striving to create an environment where all employees do their best work, to delivering customer value by continuously innovating our products — and making sure to celebrate our successes and have fun along the way.
   

  

 We’re proud of our diverse team of 2,300+ employees in 50 locations across 25 countries around the world. No matter where you are, you’ll work with people who care about your success and get the support you need to reach your goals.
   

  

 So, in a nutshell, that's Meltwater. We love working here, and we think you will too.
   

  

**Equal Employment Opportunity Statement**
*Meltwater is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: At Meltwater, we are dedicated to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace where every employee feels valued, respected, and empowered. We are committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity and strive to provide a work environment that is free from discrimination and harassment.*
*All employment decisions at Meltwater are made based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, marital status, veteran status, or any other status protected by the applicable laws and regulations.*
*Meltwater does not tolerate discrimination or harassment of any kind, and we actively promote a culture of respect, fairness, and inclusivity. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, experiences, and abilities to apply and join us in our mission to drive innovation and make a positive impact in the world.*

title: Research Engineering Lead
description:
**TL;DR**
 We’re looking for a hands-on research and engineering leader to get the best performance out of commercial and open source frontier models, in order to power the future of AI software engineering. You’ll own experiments end-to-end—from dataset design to model alignment and performance optimization. Must be curious, experimental, and obsessed with squeezing the most out of models.
   

  

**Why Lovable?**
* Change the world, literally: 2025 is the year AI works, and Lovable has the best AI full stack engineer product (according to industry veterans)
* Work, learn, have fun: We’re building the strongest technical team in Europe. You will shape our culture and be inspired in a place of exceptional talent density
* Build a unique network: Lovable is a global top AI brand that the world is eager to work with. You will meet and work with some of the most important people in tech
* Get autonomy & ownership: With lots of things being built, this is a unique opportunity to get ownership and have a true impact on our product
* Compensation: Lovable pays top of market cash and equity, and is committed to compensate better than any other company in Sweden on a performance basis


**What We’re Looking For**
* You’re a natural leader who is obsessed with building the best technical team in the world
* You’re a bold, unconventional thinker who learns at lightning speed
* You love working at the intersection of algorithms, data and machine learning
* You have a deep intuition for what works when training and fine-tuning LLMs
* You understand that synthetic data is the core of making the best AI systems during this decade, and are excited about generating data and increasing quality
* You know how to design high-quality and fast-paced experiments and have strong sense for effective evaluation
* You are relentless in debugging training runs just as much as designing new approaches
* You’ve got a pirate’s mindset: pragmatic, resourceful, and fast-moving


**Your day to day**
 In one sentence: Create the most powerful ensemble of LLMs into lovable products.
   

  

 You will:
   

  

* Identify and update the most important metrics to optimize from a product perspective
* Collaborate with fellow engineering leaders to build a world-class team of brilliant, ambitious people
* Design, run and analyze experiments grounded in real-world coding and product use cases
* Develop and maintain training pipelines, distillation workflows, and synthetic data generating systems
* Work closely with infra and product engineers to scale training efforts and ship results


**Our tech stack** 
 We're pragmatic in picking the tools that make developers move as fast as possible, and have a platform team to support you.
   

  

**How Applying Works**
* Fill in a short form then jump on an initial exploratory call
* Complete a technical take-home exercise
* Dive deeper into your way of thinking over two technical interviews
* Join us for 1-2 days of trial work on-site if possible. We'll see how you tick and you get to meet the team and explore whether joining Lovable feels right for you


**About Your Application**
* Please submit your application in English. It’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join.
* We treat all candidates equally - if you are interested please apply through our application system.

title: .NET-utvecklare
description:
*Vill du ta ägarskap över systemutvecklingen och driva fram innovativa lösningar? Vi söker nu en erfaren .Net-utvecklare till vårt team inom Mina Fordon. Bli en del av vårt framgångsrika team och bidra till vår fortsatta utveckling!*
**Om jobbet**
 Som .Net-utvecklare hos oss på Mina Fordon kommer du att ha en nyckelroll i att utveckla och förbättra våra försäkringssystem inom Motorområdet. Du kommer att arbeta i en agil och modern organisation som följer SAFe-ramverket. Rollen innebär att du kommer att ta ägarskap över systemutvecklingen och med din problemlösningsförmåga driva fram innovativa lösningar. Du kommer att samarbeta nära med ditt team och andra intressenter för att säkerställa att våra system uppfyller höga kvalitetsstandarder och levererar värde till våra kunder. Tjänsten erbjuder en dynamisk arbetsmiljö där du har möjlighet att växa och utvecklas inom företaget.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer vara bland annat:
   

  

* 
* Ansvara för att driva systemutveckling på ett kvalitativt och hållbart sätt.
* 
* Utveckla ny funktionalitet och förbättringsarbete/rättningar i våra system.
* 
* Testa att systemen är rätt utvecklade.
* 
* Vara en aktiv medlem i ett utvecklingsteam och driva utvecklingsarbetet framåt.
* 
* Ta ägarskap över systemutvecklingen och vara med och driva den framåt.
* 
* Hjälpa till med att förstå systemkrav, utveckla koden, testa och göra deploy till servrar.
* 
* Underhålla applikationen efter implementation.


**Vem är du?**
 Följande kommer göra dig framgångsrik i denna tjänst:
   

  

* 
* Akademisk examen inom datavetenskap.
* 
* Minst 5 års relevant arbetslivserfarenhet.
* 
* Erfarenhet av att ha arbetat med Microsoft-tekniker eller motsvarande.
* 
* Behärskar svenska och engelska obehindrat i tal och skrift.
* 
* Beprövad erfarenhet av lösningsdesign och applikationsutveckling.


 Meriterande är även om du har:
   

  

* 
* Certifiering inom SAFe eller tidigare arbete i ett SAFe-tåg eller agilt team.
* 
* Erfarenhet av GIT, CSS, XML, XLST, Azure DevOps, Angular.


 Som person är du en mästare inom utveckling och problemlösning. Du har starkt självledarskap och är en sann lagspelare som kombinerar utmärkt kommunikativ och analytisk förmåga. Du har ett högt engagemang, är drivande och självgående, samt prestigelös och fokuserar på teamets framställning och leverans. Du är kommunikativ, hjälpsam och lyhörd.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Inom SAK IT & Utvecklingsstyrning arbetar vi i en miljö med både anställda medarbetare och konsulter. Vi har olika nationaliteter och ett brett åldersspann. Vårt utvecklingsteam består av olika roller som PO, SME Motor och systemutvecklare. Vi erbjuder möjligheter att växa och utvecklas inom företaget beroende på intresse och kompetens.
   

  

 Affärsenhet SAK inom Länsförsäkringar AB ansvarar för service och utveckling av länsförsäkringsgruppens sakförsäkringsaffär samt för att starta och driva ny affär. Enheten kompletterar länsförsäkringsbolagens erbjudande med specialprodukter för att möta kundens behov och ansvarar även för gemensamma koncept och erbjudanden samt för gemensam kundkommunikation och digital marknadsföring. Affärsenhet Sak ska bidra till att Länsförsäkringar är ledande inom sakförsäkring och bedriver framför allt personrisk-, motor-, transport-, ansvars- och egendomsförsäkring. Enheten hanterar även länsförsäkringsgruppens gemensamma återförsäkringsskydd.
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
*OBS: då vi är inne i semestertider kan återkoppling komma att dröja lite längre än vanligt.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-07-04**

title: Software Architect - Containers / Virtualisation
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in more than 80 countries and very few office based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder led, profitable and growing.
   

  

 We are hiring a
 **software architect** 
 for Canonical LXD and MicroCloud.
   

  

 Our goal is to make clusters of compute, with system containers or virtual machines, "just work". It should be trivial to stand up a small cloud using one, two or twenty servers. This is a challenging exercise in distributed systems, virtualisation, container technology, networking and storage. As with the Ubuntu desktop, our goal is to make it easy and to make it reliable for people to focus on the things that really matter to them rather than the OS and infrastructure.
   

  

 LXD is a modern Golang system container and virtual machine orchestrator widely used on Ubuntu, ChromeOS and other Linux platforms. LXD engineering spans the entire software stack from low-level kernel work on namespaces, confinement, security, filesystems, VMMs and networking, to the high level management REST API and CLI. As a software architect, you will drive the architecture, design and evolution of LXD, and also Canonical MicroCloud which combines LXD with Ceph and OVN to make a lean, easy to use and resilient cluster-scale cloud infrastructure.
   

  

 We are looking for an outstanding software architect and engineer with experience in Golang and C, with the leadership qualities needed to rally a team to ship outstanding products. Knowledge of modern cloud infrastructure offerings, their APIs and their underlying technologies is a must.
   

  

 This is an opportunity for someone who wants to have a meaningful impact on modern cloud computing technologies. Canonical offers a fun, fast-paced team environment and a career full of learning and development.
   

  

***Location***
 : This is a home-based position available in EMEA and the Americas.
   

  

 The role entails
   

  

* Leadership of the LXD and MicroCloud architecture
* Mentor, develop and advise colleagues in their career progression
* Develop in Golang and C
* Review code produced by other engineers
* Ensure the product is secure and performant
* Display technical leadership in Canonical and our communities
* Work from home with global travel twice annually for company events


**What we are looking for in you**
* An exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
* Undergraduate degree in Computer Science or STEM
* Drive, and a track record of going above-and-beyond expectations
* Technical leadership as well as team motivation, direction and pace
* Well-organized, self-starting and able to deliver to schedule
* Professional manner in interacting with colleagues, partners, and community
* Experience with Go and C
* Experience with storage, networking and virtualization
* Experience with container technologies
* Experience with concurrent, distributed systems
* Conscientiousness and detail orientation, with a focus on performance
* Professional written and spoken English
* Experience with Linux (Debian or Ubuntu preferred)
* Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability


**What we offer colleagues**
 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT, and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence; in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since our inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: E2E Software Onboarding Flow Owner
description:
**Join our Team**
**About The Opportunity**
 The Group Process Management team is searching for a new colleague, a key role needed for a highly prioritised area in Ericsson. The Group Process Management team resides within the newly formed Data & AI organisation and is as part of the Ericsson Business Process & Ericsson Group Management system responsible for owning the Business Architecture and Process Management frameworks, setting the foundation for how Ericsson operates in these domains. We are a small team but our impact on Ericsson's ways of working is significant, and we do this while having fun on the job.
   

  

 We are seeking a dynamic and strategic professional to join our team as the E2E Software Onboarding Flow Owner. In this senior role, you will be instrumental in driving Ericsson's AI integration by ensuring our software and IT tool onboarding processes are efficient, effective, and transformative. Your primary focus will be on enhancing the software onboarding process, with particular emphasis on enabling AI application onboarding to better support Ericsson's strategic objectives.
   

  

 As a key player in our team, you'll balance visionary leadership with hands-on involvement, taking ownership of complex onboarding initiatives that require both strategic oversight and meticulous execution. Your ability to navigate between high-level planning and detailed process optimization will be crucial to driving impactful change and achieving our organizational goals.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Manage and optimize the AI software onboarding processes.
* Ensure efficient execution of software onboarding activities and adherence to SLAs.
* Lead initiatives connected to software onboarding (focus on AI applications).
* Drive continuous improvement to streamline processes and enable AI transformation.
* Facilitate discussions and collaboration between stakeholders.
* Establish, monitor and report on key performance indicators (KPIs) for onboarding processes.
* Identify and mitigate risks associated with software onboarding process.
* Collaborate with IT and business units to ensure alignment and integration of onboarding processes.
* Coordinate with vendors and external partners as needed to ensure smooth onboarding.
* Conduct regular audits of onboarding processes to identify areas for improvement.


**The Skills You Bring**
* Several years of proven experience in process management/development within global settings. Preferably several years of experience in optimization of software onboarding processes.
* Strong interest and knowledge in AI, Machine Learning, and Automation, with the ability to apply these concepts to enhance software onboarding processes.
* Ideas for making software onboarding more efficient in AI-driven environments.
* Strong skills in process optimization and continuous improvement.
* Documented results in reducing onboarding time and enhancing transparency.
* Ability to lead cross-functional initiatives.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
* Strategic thinking and problem-solving abilities.
* Experienced in facilitating workshops and fostering collaboration among diverse teams


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

title: MLOps Engineer
description:
**What we are looking for:**
 We’re looking for a skilled MLOps Engineer to join our team and help scale our machine learning infrastructure. You’ll play a key role in designing, deploying, and maintaining end-to-end ML pipelines that power impactful data-driven products. You’re someone who’s passionate about automation, and building systems that are fast, secure, and robust.
   

  

 Your background enables you to bridge the gap between data science and production. In this role, you’ll work closely with cross-functional teams to version, test, deploy, and monitor models that support real-world and multi-tenant applications. You enjoy making things work seamlessly, from model training to serving at scale.
   

  

 You’ll be part of a collaborative, agile team that values clean code, reproducibility, and observability. While you bring a strong foundation in modern MLOps practices, we’re also excited to support your continued learning as the field evolves.
   

  

**What you'll be doing:**
* Collaborate closely and support the team to make model training, development, and monitoring fast, scalable, and cost-efficient.
* Working with infrastructure as code technology to deploy, and manage robust MLOps solutions.
* Proactively suggesting and implementing improvements to our ways of working within and beyond the team.
* Stay up to date with the latest trends and technologies in MLOps, AI, and cloud computing, and drive continuous innovation throughout the organization.


**Qualifications:**
* Hand-on experience building multi-tenant AI and machine learning systems.
* A strong understanding of CI/CD pipelines and automation tools.
* Experience working with Kubernetes to orchestrate scalable, containerized ML workloads.
* Strong experience in cloud platforms (we use AWS) and cloud-native tools.
* Fluent in English, residing in Sweden


*This is a full-time position with a preferred start date during Q2, based in our office at Birger Jarlsgatan 7, Stockholm.*
